38932650.review:
WORTH BUYING!

This game is unexpected good. This game realy got alot of love and you can feel it. This game feels like Diablo 3 should. Great sound, great gameplay and nice story! And overall finaly again a game which try to be diffrent and realy be it! Overall you can say this game is a real jewel in the ARPGs, its unfinished and need some polishing but this game can be as good as Diablo 1/2 was in there best times!

On the card dynamic for the skills i was skeptic, but this got the game was Diablo 3 absolute missed - Possibility to creat your own playstyle. In Diablo was always like, which season is buffed / nerfed and what built you can have to play. Here you can choose your own playstyle and after you finished you start collecting better cards, which realy let you try diffrent playstyles. 
The MOBs are realy interessting new. There are realy kinda diffrent combats than the most ARPGs out there, you not simple smash tones of them, you have to do them in the right why to be faster. Like one type of enemy which you can't smash all the time, because than you healed itself. (Well you cant do anyway but it took ages to kill them). diffrent card combos better attacks, against diffrent enemys.
Another realy interessting aspect is that the MOBs dont have a "level", there are simply have tiers, as more as you kill of a special type of monster as more it upgrades itself and got new skills. This concept is very interessting and i love it much, with this you fight against the same type, but sometimes you think yourself "oh, didn't expect this" on there attacks.

There are 3 (elemental) classes (like in every other ARPG): Knight (start-class), Archer, and Mage.
This seams not alot, but for the state of the game it is more then enought, and i realy can say i seen worst releases on AAA-titles as this 3 works. The classes realy feel diffrent and you want play them all. I hope for more in the future, but i more like a balanced class then a 15th class which is unbalanced you want play it. Thumbs up on the developers for the balancing!

The story is kinda plain. You got 3 bosses and yeah that was it. Therefor this 3 are realy a good challenging and interessting fight (not like in Diablo where you onehit some bosses with that one ring). The bosses are less, but this lack of mainbosses are ok, because the figths realy are interessting and very nice. On the way to them you find alot smaller bosses which you can smash (some of them realy challanging ;) ). I hope realy the Mainbosses will be expended, but i hope too that there will be more good bosses and not like Diablo3 a bunch of Mainbosses you onehit and run forward!

38922488.review:
I really like this game.

It is unashamed and frankly completely transparent about its inspirations, namely Diablo. References to Diablo abound, from the slurry old Sage standing next to the well, to the first boss (which I won't spoil). However, it is its own game with its own merits that merely uses Diablo as a platform from which to launch its own trajectory.

At first, I wasn't sure about the card system. This game isn't really a deck builder, which is how another review presented it to me. Cards are persistent and essentially act as items, equipment, or spells in the same way any drop in Diablo would. The fact that they are cards kind of misrepresented how they work, for me. However, it's part of the pop-up book flavour and really it's just a cosmetic issue. What matters to me is that the way you use them has meaningful gameplay inplications and which ones you choose to equip essentially represents your character build. Some cards have great synergy with others, and it feels good to encounter a pack of enemies that your build is perfectly suited against, and sometimes actually terrifying when you come up against others that seem like perfect counters.

I was initially in danger of not finding the meat of this game, and losing interest early. To begin with, the cards felt kind of inconsequential, as the game seemed quite easy - the enemies were predictable, their behaviours exploitable. Being able to attack anything at range even with a melee weapon felt like I could cheese my way through the whole game. The cards didn't seem to matter too much - my first one gave me a chance to block projectiles, and really that translated to a very small and random advantage against enemies that died in a couple of hits and rarely hit me anyway. However, don't let the slow start fool you. Once the game ramps up its enemy variety, and starts introducing mechanics that change the battlefield, disrupt your mechanics, and more, the magic starts to happen. It doesn't take too long for it to do so.

Level generation is what you'd expect from a Roguelike that borrows from Diablo - you see the occasional familiar piece, but all in all it is a competent and varied system that never lets things get stale. The fact that you have to stick to the path initially worried me that the game would lack depth, but it has clever systems (namely in enemy behaviour) that are built around this which make it work. Discovery is part of the excitement, so I won't warn you what any of them are.

The "Flexiscope" system is wonderful. Essentially the game breaks itself down into chunks and allows you to tell it how large you want the chunk you're about to enter to be, scaling the difficulty and rewards accordingly. If you've got only 15 minutes to spare you can select the small size option and still have a relatively fulfilling run. The system learns from your playstyle and average completion times of each size and builds a more accurate idea of how long it will take you to complete any given size over time. This system is pretty cool as it means you don't necessarily have to set aside an afternoon to properly enjoy this game, as is the case with many RPGs.

To top it off, the game has great ambient audio (which is something the first Diablo absolutely nailed compared to its successors), very competent voice acting, and polished presentation. The previously mentioned pop-up book style kind of rubbed me the wrong way at first, because I wasn't sure it was going to adequately convey the isolation and claustrophobia of being a vulnerable human stepping into a dungeon of evils, but it grew on me. They took a risk with the art direction, and it paid off because of their commitment to it and their undying vision of how it would all come together.

If you like dungeon crawlers and/or Roguelikes, you owe it to yourself to give this a go. It's familiar enough - it has all the elements that you enjoy about those games and many of the staples that the genre demands, which includes the cliches (but in a fun, self-aware way). However, as familiar as it feels, it does everything in its own little nuanced way which gives it some new life in a frankly cluttered genre.

38871858.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Book Of Demons is a fantastic hack and slash dungeon crawler, even for a game that is in early access it has an extremely solid base game that I hope they will build around and continue to expand upon as they move out of the early access stage of their game.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
So where to even begin with this game... Well let's start of with how the game works and what makes this game just so damn good. To start off with the game has a option before you even begin the game for you to decide how long you want the dungeon to go on for until you reach the end of that section. This sort of mechanic isn't usually shown in many games nowadays, and it really helps with those people who don't have too much time on their hands to play hours upon hours of games everyday. You only want to play for 5 minutes? We've got you covered! Want to go for an hour long play through? No problem, the game is very nice for giving you this option as it provides the player with a reasonable playtime if you're short on time and only want to play through part of a dungeon for a couple of minutes.

As well as this useful mechanic, the game also provides a deck building mechanic that aid you upon your quest. Even though there isn't much depth to the deck building side of the game, it provide a variety of different play styles, so being able to mix and match cards will be up to your own personal preference. There are 3 different types of cards, artifact cards, item cards and spell cards. Artifact cards are basically passive cards and the ones that I used throughout the entire game, there is a nice variety of these cards, as well as legendary and magical types of each card. Some of them will allow you to cause enemies to slow, whilst others will give you a chance to stun enemies, and even regenerate health. Items cards are basically consumables, healing potions, town portal, toxic bombs etc. and the final one being mana cards, which are spell cards. I personally never used these cards, and never really felt like I needed to.

Now, something that I was slightly concerned about was the way that your character could only move on the set path that is built in the dungeon. I mean why would you need your character to only be able to walk across a one block path? For me this kind of limited the way I could play the game, but didn't make ruin the enjoyment of the game for me. I would've liked maybe a bit more freedom to move around on these set paths, maybe make it 2 or 3 blocks wide so I can move around a bit more. I suppose that the game was designed like this with a purpose to make it more challenging, but for me it didn't really hit the mark. It's a small thing, but something that I think would make me want to play the game more.

Speaking of dungeons, the game provides procedurally generated dungeons each time that you choose a length time to play through. I really enjoyed this aspect of the game, as this keeps the game fresh and allows for a nice amount of replay ability once you have completed the main storyline of the game. However, I feel like it was slightly lacking a variety of different 'tiles' that are used to piece together each dungeon. I would of like to see a bit more variety with these 'tiles' just to make the dungeons seem different from one another.

So does the game provide a nice amount of enemy types that co-inside with the randomly generated dungeons in the game? Yes it does, there is wide variety of enemies that you will encounter at different part of the game, all of them having different fighting styles whether they shoot projectiles at you, or run at you knocking you out for a few seconds, every enemy feels well thought out and put together. You will find different enemies in all 3 different areas, from demons to ghosts to goat things each area has it's own arrangement of enemies that you will have to adjust your play style to in order to effectively kill them.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Needless to say, the graphics in this game are extremely unique and something that I personally haven't seen much of when it comes to gaming. It's kind of like a pop-up book world, but combines it with dark dungeons that really seems to fit the game and the atmosphere in general. All the characters and enemies look very nice, and it's all very consistent throughout the game.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Choose the length of each dungeon, from a 5 minute run to an hour run. Very useful for people who don't have too much time to play games for hours upon hours.
+ Even though the deck building isn't very in-depth, it does provide a different play style being able to mix and match different types of cards to suit your play style.
+ Procedurally generated dungeons makes the game have better replay value.
+ Nice variety of enemies throughout the game, most enemies are contained in one of the three dungeon areas.
+ Very unique graphics that isn't really used much in gaming nowadays, works well with the game itself
+ Good length storyline, 12 - 15 hours of gameplay + freeplay mode for more of a challenge.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Only being able to walk on the set path that is provided, kind of limits where you can go but for me didn't ruin the enjoyment of the game all that much.

[h1]Result / Final Thoughts[/h1]
Overall this game is extremely well built and put together, even though it's still in early access. The game provides a nice length main storyline (will last about 12 - 15 hours) as well a free play afterwards so you can continue going through these dungeons. I for one am very excited to see where this game goes next, and can't for more game modes, and more storyline (maybe) as the game continues to get updated. Would defiantly recommend this game to any fans who enjoy a good dungeon crawler.

38847958.review:
这是一款用卡牌包装起来的砍杀类RPG游戏

传统RPG所需要的技能 和 装备体系 用卡牌的外壳包装了起来。

角色的血量和蓝量单独成长，主动卡牌相当于主动技能，被动卡牌相当于装备和被动技能，还有分别对应的加血加蓝卡牌相当血瓶和蓝瓶

卡牌的制约在于卡牌栏位数量，和 共同占用的蓝量池子。被动技能占用蓝量，相当于主动技能消耗的蓝量池子减少

卡牌可以升级，材料是对应的符文卡牌，相当于传统RPG里五花八门的材料，升级后效果和消耗都会增加

单人的体验不错，但是加入多人模式可能会更好，可以有配合，甚至是对抗

另外，这款游戏的美术风格相当独特，值得借鉴和参考

38703956.review:
[b]ARPG兼卡牌遊戲[/b]

[h1]劇情6/10[/h1]
[spoiler]故事發生在一個被惡魔入侵的小鎮，在這動盪不安的情況下，鎮上的人不是自殺就是被惡魔逼瘋，而勇士的到來必須拯救這一切。
整個遊戲具有濃厚暗黑破壞神的味道，所以處處可見其蹤跡，甚至其中一個魔王也叫做屠夫。
但是打敗最終魔王後出現了亮點，「惡魔被消滅了? 還是他依然存在?」，勇士被魔王附身，替遊戲日後的劇情埋下伏筆。[/spoiler]

[h1]畫面8/10[/h1]
剪紙繪畫風格令我相當驚艷(至少我目前沒看過)，搭配顏色深淺為畫面整體氣氛做出不同的變化。
在遊戲特效的部分也做得很精細，陶罐被打破時碎裂的動畫、怪物施法的動畫、人物被凍結的畫面花邊...等。

[h1]音樂6/10[/h1]
遊戲中的配樂很到位，頗有史詩戰鬥的感覺。
音效的部分也很精細，怪物爆炸、凍結、著火...等音效都不馬虎。

[h1]操作6/10[/h1]
人物可以透過滑鼠或是方向鍵移動，而施放技能可以利用鍵盤上的快捷鍵。

遊戲中比較獨特的是移動方式，人物只能在規畫好的道路上行走，能避免玩家走一走迷路，或是導致地圖大時繞不出去。
通常利用滑鼠來控制角色，點擊角色前方可以使其往前，而要讓角色停下則左鍵點擊角色或是角色後方又或是按下Shift，如果要攻擊敵人，可以連續左鍵點擊敵人或是按住左鍵連續攻擊，看似簡單的描述，在遊戲中卻時常因為激烈戰鬥以及遊戲設定而措手不及，熟練這些技巧會在遊玩時更得心應手，例如: 有些敵人只能透過拉打，這時候角色的移動方式就是一門技巧，時常因為操作不順，而遊戲設計卻會使角色突然停下而導致死亡或被怪物擋住動彈不得。

對於這款遊戲，玩家對滑鼠的控制能力會是一門學問(我很常手忙腳亂...)。

[h1]遊戲性7/10[/h1]
遊戲一共有三個職業，分別為戰士、盜賊、法師，每個職業都有不同的能力和玩法。
富含濃厚的暗黑破壞神風格，因此遊戲內容也正是進入地下城副本冒險，不管是怪物的特性或技能都可以看到暗黑破壞神的影子，但是因為獨特的玩法及操作方式，所以並不會厭倦這些細節。

角色的戰鬥方式變化很多，最開始的怪物可以靠瘋狂的攻擊來擊敗，而後來的怪物必須控制攻擊的節奏，有些必須拉打、有些只能讓角色自動攻擊；其中有盾牌能力的怪物，必須先點擊打破敵人身上的盾牌後，攻擊才會生效，然而盾牌出現的位置也不一樣，因此必須眼明手快擊倒敵人。而有些怪物只要連打四次就會免疫傷害，並會恢復血量以及施放獨特技能，此時就必須要依靠拉打來解決。

中斷敵人施法也是使戰鬥勝利的關鍵，怪物在施放技能時會免疫任何傷害，同時頭上會出現正在施放的技能圖示，在技能跑完前，利用左鍵按住技能圖示即可中斷施法，這個技巧在面臨混戰時更是重要(例如: 混戰時沒有中斷衝鋒技能而被撞暈、沒有中斷瞬移技能導致敵人脫逃或召喚出難纏的小怪)。

除了以上的戰鬥技巧，本作的核心就是卡牌系統，其中有四種不同性質的卡片: 道具卡、法術卡、神器卡、特殊卡。
正如同字面上的意思，道具卡可以是補血藥水、補魔藥水、免疫藥水、炸彈、傳送門...等消耗品；法術卡有攻擊技能、防禦技能、回復技能...等主動技能；神器卡有強化攻擊、強化防禦、免疫屬性、反射攻擊...等被動技能；而特殊卡則是可以用來升級另外三種卡片能力的素材。
作者在創建角色畫面有提到每種職業最具代表性的卡片，但是每種卡片都可以搭配出自己獨特的玩法，等著玩家去發掘。

另外本作有許多相當貼心的設計，例如玩家可以自行決定要遊玩多久，自訂副本大小，並且在多次遊玩後會讓系統判定得更精準；副本中走過路，在地面上會出現腳印，一般的腳印代表還有路沒走完，金色的腳印代表全部角落都走過了，讓玩家不會浪費時間走相同的路；遊戲中也會提示該地圖還有多少物品沒有取得，而未取得的物品如果超出螢幕範圍，也會在畫面邊框顯示該物品的方位。

遊戲還有一個特別的系統是魔法鍋爐，再升級時可以選擇增加生命或是增加魔力。當選擇增加生命時，會有一個魔力點數被丟進鍋爐，而當選擇提升魔力時，也會有一個生命點數被丟進鍋爐，副本中獲得的額外獎勵也會丟進鍋爐。玩家可以隨時花費金幣去收集鍋爐內的物品，但是每收集一次，下一次花費就會大幅增加；但是當角色死亡時，鍋爐內的額外獎勵也會一併消失(生命點數和魔力點數不會消失)，而這就要靠玩家決定是否要再撐一下，還是要立刻收集了。

目前這款遊戲還是搶先體驗，內容還不多但是遊戲很合我的胃口，而我也認為日後的改版非常值得期待。

[h1]整體6/10[/h1]
遊戲的劇情較樸實，但是角色對話幽默，在最後埋下的伏筆能讓之後新的劇情有更多發展的空間。
獨特的畫風深得我心。
現在越來越多獨立遊戲朝向「動作兼卡牌」類型發展(例如: Hand of Fate)，當相同類型的遊戲漸漸變多，能吸引到玩家的創意玩法就顯得格外重要，而我認為這款遊戲確實吸引到我。

卡牌系統的通病就是「死板的卡片組合」，當卡片越出越多，如果只在乎創意卻沒有注意平衡性與實用性，那玩家就只會去發掘所謂「最強的牌組」，這會讓一款卡牌遊戲喪失樂趣，因此作者必須更用心構思之後的設計。

花了12小時把目前的劇情破完，本作很有暗黑破壞神的感覺，卻擁有自己的創意，但這也可能是面對一款新遊戲的錯覺，期待日後的遊戲內容能越來越豐富。

[h1]優點[/h1]
-特別的剪紙風格
-ARPG兼卡牌很特別
-濃厚暗黑破壞神的味道卻有自己的創意
-遊戲提醒非常貼心
-在社群有網友的中文化翻譯

[h1]缺點[/h1]
-搶先體驗劇情稍短
-有時小區域怪物太密集(但可能是設計本意)
-卡片種類可以再更多一點

--------------------------------------------
[h1]休閒玩家[/h1]
[b]操作簡單又可以自行決定遊玩時間，非常適合想輕鬆玩的人嘗試。[/b]

[h1]專業玩家[/h1]
[b]遊戲有獨特的樂趣，但還能更豐富，我認為專業玩家值得一試。[/b]


[b]支持他們的想法，所以我買了贊助包，期待之後的消息。[/b]

38666847.review:
Disons le sans détour, ce jeu est le meilleur auquel j'ai pu jouer depuis des années. Il me rappelle la découverte de Diablo 2 et comme pour Diablo 2 il fourmille de bonnes idées jamais rencontrées auparavant.

Vous incarnerez donc un des 3 personnages disponibles, guerrier, archère ou mage, et évoluerez dans les profondeurs d'une chapelle profanée par l'incarnation du mal, le diable, qui lui se situe dans les entrailles de l'église, tout au fond dans les lymbes.
Après avoir peu à peu débloqué les différents mécanismes du jeu qui seront amenés sous forme d'un tutoriel très bien fait, vous pourrez choisir la durée de votre traversée dans les profondeurs, soit un jeu très court (2 étages), moins court (4/5 étages) et ainsi de suite, cela vous permettant de faire de courtes sessions.

A chaque fois vous aurez l'opportunité de retourner en ville, soit entre 2 étages, soit via un town portal, et ainsi rencontrer les 4 PNJ résidant en ville, chacun ayant une fonction (guérisseur, tavernier...)

Il serait trop long de faire ici un inventaire de toutes les nouvelles idées présentes dans le jeu, mais citons en 2 essentielles:

- tout d'abord, le jeu est en vue isométrique, c'est à dire avec une vue un peu de dessus, cela donnant une fausse 3D, mais ceci n'est pas un hasard, car en effet, votre personnage se déplace en suivant une route en ligne droite, avec quelques intersections ça et là. Vos mouvements sont donc réduits, se limitant à avancer ou reculer, et c'est là que vient tout l'enjeu, car plus les ennemis se massent et plus vous devrez vite faire des choix, vos mouvements étant très limités, et ainsi absolument éviter l'encerclement.

-Pour vous aider dans votre périple, vous trouverez dans les donjons des cartes qui viendront s'empiler dans un livre, et vous choisirez ainsi telle carte à placer dans votre inventaire qui est au départ réduit mais que vous pourrez agrandir moyennant finances en ville, ces cartes vous procurant des capacités ainsi que de l'équipement.
En parcourant les donjons vous trouverez également des runes qui vous permettront d'améliorer vos cartes en allant voir la cartomancienne en ville, moyennant encore une fois finances.

Les cartes de sort coûteront de la mana tandis que les cartes d'équipement ponctionneront une partie de votre mana, il faudra donc faire des choix sous peine d'être à court de mana et de ne plus pouvoir que faire des attaques de base.

En montant de niveau vous pourrez choisir entre ajouter 1 point de vie ou de mana, et selon votre choix, la vie ou mana non utilisée ira dans un chaudron, auquel s'ajouteront certaines trouvailles non identifiées. Vous pourrez alors retourner en ville afin de prendre le contenu du chaudron, mais attention, plus vous utiliserez le chaudron plus son coût augmentera, et surtout si vous mourrez, vous perrez toutes les récompenses du chaudron (excepté les points de vie/mana).
Cela ajoute donc un choix stratégique, dois je attendre ou prendre le chaudron, au risque de perdre une partie ou de voir son coût augmenter trop vite...?

Voilà, ce jeu est actuellement en version anticipée, je n'ai rencontré aucun bug pour le moment, et je le répète, ce jeu est une perle, avec un bestiaire impressionnant, des sous-boss et boss à foison, bref, un chef d'oeuvre en vue, et pour couronner le tout un studio qui vous demandera vraiment de participer si vous le souhaitez à l'élaboration du jeu.

Book of Demons is a game that combines classic Diablo-style dungeon crawling with Clicker-style combat supplemented by a clever deck-building system. Instead of your typical loot like swords and helmets, your rewards for besting the baddies could be a shiny new Legendary Artifact card to add to your arsenal. 38577367.review:
This game seems simple at first, but it really pulls you in. It got that Diablo addiction as you go down deeper (exactly like Diablo 1 actually) . They  added all 3 classes at the time of this review, making this game immensely replayable . Love how you can select what size dungeon to generate based on your time available . This is perfect for quick short bursts, i have been playing this in 15min stints resulting in me increasing my dungeon sizes as i get more hooked. For a game in early access it is very stable and seems feature complete (i did not notice anything missing or broken).

Pros:
The graphics are a rather unique cardboard cutout design which does the job. This definitely seems to make the game perform extremely well (can most likely play this on a tablet). Some might not like this if you are coming straight out of say Grim Dawn / Diablo 3 / Wolcen , but give it a few dungeon runs, it grows on you.

The card based skill system combined with how you upgrade cards and have to manage your mana pool to equip them is very satisfying to play around with. Love how you have to constantly weigh up between more passive skills vs. active skills etc.

The game is definitely taking its inspiration from Diablo 1, and there's a ton of throwbacks and humour around this. The game does innovate quite a bit in the actual combat which can be both good or bad. I like that there's various mechanics that you need to take note of with different enemies , like enemies being immune until you do something specific (i.e. killing their guardians first or  destroying their shields first by clicking on a specific shield icon etc) or being able to reduce poison time by clicking on your poisoned health bowl. Even getting stunned has a little mechanic to it allowing you to get out of it faster if you are swift with the mouse.


Cons:
It can get a little chaotic with the clicking when there's alot of enemies and you need to click precisely on specific icons (i.e. to break shields you have to click on the actual enemy shield which is often a tiny thing to click).  Luckily there's skill cards that make this easier.

The game is still in early access and they juuust released the final 2 classes. I started with only the warrior class available which would have been a con, but no longer.

38546990.review:
This is a game that comes from the mind of a mobile developer. One of its selling points is the option to have a short play session—an issue that often is crucial for mobile, but hardly relevant for a PC gamer. The control scheme also feels like it was made for a touch screen. There are many mini-games that boil down to grabbing things floating on the screen. To heal poison, you have to click the bottom left with your cursor, even though normally you keep it to the center of the screen—an idea that would be handy of the game was controlled with your fingers via a mobile device, but doesn't translate well to PC.

A lot of its other elements feel clunky as well. While you can instantly teleport to the end of a dungeon when it's 100% clear, looking for that one pesky pile of gold you've missed means backtracking—excruciatngly slow backtracking. And pray that your final enemy isn't a gargoyle or a ghost: both can hide and must attack first... or ignore you, making you run past them a dozen times, groaning.

As for the presentation, I'm pretty sure that Deckard Cain voice is borderline copyright infringement. [i]Book of Demons[/i] also borrows heavily from [i]Darkest Dungeon[/i] with its combination of stylized visuals and gritty narration.

Does it all mean that the game is bad? No. It's all right. The treadmill does its job, injecting you with satisfaction via a steady stream of achievements and other small rewards. The idea of a small-budget simple Diablo-like is laudable, and you get enough fun for the price.

I do, however, feel that the 'Overwhelmingly positive' rating gives the wrong impression of [i]Book of Demons[/i] being some sort of a hidden gem.

It's not. It's just all right.

38439616.review: I was surprised to find after finding it on my steam que I was debating whether to get the game, a ARPG which I liked the papercraft aesthetic and the interesting level and equipment system but was almost immediately put off by the combat system, a good core combat loop is essential for me to enjoys these types of games and the clicking style didn’t appeal to me, but after reading the reviews someone pointed out that there was indeed a demo and you had to experience this game to understand why it was so good. 38360114.review:
After 5 hours of playing the game (on a single day) I can say, that it was really worth it for 13 Euros. The game is a tribute to Diablo 1, one of my favourite RPGs.


Nice atmoshpere, it resembles that of D1 quite good, although in a very different graphics design. It is a little cartoony, but I like that as well. The music fits the game, it is perhaps not so epic, as in the Diablo games, but well enough.

The loot system is based on cards, but they are in fact potions, different pieces of gear (shields, axes, amulets etc.), or your spells and skills. What I really like is that you don't have to click on gold, you move the pointer over it, and you pick it up. (Believe me, you will have to click enough times to kill the monsters).

There are click slots for potions, skills as well, and as a quite good solution imo, you have to put your gear in the slots as well, and for each piece of gear, several of your mana points are blocked/reserved, so you have to balance that as well.

There are boss fights on every level, and every boss has more stages, cast different spells, summon minions, etc, so it won't get boring. There are 3 main bosses in the game as far as I can tell (I only killed one).

Although the game is in early access stage, I did not encounter a single bug, yet.

All in all it is a really nice hack and slash game with a little twist in the graphics and the looting/skill system as well, definitely worth checking it out.

38308838.review:
I'd call this a funish game but a crappy homage to Diablo series.  If this wasn't an homage to diablo, I'd recommend it, but I can't recommend something that calls this an homage to diablo.  

The combat in this game feels like something you'd see in a web app game.  Everything is streamlined and has basically been turned into an on-rails version of Diablo.  

The enemies start out interesting, but quickly become boring once you realize they're just recycling the enemies from the first act over and over again with new skins.  

Everything in this game is as procedurally generated as humanly possible.  Even the bosses seem to be procedurally generated.  As in their names are pieced together from a pool of boss-like names.  Thus you end up with really wonky names like "The Wizard Defiler"

As an homage to the Diablo series, this game is even worse.  Diablo was most famous for its amazingly creepy atmosphere and what does this game do?  It copies just enough that you can tell they're referencing Diablo, but make all the characters cartoonish.  Every character interaction starts by describing things in a creepy light, but end the dialog in a cartoonish fashion completely ruining the mood.  

In Diablo 1, the most famous boss was "The Butcher" whose famous for the line "Ah. Fresh Meat" who comes out of a room filled with gore and is almost guaranteed to WRECK the player.  In Book of Demons the butcher is a french chef who says lines like "I forgot I left the stove on."  And he's actually a pretty easy boss.

The system that makes card inactive is stupid, having to click on those to reactrivate them is evn more stupid. Movement limitation makes combats unbearable, unfun and too long and ultimately you die because you've run out of pots and no way to escape and go back to town... I've played hard ARPG's that insta kill me and i know why i'm dead, this game is just unfun and badly designed !!!

38245766.review: Book of Demons is a great hack n' slash dungeon crawler with its own unique playstyle.  Still in Early Access, this game promises to be a keeper in my collection for years to come; especially as the devs continue to add content.  As I disklike the restriction of movement along preset pathways and not being able to go all crazy around the screen, it does have a fluidity in its pace to please the restrictee.  You end up a little click happy, similar to other hack n' slashes but there is a completely new strategy in place here with the card system.  It has the typical grind to it, but this doesn't draw too much away from the fun of diving deep into the dungeons in search for treasure or rare cards.  Hard to put down once you start and the humor throughout is refreshing.  If you like games that integrate card mechanics or hack n' slash dungeon crawlers, this should help derail you from some of the monotony you'd typically find and branch out a little.

38080899.review:
Book of Demons находится в раннем доступе, но это один из тех случаев, когда перед игроком уже фактически готовая игра, требующая небольших косметических вмешательств. Соответственно, сам обзор будет выдержан в духе мнения о полноценной игре, а не сырой демке.



Честно говоря уже с самого запуска игры я немного впал в ступор. В главном меню несколько пьедесталов, но одном из них заветная книга с названием игры — Book of Demons. Для чего остальные пока пустующие постаменты? Видимо для следующих игр разработчиков. Кстати, позиционируют они свою задумку так — это будет ретроспектива старых добрых игр в современной обложке. Книга демонов лишь первый шаг.

Говорить об успехе рановато. Не смотря на то, что игра выглядит очень занятно, погружаться в неё с головой не выходит. Лор слабоват. Экран перед спуском в подземелье представляет собой кусочек поселения. Из домов вышли граждане и взывают к нам о помощи. Каждый из них не только поведает историю, познакомит с механикой игры, но и окажет услугу. Все эти услуги естественно завязаны на прокачке героя, так что кусочек поселения — условный хаб, где можно перекантоваться, прокачать карточки и разжиться новеньким добром.



После каждого захода под землю мы будем возвращаться сюда. Делать это, конечно, не обязательно, можно попытаться пройти весь путь к центру земли без вылазок, но, думаю, шансы на это крайне малы. Наконец, поговорим о самих подземельях. Вся изюминка игры завязаны на них и их покорении.

Движения осуществляются по рельсам. То есть бумажный герой (в игре все выполнено в бумажном стиле) в минималистично анимированном стиле — прыжками — передвигается по заранее проторенным дорожкам. Врагов он сечет, допустим, мечом, но может это делать не сходя с пути. При старте уже есть небольшая область, до границы которой мы можем дотянуться до противников. Совершенствуя героя, мы можем расширить область. Так что орудуя мышкой в пределах экрана мы будем убивать врагов и собирать лут.



Со временем враги становятся сложнее и обретают некоторые свойства, который будут требовать чуть больших усилий, чем просто направить мышку на супостата. Иногда потребуется проломить щиты, или сбить заклинание, иногда жизни врагов будут относиться к той или иной стихии. Это заметно скажется на уроне, который игрок сможет нанести. Для того, чтобы уничтожение врагов не превращалось в ковыряние кита палкой в Book of Demons придумана система карточек.

Карточки делятся на пассивные и активные, на оружие, броню и заклинания. Цель игрока собрать для себя подходящий билд, прокачать его и протиснуться через толпы врагов к главному боссу. Вот в этом вся суть. Чем ниже погружаемся, тем больше и сильнее будут враги. Для удобства покорения подземелий разработана шкала глубины. Игрок выбирает подходящий диапазон времени, то есть сколько он хочет примерно убить времени на подземелье и в путь. Я не сумел добраться до самого конца, но прошел три четверти пути. Думаю, ничего принципиально нового ближе к финалу не появится. Кроме того сама механика Book of Demons построена так, что если вы погибли, то начинайте заново. Предыдущий заход фиксируется как ваш рекорд и так снова и снова. Рогалик, сэр.

https://youtu.be/0T_3ezRnC_w

Book of Demons напоминает одну известную присказку, когда делают массаж про рельсы и шпалы. Вначале все выглядит вполне логичным и обоснованным, а потом все заканчивается нелепым требованием что-то купить. Тут, конечно, проще. Иди себе убивай врагов - сам не умирай.

Кураторство - http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5763270/

38039088.review: So far I am enjoying this game. It is easy to learn how to play and you can set the size of the dungeon you want to play. This helps if you don't have a lot of time to play. Nothing bad to say about the game so far. It reminds me a lot of Diablo 1.

38030622.review:
This is a gem, masterpiece for any player that ever played and liked Diablo 1 (yes, that old one). If you ever played it and liked it - be sure - you will like this game. If you haven't - try the free demo first (available in steam)
This is kind of a parody/remake of Diablo 1 in a developer's very own and original style. The difference - you now use cards instead of items, the movement and the game itself is simplified - but that doesn't make it worse.
To my taste it lacks a bit of content - you will become bored eventually, but for me it was when I played 18 hours - which is more than enough for a good game. But this is yet Early Access!
Futhermore developers seem to want to create more games like that, parodies on popular old tittles. Looking very much forward!

Anyway, this is one of the best games I played this year.

37661236.review:
The weird thing about Book of Demons is that I don't find Diablo 1 particularly compelling (LOVE 2 and 3), but is this game ever fun. It seems to be a whole pile of concepts - Diablo 1, but its papercraft, and also all your items and skills are cards, and you're also a particularly human shaped train. And I love almost every single thing about it.

The only thing I dislike is the movement system. The procedural dungeons are a series of smallish rooms, which really works well, but you only travel through them on what is effectively a small network of rails. And that gives me a headache, especially when I start going down a long straight corridor with a dozen archers at the end and all I can do is slowly eat 50 arrows as I laboriously make my way to them.

On the other hand, Plexiscope, a system that lets you choose the length of your playsession down to within a few minutes, is absolutely brilliant and now I want it in all my ARPGs and rougelikes.

Book of Demons is great, you should try it. It even has a demo so +10000 points for that.

[list]

On the downside, there are only two playable classes (another is in the pipeline soon), it lacks of character customisation (no plans for it as far as I know) and the story / handful of npcs are a bit basic / minimilist. 36077238.review:
[h1]好遊戲需要你我一同支持[/h1]

寫下評論的當下，《Book of Demons》賣出了 2.4 萬餘套，製作團隊回收了遊戲開發成本的69%。

[h1]以下轉載自開發者部落格[/h1]

由於這是我們的首次Early Access，所以我們不知道會發生什麼，團隊成員們也有很多的不安，因爲這款遊戲的製作用了3年的時間。

我們沒有發行商，所以一切市場營銷和財務風險都是由我們個人承擔的，因此你們也可以想象的到我們的壓力有多大。

爲了收回成本，我們需要賣出去 3.5 萬套遊戲才行，當然，我們更希望可以多賺點錢，這樣後續的遊戲就有足夠的資金製作了（因爲這只是R2G系列7款遊戲裏的第一個）。

[h1]評論正文[/h1]

這是一款紙雕風格的暗黑破壞神。

殺怪、闖關、蒐集物品。

所有 ARPG 該有的基本元素都已經到位。

目前玩了 5.8 小時，進度到大約一半。第一輪看來會是十小時起跳。

第一輪戰士完成，尚有另外兩個職業可以選擇。

怪物種類多樣且設計上十分用心。

譬如說，boss 各變身階段的攻克方法各不相同。

並不是等級高、裝備好，就可以無腦對尻。

走位、施放技能的時間、滑鼠點擊的位置，都是很重要的。

卡片有分等級：普通、魔法與傳說，且各有不同的附魔效果。

如果蒐集卡片能讓你覺得大滿足的話，就買吧！

期待製作團隊推出更多元的卡片，帶來更多樣的搭配、玩法。

個人認為，只要能做到這一點，這遊戲就完美了！

這遊戲畫風不錯, 操作簡單, 動作流暢, 容易上手, 可用手把或鍵盤滑鼠來玩
早期手把比較易玩, 不用瞄準點擊; 但到後期技能多時, 我不確定 (手把不像鍵盤可以按0-9出招)

裝備卡片10個欄位(熱鍵0-9), 卡片能進化, 可以是招式、防具、或被動效果等, 實際上不是0-9全部鍵都要按, 只須依自己喜好設置。

職業有三種: 戰士、弓箭手和法師, 目標是走到地城最下層。
每次進入地城可以由玩家選擇玩多少層為一局, 完成一局後再換算為故事進度。層數越多獎勵越豐厚。中途也可以回城補血補魔的, 免費。

現在看到排名榜第一位的玩家一條命玩到1萬6千多層, 所以只要你喜歡這遊戲是可以玩很久的。
____________________________________________________________

另外, 值得注意一點: 整個故事似乎打算分別出7個遊戲, 會否越做越差或爛尾, 實在無法估計。幾年後仍記得玩過甚麼嗎? :p

This is the perfect homage to the very first Diablo, but it is oh so good and certainly not a carbon copy! 

Changes a lot of the mechanics, largely by introducing cards which can be levelled up, mixed and matched to create versatile builds. Art direction and the irreverent, tongue-in-cheek humour is light and not overdone, so never feels put on and off-putting. 

Really great game play with randomly generated maps make this very playable and it sucked me in straight away with its very well done demo (another nod to the original Diablo). Despite its Early Access status, this game is very polished--both from an artwork (fresh!) and technical point of view (no crashes in 3+ hours of play)--so do grab it and support these magnificent indy developers.

11/10 would pick up "shit-coins" errytime!

35832913.review:
I just started playing this game, and due to what looked like an issue, figure I put a temporary one up until I can delve further into it. I bought this game at $10. Forgot why I got the coupon, will look into it. Anyway, this game sort of reminds me of the old C64 game Wizzardry, but much better. The game starts out confusing, and that inmy opinion is because the tutorial that helps you to learn game play starts when you go into the gungeon the first time. It should in my opinion be fixed up so it starts when you start the game up. I was stuck trying to figure out what to do and what keys did what because of this and took a bit of trial an error to get the adventure started. I like playing mages, yet the game makes you pick a fighter until you level up. Thats the only thing I do not like about this game, the ability to choose my character  from the outset. Who wants to work on a character and level them up in order to unlock the one you want. Thats just my opinion. Be forewarned, when you load the game up for the first time, its going to crash, or look like it does. Don't be worried that the game doesnt work with your pc if and when this happens the firt time around. This is caused by the game configuring itself to work with your pc, and also synch with your steam account. Soon as the game crashes, give it about a minute to do what it needs to on fast machines. I recomment 2 minute wait for slower systems, or systems that are limited with ram. 
(BIG WARNING) if the game does not save correctly, or loses data, check to see what version on windows your running on. My son had issues because his system updated to windows 10 pro build 1703 and it's caused a lot of issues with many a games. I had a lot of data loss two weeks ago due to this and even the restore point and windows.old that it made was corrupted so just formatted my pc and made it so it will pass up 1703.
Updating my review as of 10/21/2017. For an early access game, the features and playabality are definately fun and challenging. As the author stated in the reply below that the game crashing on first run isn't normal and for me to report it. If this happens to you, follow the same instructions but in my opinion, because my server isnt one of those pre-built systems and that every part of my server is built by myself, some even down to compenent level, the fact it crashes on firt run during setup is actually a normal process for my machine and in most likelyhood, might be for others as well. The reason it crashes on my machine, and other programs as well sometimes on first run is caused by multiple graphic cards and the fact the system shuts down the game while still setting up its files to stop the strain on both motherboard CPU and graphic card CPU's. 
I have played the game for 10 hours, and even delved into the program itself and made changes to play the way I want it to. As I said above, I do not like having to waste my time playing a character type in order to unlock another, which after two hours, went in and changed it so I could play it, and unlocked others I will be trying out after I finish playign with the mage. Sorry Konstantly, whatever my game is reporting to you isn't an issue with the game and the stats you are seeing are what I made to my character so your reading real data after MY changes. I blocked several ports to prevent the game reporting my info to the scores list on things like levels and collections so people actually trying to play fairly don't end up trying to beat something that would obviously be nextto impossible. I mean, how fair would it be if people were trying to beat me on the leaerboard for completing the entire dungeon without dying when I'm using a character with 1k hp and mana? Which is why I am mentioning this here. If something does show up, please let me know so I can remove it. Steam actually needs a feature to shut off leaderboard submissions for specific games. 
Again, as for playability, challenges, graphics, the game is definately worth the $10 I spent. The fact it's keeping me from my other games I normally play like Starbound and Terraria, this says a lot. I'm not sure what generated the $10 coupon for this game, and still looking into it so others can possibly benefit from it as well if they have not purchased the game yet. I'm still going to add more to this review as well once I'm done.

35720983.review:
Even though this game is still in Early Access, it's already very well polished.
The game looks and feels a lot like a certain hack & slash most of us are familliar with from the '90s but somehow it is more than a tribute or homage; the game is it's own and has a distinct identity which does not fail to bring back the nostalgic feelings most of us had when playing these kind of games some 20 years ago.

Gameplay is different enough not to be a clone and graphics are very well done and have their own distinct style.
Skills are collected by finding cards and equipping these in a deck which can always be re-arranged or upgraded.

If you even remotely liked these kind of games when you were a kid or like modern hack & slash games, try the Demo, it's excellent!

35575445.review:
--------------------------- Türkçe ---------------------------

Hazırsanız başlayalım,

Öncelikle bu oyun bir harika dostum. Uzun bir süredir bu kadar eğlendiğimi hatırlamıyorum ve bu oyun Şifa gibi geldi (kasten sözcük oyunu yaptım).

Nesi iyi?

-Bu oyun Diablo oyununun anısına yapılmış olduğu için öncellikle Grafikler dikkatinizi çekecektir. Sevimli ve eski tarz grafikler Diablo hayranlarının hoşuna gidecek tarzda.
- Rastgele Zindan Oluşturma sorunsuz çalışıyor, her oyun bir diğerinden farklı.
- Öyün Süresi Belirleme oyunu ne kadar süre oynamak istediğinize göre oyun oluşturmaya yarıyor. Bu mekanik oyuna eklenmesi zor gibi görünse de sorunsuz işliyor. Hatta bir zindanda ne kadar vakit geçirdiğinizi oyun zamanla öğreniyor ve her oyunun seçtiğiniz büyüklüğe göre ne kadar zamanda tamamlanacağını doğru şekilde hesaplıyor.
- Kart Sistemi Hearthstone gibi işlemiyor merak etmeyin. Envanter ve ekipman ekranlarını yerine ekranın altında bulunan kart yuvalarına kartları yerleştiriyorsunuz. Bu da bir kaç çeşit daha ilginç mekaniğin oyuna dahil olmasını sağlıyor.
- Klasik Diablo Karakterleri: Savaşçı, Büyücü ve Hırsız, daha da açıklamaya gerek yok bence.
- Klasik Diablo Zorluk Seviyeleri: Normal, Zor, Kabus ve Katliam, bence bunlar da bilindik şeyler.

Nesi kötü?

- Yine Diablo anısına yapılan bir oyun olduğundan Eşya Çeşitliliğini az buldum. Her kartın yaklaşık 10 adet sihirli, 1 - 2 adet de efsanevi çeşidi var. Nadir bulunan (Sarı) ve Set (Yeşil) eşya kartları olmasını da isterdim açıkçası.
- Bazı Ses Efektleri çok rahatsız edici. Mesela zombilere ve kalkanlara vurduğunuzda çıkan ses çok tekdüze.
- Zorluk Eşiği benim gibi günde 1-2 el oyun oynayıp çıkan birisi için fazlaca zor. Özellikle Kabus zorluğundan Katliam zorluğuna geçişte çok dik bir zorluk artışı var.

Kısacası oyun aşırı güzel ve eğlenceli. Zamanla daha fazla içerik görmeyi umuyorum. Yapıncılara da tavsiyem oyunu uzunca bir süre erken erişimde tutup bol bol içerik ve oyun modları eklemeleri.

(Oyunun Türkçe çevirisi tarafımca yapılmaktadır. Şu an itibariyle %50 den fazlası çevrilmiştir. Ekim sonunda da tamamlanacaktır.)

--------------------------- English ---------------------------

OK, here we go.

First of all, this game is amazing! I have not had such fun for a while and this game came as a Remedy (pun intended).

What is good?

- As this little game a homage to Diablo, Graphics: strike you first. Without doubt, the Graphics look very cool and oldschool. Fans will love it. 
- Randomized Level Generation: works great. Each game is different from the other.
- Game Time Manipulation: helps you decide how long you would like to play. This mechanic looks very difficult to adopt in the game but works great. The game learns how much time you spend in a level and calculates estimated completion time for the game size you choose.
- Cards System: is not like Hearthstone do not worry. Instead of an inventory and equipment screen, you get cards to equip in a hotbar which enables some more interesting mechanics to work.
- Classic Diablo Characters: Warrior, Mage and Rogue, oh man, needs no description.
- Classic Diablo Difficulties: Normal, Hard, Nightmare and Massacre, again, no need for any description.

What is bad?
- As this game is a Homage to Diablo, Item Variety: should be wider. Each card has about 10 magic and 1 or 2 legendary variants. I would love to see Rare (Yellow) and Set (Green) variants too.
- Some Sound Effects: are really annoying. When hit, zombies and shields make an annoying sound effect and these effects have no variety.
- Difficulty Span: is kind of challenging for such a Casual player like me. There is a steep increase in difficulty from Nightmare to Massacre.

In all and all, the game is amazing and fun. I hope there will be more content and game types in time. I suggest the developers not to leave Early Access for a long time and keep adding content to it.

(The game is being translated to Turkish by me. More than 50% of the translation is complete. It will be fully completed by the end of October.)

35481380.review:
[i]Осень 2017. По мере больших обновлений дополню обзор.[/i]

[b]Вкратце. Без спойлеров.[/b]

Это безусловно хорошая игра. Картонная графика, интересная механика, минимальные системные требования, удобный интерфейс. Но стоит ли её покупать сейчас? Нет. Пока реализовано мало контента. Игра явно долгострой. Смотрите демо или ищите пиратку.

[b]Подробнее. Со спойлерами.[/b]

На момент написания прошел год как игра в раннем доступе. Максимальная скидка 30%. Среднее время обновлений 2 месяца. Разработчики за это время добавили мага (воин – первый персонаж), балансировали навыки, новые карты умений, проклятия. Вскоре будет локализации на множество языков и третий персонаж – разбойник.

Сюжет состоит из 3 квестов (боссов) и откровенно пуст. Проходится за 10 часов с зачисткой всех и вся, искусственно затянут. После игра превращается в бесконечный лабиринт для открытия не найденных карт всех редкостей, их улучшений, новых сложностей и проклятий. Эдакая песочница. Между персонажами нет обмена и каждым необходимо проходить сюжет и собирать карты.

Первые 2-3 часа интересно, но после первого босса, ты понимаешь, что тебя ждет одно и то же, смотря на маркер твоего приключения на карте до следующего квеста. Да, меняются декорации, новые враги, новые карты умений, но все одинаково. Сейчас, на мой взгляд, в игре нет интриги, что ждет за углом известно. Это одна из причин, почему не рекомендую её сейчас. Если энтузиазм разработчиков не иссякнет, они выдумают в геймплее что-то новое, не сомневаюсь. В финале должен получится добротный продукт, но боюсь его еще нескоро ждать.

Ребята стараются, прислушиваются к мнениям. Местами даже навязчиво: прошел босса – вылезает окно «напиши отзыв в Стиме», закрыл игру – пройди опрос. Отключаемо. Конечно такое внимание хорошо.

Но меня беспокоит другое – это будущее игры. Сейчас доступна 1 из 7 книг, назовем это главами. Если грубо прикинуть (с главами и будущими обновлениями), то сейчас доступно 10% игры. Предположу (судя по внутриигровым ачивкам), что продолжение будет в виде ДЛС. А как много игр с бесплатными ДЛС вы знаете? Надеюсь, я ошибаюсь.

Впрочем, даже сейчас игра очень хорошая, это факт.

35395195.review:
Honestly, I'm impressed. I bought this solely based on the other reviews because my initial impression was a bit lackluster-- that this looked like some kind of Diablo-flavored reverse tower defense.

Gotta say though, it captures the essence of the ARPG genre and Diablo 1 very, very well. And then it manages to add interesting mechanic changes on top of that to keep it fresh.

The flex system is pretty amazing. Even if I do generally end up picking the longer ones, it's nice to have the choice to play a shorter quest and still progress if I'm short on time. It's not something you often think about with this kind of game but it's definitely on my mind now that I've experienced it.

The card system was something I was very skeptical about, but it works. The upgrade system isn't overly complicated but it is robust enough to make progression feel steady and meaningful.

Overall, I'm excited to see this come out of EA to see what the final product is like.

35390269.review:
Прекрасный рогалик с неким подобием механики настольно-карточной игры. 
Приятная картинка выполненая в стиле бумажных фигурок, атмосферное музыкальное сопровождение, добротное повествование и описание всех типов врагов.
Ко всему прочему отличная оптимизация. Запускается шустро, работает стабильно. Багов замечено не было.
Самое главное, что игра не требовательна к игроку и не отжирает его время в постоянной погоне расскачивании умений и выбивании лута. 
Хороший проект для лампового вечернего времяпровождения по недорогой цене.

п.с. Единственное что захотелось бы в ней, так это кооператива, но это уже была бы другая игра.

35382685.review:
Book of demons é um jogo ao estilo diablo em que nosso personagem precisa adentar inumeras dungeons até chegar no boss final, o que atrai esse jogo é os seus gráficos que é tudo estilo papel dobrado e seu estilo de gameplay

Gameplay : O seu personagem anda por apenas 1 caminho pela dungeon, e o ataque é ''ficticio'' ou seja, você pode ser um guerreiro, mas ataca a distancia clicando com o mouse, e sim, você ataca clicando nos inimigos, isso é bem legal, mas as vezes acaba se enrolando entre querer fugir e atacar os inimigos, o sistema de magias do mesmo é feito atráves de cartas em que acha durante a gameplay, podendo ser selecionadas com o botão direito do mouse

Sons : Os sons do jogo são bons, e as músicas também, nada de muito destaque aqui

Inimigos : Variedades OK de inimigos, alguns são parecidos com diferenças X e Y, mas nada que vá '' ah só copiou e colou ''


O jogo é divertido e cumpre bem o seu papel, quem quiser ser mais hardcore tem o modo em que morreu já era, vale a pena a jogatina para quem gosta de jogos estilo diablo, o único defeito é que em meio a briga, o jogador se enrolar por basicamente o mouse ser o centro de toda a movimentação e ataque

35364100.review: 9/10 great game. Loads of fun, excellent humor and whimsy factor. The homage is top notch; i am consistently humored while being challenged. A nod to a classic favorite yes, but the gameplay is fresh and inventive. The way you skill up is a new approach, and deciding what to use and what to power up always leaves you striving for more, so you can BE the hero of legend, but also because you want to see what lies in store. The artstyle is light and fun yet plenty of thought and detail have gone in, and there are the specific sound effects used to give the nostalgia glow, as well as some actual glow effects.:D A solid fan after trying the demo, i was pleasantly surprised by how much more was available once i purchased the full game.

35361575.review:
Alright so I decided to give this game a try, but i was hesitant because i play a lot games that are on the more complex side like Path of Exile and this game looked a little to simple for my tastes. 

I was VERY surprised to find out that that was NOT the case. The card system gives you quite a lot of customizable options and finding new cards feels just like finding rare items in other RPG games its rewarding and surprisingly challenging. There have already been several times while playing i ran into a group of monsters only to immediatly run away muttering "shit shit shit shit" this game gets a lot harder as you progress and its an absolute blast.

Pro's
-Awesome voice acting and story telling
-The towns people dialogue has made me laugh out loud on several occasions and they have awesome personallities
-Kick ass art style
-Great levling system
-Area's let you know when they are cleared
-Surprisingly deep combat and card system
-Interesting and unique combat mechanics
-Full keyboard support (no mouse needed if you prefer that) great for traveling
-Good sountrack and ambient noises
-You need to be strategic with your movements there is no "mowing down" enemies in this game
-Challenging
-"Hardcore support" through the daredevil (one life and you are dead) option
-Flexiscope mechanic letting you tailor area's estiamted time of completion so you can sit down and enjoy an area for a few minutes or recieve bonuses if you wanna marathon the game. Pretty sweet and unique. never seen something like that in a game.
-Active Devs


Cons
-Track type gameplay can be frustrating at times
-Picking up items in combat can be a death sentence if you arent carefull
-Movement can be a little challenging untilyou get used to it
-Can be hard to tell if monsters are within your light radius

Overall awesome game im really looking forward to supporting these dev's and playing this and future games from them. 

-Easily worth the money

35361384.review: Quite fun, the movement controls feel a little clunky though.

35355648.review:
[b]Encantamento[/b] é o sentimento que [i]Book of Demons[/i] causou em mim. [b]O game é antes de tudo uma homenagem ao sagrado ato de jogar[/b], conseguindo tocar aquela consciência de "bem-aventurança" já há muito guardada; coisa que costuma ressurgir em forma de nostalgia naquelas pessoas que começaram a jogar nas décadas de 80 e 90. Apesar disso, [i]Book of Demons[/i] não é igual aos games do passado; é novo! novinho em folha! Contudo, feito com aquele carinho que os [i]tiozões[/i] (eu entre eles) sentem que havia em dose maior nos clássicos.

A cada canto, a cada andar descido rumo ao inferno, você sente o empenho dos desenvolvedores que tornam cada fator do game num elemento cativante, como os [b]gráficos que são tremendamente encantadores[/b] juntamente com o character design (adoro os efeitos de papel desgastado que há na maioria das coisas). Há um [b]tom de comédia em tudo, mas nunca de maneira escrachada ou forçada[/b], provocando bons sorrisos durante o gameplay todo. As [b]vozes[/b] são bem gravadas e cheias de carisma.

Não é um game para substituir seu ARPG padrão, seja ele qual for, mas com certeza é uma soma daquelas que duram quanto tempo vivermos, pois, a aventura fica muito interessante após o “final”, com o aumento de desafio constante, adição de regras e a exigência cada vez maior da perícia do jogador em manejar o [b]sistema de cartas[/b] que define todos os atributos dos heróis – do equipamento às magias. [b]Tudo isso feito de maneira bem dinâmica, exigindo raciocínio e a troca de cartas durante as batalhas mais duras para evitar a morte, coisa mais terrível do modo daredevil[/b], similar ao hardcore de [i]Diablo[/i] – morte permanente. Há um ranking dos 100 primeiros desse modo e não custa lembrar que não é fácil chegar a ele, pois em Book of Demons acontece algo que muito raramente acontece em [i]Diablo III[/i]: [b]você morre se bobear![/b]

[b]Os pontos adversos existem por motivos de extensão da campanha principal, que é "terminada" em pouco mais de 10 horas[/b], após uma caminhada entre [b]cenários que são pouco diversos em cada ato[/b], inexistindo qualquer coisa semelhante com puzzles, tornando a exploração de cada sala numa única busca por todos os itens [i]dropados[/i] por monstros eliminados, jarros e baús.

Minha nota para o [i]Book of Demons[/i] é [b]8,5[/b]!

35254542.review:
El juego es un hack&slash que tiene el alma del Diablo 1, eso sin dudas, con montones de referencias.  Los personajes (que hasta ahora son 3, guerrero, mago y arquero) mantienen un estilo caricaturesco lo cual le da un tinte especial, casi bidimensional, que contrasta con el ambiente 3d.  Los enemigos, también caricaturescos, tienen diferentes habilidades que vamos a tener que medir y aprender antes de enfrentarlos (lo cual le suma dificultad). Esta dificultad también está acrecentada por el tipo de desplazamiento del personaje, ya que los movimientos posibles son 4, hacia arriba, hacia abajo, a la derecha y a la izquierda (nunca nos podemos salir del camino). 
La historia es simple y está contada por los NPC que son 4. Cada NPC tiene una función diferente: curarnos, desbloquear espacios para habilidades, mejorar esa habilidades, etc. Las habilidades activas y pasivas se presentan en forma de cartas que vamos encontrando a lo largo del juego y que podemos equipar en los diferentes casilleros, este sistema me pareció bastante interesante ya que una misma habilidad (por ejemplo bola de fuego) puede ser encontrada con diferentes efectos (por ejemplo: cura, reducción de enfriamiento, etc.) lo que hace que el juego no sea tan lineal. Estas cartas pueden aparecer también en sus versiones mágicas y legendarias. 
Al matar enemigos subimos de nivel y al subir de nivel podemos elegir entre subir vida o mana, no hay más opciones que estas. Eligamos lo que eligamos el punto restante (mana/vida) irán a parar a un caldero junto con diferentes premios que vayamos encontrando a lo largo del camino (en el pueblo podremos comprar estos premios y la vida/mana restante a cambio de oro).
Otra característica que me parece muy importante destacar es la posibilidad de elegir antes de iniciar un nivel la dificultad y la cantidad de tiempo que podamos/queramos  dedicarle. Así podemos elegir si va a durar 5 minutos o 30 minutos, en base a esto se generará una extensión aleatoria de mazmorra (con mayor o menor cantidad de enemigos y longitud, también serán mejores los premios cuanto mayor sea la dificultad).
El sonido en general no es de destacar, pero tampoco molesto, es acertado (quizás el punto más bajo del juego).

El juego lo recomiendo para cualquier nostálgico del Diablo 1, o amantes del hack&slash en general. Está en beta aún, pero ya tienen bastante contenido como para pasar muchas horas jugando.


PD: está en inglés y polaco por el momento...

35235454.review:
Very fun, quirky little hack and slash. 

Your character is stuck on linear paths, you can move along the paths at your own free-will, however you cannot deviate from the path. It takes a bit to get used to, however it lends itself to the combat quite well! The entire game can be played with your mouse, with very little keyboard input (unless you have a mouse with numerical inputs, in which case you never need to touch the keyboard.)

Excellent little game, it can be a lunch break game, or a long sit-down session game, entirely up to you! You're able to choose the length of your runs. Fantastic idea on the devs part, it adds a lot of accessibility to the game depending on your schedule.

For early access there is a tonne of content, and a LOT of polish. Very excited to see where future updates take it!

34949089.review:
A dungeon crawler with enough twists and turns away from the usual to keep me interested. Book of Demons brings something new to the table that really stands out, the option to choose how long of a dungeon you want, and have time for. The sense of humor and obvious love from the devs towards the first Diablo game really brings back some fond memories of my own. With just a few hours spent in-game as of right now, I can already tell that this will be a memorable adventure. Which I do hope the devs expand upon before the full release. There's a lot of potential here, and I hope they don't waste it like so many other early access games out there. 

I will give the devs extra credit for having a demo of the game, something that is rare these days, and a shame that so few companies make use of these days. But that's another topic. 

10/10 would recommend this early access game again.

34677946.review:
I barely scratched the surface, but what yielded was a gross, overly cinematic, hand-holding stroll through generic off-brand Diablo 1 on rails, and Early Access, in all of its incomplete glory, upon that.  

[list]
[*] [b] Fully voice acted quest text [/b] It's an exhausting, unimaginative rip of Diablo characters, the most laborous of which was easily Deckard Cain. Even if there is a mute function, what a waste of resources.

[*] [b] Severe limitations in world interactivity [/b] The village is not a fully realized, 3D scape, it's a backdrop for cutesy paper people. The cathedral runs exclusively on rails; while it could be argued that this approach is streamlining unnecessary movement, my counter is that the appeal behind Diablo was its gritty, stomach-knot-twisting darkness that drew harsh, dramatic lines of aggro demarcation, accompanied by the bellow of a charging rhino demon. Gone is that enveloping darkness, replaced by amusement park fare and circus peanuts.

[*] [b] Broken combat [/b] Warrior is the only available class as of writing, but you'd guess it were the rogue from the gameplay- kiting is actually integrated, and requires no special effort. For whatever reason, your attack range is mostly determined by sheer visibility while wielding a sword, whereas the demons' is true to life. How does this gameplay evoke "warrior"?

[*] [b] Terrible exposition and cinematics [/b] They beat you over the head during the introduction with every development you can expect, in what order, delivered via WWF/ Diablo 3 style with megaphone announcements. I understand they're trying to cram as much presentation/ promise of content as possible into the demo version to sell Early Access, but it's a huge turn-off for anyone wanting to simply enjoy it for what it is. 
[/list]

I approached this game with eager nostalgic glee and left it disgusted. It's an unabashed parody of a cornerstone of 90's gaming, and I couldn't stand to face its shit-eating grin any longer than I did.

The Paperverse is an unraveling roll of toilet paper tumbling by. Let it pass you too.

Edit: Requesting more downvotes from angry fanboys pls. Sorry, not sorry, but you can't blatantly rip off a game, to the point of actually mimicking Deckard Cain as closely as possible, fail miserably to create anything worthy of being called "homage," or anything remotely original, for that matter, and expect no backlash. 

Keep pouring the salt, boys.

34623174.review:
Oh look, it's Diablo 1 HD! With papercraft!

Seriously though, as someone whose first gaming true love was Diablo 2, I always felt bad for being unable to appreciate the original Diablo 1 for what it was, always seeing it as an inferior Diablo 2 prototype. This game, however, gives me that feeling I know I should've experienced when I played D1, but didn't. Its setting, characters and story are as close as you can get without getting sued by Blizzard, and gameplay is a weird kind of streamlined hack'and'slash, where the main character can only move forward and backward on a corridor "rail" of sorts. Which could be unfamiliar at first, but really doesn't take away much from the experience.

All the spells, gear and consumables in the game are called "cards". There are 3 classes (guess the archetypes), and the "cards" you can get are determined by those. What I liked about this system is that you can put on any card in any slot, so if you want, you either can get loads of spells and survive without any gear at all or, on the contrary, you can ditch the spells, gear up all the way to the teeth, and go left-click everyone to death. Both these possibilities require lots of mana to be viable, but in different ways - spells cost mana as you cast them and you have to refill it once in a while, and gear passively locks some of your mana up, so if you don't have enough free mana, you can't put on any more gear. It's an interesting simplification of the classic level/stat requiement on gear that falls into the whole "streamlined" feel this game goes for.

In short, I'm glad I found this little gem, and I hope one day to see Book of Demons 2: Archon of Ruination, if anything, just to see a papercraft Necromancer raising paper skeletons.

34423581.review:
UPDATE:  I am amazed at the level of support from this Dev!  The latest update fixed every issue I had with the controller, targeting, and button identifiers.  It had a huge impact on gameplay.  Have zero issues with the game now!  Before I was really having trouble hitting the correct targets, so I just had to plow through them in the order they appeared, it seemed to get stuck on certain targets.  This is no longer an issue, and my poor mage is surviving a lot better now!  

I'm going to write this from a "blind" point of view.  Before yesterday I had not really looked at this game, it was on my wish list, but then again so are like a million other things that I might be interested in.  It popped up on my radar through Steam suggestion, saw the huge positve reviews, and the fact that it had a demo.  So why not try it!  I also don't really know what's on the radar for future updates.  I hate spoilers, and really don't watch videos or read reviews much.  Only enough to get the basic idea of what a game is about.  

Positive: 

+I really like how you can adjust how long your run will be, and that it calculates this based on your personal time completing runs.
+More varied strategy than it at first appears. 
+Very nice visuals/art style.  Pop-up bookish.
+Nice card upgrades/mechanics, make sure you properly seat each card tightly into it's slot! 
+Enough random goodies to be interesting, but not overdone like Diablo or Torchlight.

Neutral:

I have to say I am a bit worried about Corpse Runs!  I had a real bad flashback to the late 90's playing Everquest. In Everyquest you die 18 levels down in some dungeon and have to painfully run back down and get your ... naked.  This is somewhat similar.  However you don't have to start over from the entrance, and it is not really too painful to get your stuff back.  I died in a room with the mage full of nasty armored dudes, took me a few tries to get my stuff back.  All in all it was NOT very painful.  This could have been a huge turnoff for me, but I think it's done well.  

Negative:

-I use a steam controller for almost everything I play.  I was happy to see they included a Steam Controller profile, I love it when a dev puts some time into making a really nice profile.  However my first run or two in the demo was really not fun.  The buttons are ALL labeled wrong!  So it kept telling me to smash armor with the Y button , when it actually was the B button!  Not a huge negative, but really annoying.  I'm old, it took me a while to remember which buttons to hit when due to the on screen prompts always being wrong!  An hour or so of messing around and it was not really a problem any more.  And I could always make my own steam controller profile for it.  Not a huge issue. Maybe there is a way to set this in options, I did really dig for it.  

-Targeting.  Once again this may just be a steam controller issue.  I had a little difficulty using the right track pad to target.  WIth some practice this was not a terrible issue, I just felt like there could still be some improvement to it.  Not a game breaker for me. 

-Atmosphere.  It's early access, and I'm only four hours into the game.  I'm hoping there is a lot more variety to the setting.  It all seems similar.   Maybe I'm not far enough into the game, not sure, just beat the first boss at 4 hours.  

-Also probably because it's early access.  Not a lot of character types to choose from.  Only two at the moment, a warrior and a mage.   A 3rd one says coming soon!  What would make this game absolutely perfect for me is about a dozen unique character types (maybe even DLC packs).  

I am really having a lot of fun with this game.  I rarely buy things full price, took a shot at this after playing the demo.  The game mechanics are unique.  I would have a hard time comparing this to another game, although Diablo comes the closest, if it used cards instead of gear.  I think the difficulty is just right.  My negative points are all very minor.  The corpse run I was worried about seemed to be a non issue (was more my fault dying 4 times in a row, have to learn to play the mage better).

34412322.review: A lot of unique mechanics. Great experience and worth to play.

34412301.review:
二番煎じを避けるために色々と犠牲にしてしまった感じの、カードで戦うハクスラ。
現状ではハクスラとしてお勧めできません。

・カードの装備スロットが上限１０で固定な上に、スキルと装備で枠を共有
・一度クリアしたダンジョンは再挑戦不可（メイン進行中はトレハンできない）
・敵がアンフェア
・メインストーリー（完成済み）がボリューム不足

[h1]カードスロット[/h1]
カードの強弱に関わらず等しく１スロットを占有する以上、どうしてもビルドが固定されがちになります。ちなみに各種ポーションもこの枠で、装備しなければ回復すらできません。
レベルで上昇するコスト制にして、強力なカードは重く、補助や弱めのカードは軽いというシステムにした方が、ビルドの幅は広がったように思えます。
更にメインクリア後のフリープレイでは、敵のエリートモンスターが遭遇時にランダムでカード（難易度で枚数増加）を使用不能にしてきます。ハクスラにおいて耐性やバフ/デバフではなく、こちらのビルドを潰してくる敵というのはどうしても好きになれませんでした。


[h1]トレハン不可[/h1]
一度倒した敵は復活せず、戻って装備集めやレベル上げをすることが出来ません。メインクリア後は、フリープレイモードで好きなだけ戦えます。
過去のバージョンではレジェンダリが全くと言って良い程落ちず、実質メインストーリー中はボスからのドロップしか期待できませんでしたが、ここは改善されたようです。新規で一周したところ５枚程ドロップを確認。


[h1]敵がアンフェア[/h1]
こちらの射程が短く（半径が画面の1/3程度）、あらかじめ決められた道しか移動できません。
それに対して敵は、射程外どころか視界外から攻撃やスペルを撃って来るわ、近づくとワープするわ、経路無視で逃げるわでストレスがマッハ。
他には１ダメージを与える度に一定時間無敵＋護衛召喚をする敵、スペル詠唱中は無敵、ボスクラスは倒すまでに必ず３～１０回無敵になる、などなど。敵に関してはとにかく「無敵が多くてテンポが悪い」これに尽きます。ハクスラ特有の、ボコボコ殴ってサクサク進むという爽快感は得られませんでした。

[h1]メインストーリー[/h1]
短い。
恐らく初見プレイでフロアコンプ（敵及び収集物全回収）してもラスボス撃破まで１０時間かかりません。サブクエや探索中の分岐等は無く、上述のように戻ってトレハンすることもできないので完全な一本道です。


[h1]細かいところ[/h1]
カードの種類がまだ少ない、スキルのキーバインドが数字キーしか登録できない、カード鑑定が１枚ずつしか行えない、等も気になりました。まだアーリーですのでこちらは今後調整なり修正なりされるでしょう。


最初に数時間プレイした時とメインクリア後にゲーム内でアンケートを用意する等、積極的にユーザーの意見を聞こうというスタンスは好印象。
加えて、他のハクスラのように夢中にさせるだけの素材は十分持っているように思えます。
ただちょっと、ほんのちょっと変な方向に捻りすぎているのを調整すればずっと面白くなるのではないかと。
現状ではお勧めできませんが、今後に期待はできるゲームです。

34317328.review:
[h1]Long story short [/h1]
Although still in Beta, Book of Demons is a well-polished, beautiful, and nearly complete game. It’s story and intro adds a fantastic ambiance that stays true through the game. The card collecting and upgrading system adds goals, gives satisfaction, and forces you not only to use hand eye coordination, but also strategy to complete this epic game. The difficulty curve isn’t something you would expect a game still in Beta to do right, but, to my astonishment, I found it already perfected. Although basically complete, book of Demons will wait to be released until February 2018 but, to the joy of the community, the long expected Ranger Update will be added sometime before the new year. But this update will only add more play time so you might as well pick up the game now and enjoy saving the world from a duck wielding demon!

[h1]Long story Long, the Game Play[/h1]
Like a typical hack and slash RPG, you’ll be fighting multiple enemies at once while using different abilities (cards) depending on your current circumstance in game. Simple right? Well of course things are complicated whenever enemies start summoning hordes of skeletons, exploding into poisonous clouds, freezing you’re buns off, and burning your mana with hell fire! With each different level lays a different challenge and, thus, demands a different strategy. All of this forces you to have good planning skills along with proper knee jerk reactions. Although this sounds like it would make the neigh impossible, it only adds a level of challenge without making the game seem impossible. Because of this, It’s difficulty, and how beautifully balanced it is, greatly enhances the gameplay enjoyability.  

[h1]Music, Sound, and Art [/h1]
Perhaps one of the most praised things about Book of Demons is its soundtrack. I’ve read many raving reviews about how it’s better than the philharmonic orchestra, professional bagpipers, grandpa’s snoring, etc. Perhaps this set my expectation to high. I found it subpar, neither here nor there. It certainly fit all the themes but it was nothing that wowed me. As for the sound effects, I was pleasantly surprised. Often this is a corner cut by developers but I would give it a seven out of ten, a good deal above average. On top of that, on the developer’s timeline he clearly states that he will further improve them. Moving on, the art for Book of Demons is not only original, but simplistic and elegant. The combination of 2 dimensional characters in a 3D environment adds personality, depth, and contrast that most art styles lack. The unnaturalness of this design compliments the dark, brooding atmosphere that really sets apart this game from the masses.

[h1]Why is it still in Beta?[/h1] 
I know everyone’s wondering about how finished the game is and what’s missing at the moment. Well, there are only three major changes that will be made to the game. 1, the developer is making a “star mechanic” that will probably give you a rating/score upon completing each dungeon depending on how well you did. There are already achievements for this and it should add to your drive to complete each dungeon as perfectly as possible. 2, more achievements!!! This ones pretty straight forward, it’s going to add more goals for you to complete, more play time, and more ways to prove your superiority over your friends. 3 (the big one!), this update will add The Ranger as a playable class. Now this might not seem like a big deal but I promise you it is! Whenever you slaughter the innocent demon of death and doom, you’re encouraged to play through again as the mage. So, adding another play through will increase how much game time you get by 50%! Not only that, but it will also make it possible to get tens of currently walled off achievements. When will these updates come out? Sometime between now and February of 2018. So, as you may for surmised, the game is complete but how long you can play it will be lengthened in the future. 

[h1]Conclusion [/h1]
Hours of entertaining game play, beautiful graphics, challenging combat, character and card upgrades, and so much more! What not to love? Truly, his game is a hack-n-slash RPG junkie’s dream. However, like most people, I worry about purchasing games still in development. This is because some companies like to take the money they made and leave the game unfinished. Not so with this game! The game, in my opinion, is ready for release right now and the updates are still pouring in! Honestly, this game is just a treasure. So go ahead, snatch it for its very reasonable price, help support the kindly creator, and have a heck of a time playing Book of Demons!

장점과 단점, 그리고 한계가 명확하게 드러나는 게임입니다. 디아블로1을 떠올리게 하는 세가지 직업, 퀘스트 라인, 몬스터들까지 전체적으로 초기 핵앤슬래시 게임의 향수가 짙게 베어있습니다. 독특한 그래픽과 제작진이 준비하고 있다는 7가지의 게임들까지 제작진들의 포부는 굉장히 크지만 현재 이 게임의 상태를 보면, 다음 작도 똑같이 핵앤슬래쉬라면 절대 안 살 겁니다.
 이 게임의 장점이라고 하면 굉장히 가볍게 즐길 수 있습니다. 게임 자체도 매우 직관적입니다. 그래서 보통 핵앤슬래시 장르에 있는 캐릭터의 '육성'이라는 측면이 굉장히 부실한데, 이 게임에서 캐릭터를 육성할 수 있는 것은 딱 2가지, 카드 슬롯열기, 카드강화뿐입니다. 레벨업을 통해서 후에 마법의 가마솥에서 보상을 얻을 수 있는 것은 굉장히 참신하지만 그 뿐입니다. 그리고 보스들의 패턴들도 처음에는 신선하지만 게임을 진행하다 보면 패턴에 따른 공략법이랄 것도 없습니다.  그저 플레이어가 보스를 빨리 죽이지 못하게 방해만 하고 있습니다. 게다가 속성 시스템으로 몇몇 구간부터는 별로 강하지도 않은 적이 그저 피통만 많아서 플레이어의 발목만 잡고 늘어지는 경우가 부지기수입니다. 마지막으로 한계는 이 게임의 시스템, 북 오브 데몬의 본질이라 할 수 있는 직관적이면서도 간단한 시스템 그 자체가 한계입니다. 한 번 플레이하고 난 뒤엔 리플레이 가치가 전혀 없습니다. 
 세일을 한다면 사는 것을 고려해볼 수도 있겠지만, 현재 상태로는 제 값 주고 사는 것을 추천하기가 굉장히 꺼려집니다. 게임의 컨텐츠가 굉장히 부실한 지금, 컨텐츠를 추가하는 대규모 패치가 없는 한 다시 플레이할 이유가 없을 듯 합니다.

+active devs and community
+great idea of remaking a classic idea!
+ various enemies and tactics in a unique, corridor-based movement system

A great game, an homage to Diablo series, but with a casual twist.
It has a unique Flexiscope system, which calculates the time required to different sizes of dungeons based on your previous runs. So if you only have 10 mins, you can still have fun!

It is EA, yet completely playable, and the devs are very active, answering every question in the forums.

Even in its current state, if you are looking for a casual, yet complex (= not time-consuming, but interesting) RPG, it's your game! Worth even the full price.

[i]Our goal is to bring back the experiences and universal stories of those hit games and make them accessible to everyone – both casual and hardcore players. We are also simplifying and/or straight-out changing the mechanics and compressing the experience of the original games into extremely short gameplay sessions. This way the games can be enjoyed by people who don’t have much time (like grown-up fans of the classic games, or casual players accustomed to playing Angry Birds)[/i]

33793024.review:
Book of Demons is a twist on the old dungeon crawling hack and slash RPG's. What will be familiar are the dungeon types, monsters, debuffs, levelling system and so on. But that's really where it ends. In Book of Demons, you are stuck to the 'pathway' or 'roads' in the dungeon level. You move around this path fighting monsters and bosses and gathering gold. This is different to usual games like Grim Dawn or Diablo, as in those you're free to go anywhere in the dungeon, rather than stuck to a path. This means using tactics in order to defeat monsters as you're unable to dodge as well as you could in other games.

The next difference is that instead of collecting loot, like swords or armour, you collect cards. These cards provide passive buffs or active buffs. They have rarity levels. Each active card costs a certain amount of money to use; while passives will 'lock' a certain amount of mana constantly. This means you have to be careful with how much mana is reserved and how much is available for active skills. The use of these cards is further limited by how many card slots you have unlocked, you start with 3 and each one costs increasingly more gold to unlock. Cards can be upgraded by the NPC's using money and Rune Cards (crafting mats). Furthermore one NPC can identify certain rare cards; for a price. 

Book of Demon's is presented in a rather unique style; with a cardboard cutout, popup style graphics. It's pleasant to look at and is enjoyable. The game is humorous and full of character.

Overall the game is very enjoyable and the only reason I'm writing this review is because the game asked me to! I would be carrying on playing if it wasn't for that!

It takes a 'little' while to get used to but the whole package is a fantastic fun gem of a game.
