31164429.review:
[h1]Hack&Slash bis der Erzdämon kommt![/h1]

Book of Demons ist im Herzen ein waschechtes ARPG, dass hier und da ein wenig die Regeln der Kunst ändert. So besteht das gesammte Skillset deines Helden (Krieger, Magier oder später Diebin) aus einem Kartenset, dass du dir aus, im Dungeon errungenen Karten, selbst zusammenstellen kannst. Karten haben mittlerweile verschiedene Raritäten und sind upgrade-bar, so dass dein Held mit jedem absolvierten Dungeonlauf stärker, erfahrener und... ähh... heldenmäßiger wird. ^^

[h1]Liniares Gameplay[/h1]

Ok ha! Das hier ist ein guter Joke, denn liniarer als dieses Game geht fast gar nicht mehr.
Anders als in bekannten ARPGs, bewegt sich dein Held nicht frei im Raum, sondern folgt einem vorgegebenen Pfad, auf dem es nur vor oder zurück geht - immer bis zur nächsten Weggabelung.

Auch das Kampfsystem ist ein wenig gewöhnungsbedürftig, geht aber nach kurzer Zeit gut von der Hand.
Grundsätzlich kann dein Held, während er durch den Dungeon hüpft alles und jeden in seinem Sichtbereicht angreifen und sollte das auch tun, sonst - naja - ist er tot.
Mauszeiger auf den Feind, klicken und Skillkarten anwenden.
So simpel, so gelungen.

[h1]Kurzes Fazit[/h1]

Ich hab das Game für nen lustigen Zeitvertreib zwischendurch geholt und bin bisher mehr als nur auf meine Kosten gekommen. Das Gameplay ist gewöhnungsbedürftig und hier ein wenig blöd zu beschreiben, doch das Spiel zeigt dir zum Glück Schritt für Schritt, wie du im Dungeon überlebst.
Macht Spaß, bietet mehr als man zunächst vermuten würde und ist sein Geld wert.

[h1]Von mir gibts einen Daumen nach oben![/h1]

Wer mal nen unverbindlichen Blick ins Game werfen will, um sich ein besseres Bild zu machen, schaut ma rein:

[b]► [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2568xGL5mN8]Angezockt: BOOK OF DEMONS[/url][/b]

Ich wünsch viel Spaß beim Zocken. ;)

31158958.review:
Well Book Of Demons is a hack n' slash that has what I can only describe as a "Hurry up and click here!" mechanic and a collectible card inventory/spell/ability etc. system. Both ideas are new to this genre and it's good to see that something different has alot of love on the reviews here. So much love in fact that I wanted to chime in with a "no recommend" personally despite the fact that there's alot going on here to like. I am still marking this as "recommend" since Steam refuses to let us rate anyway besides up or down and while it's not for me so I can't personally recommend it I will say it's worth a go if you think it might be your thing

It's a tough call for me since this isn't a bad game, necessarily. It's just not the kind of game I enjoy for a couple of reasons but the real reason for the no recommend is that to me it just feels more like a f2p clicker game from kongregate than a game I am willing to pay $20 bucks for on steam. Given it's polished up to look pretty and sounds great and I'll give kudos on that note.

 


The good...

Paper pop-up art style aesthetic was well done
Game runs well
Voice Acting very well done
Inventory System is simple and it should be if you don't want Inventory Managment to be a part of the game

AC/DC

Simply Simple Control Scheme that provides limited movement options and limited options
Hurry! Click here quick! mechanics are not really my cup of tea but some may like it....
Cards as far as I can tell are only used as placeholders for equipment/spells etc. as inventory spots so there isn't really a card "game" mechanic but just a collectible item mechanic that happen to be on cards

Not so good.....

1 hour in and already the combat of this game is very repetitive which can be okay if you LOVE the combat but extremely tedious if you do not care for it.
Depth allegedly comes as you play for longer and watching a let's play semi-confirms that it does evolve a bit but not much and it starts off very slow (three card equip slots) and mind numbing
Minor complaint but worth mentioning in this type of game - the loot system felt kinda of meh and mehed because of the all in one collectible card mechanic that makes the inventory system so fluid.
It feels too slow and clunky to be considered an ACTION game in my book and it fails to have the depth necessary to make real-time strategy and/or turnbased games interesting

The polish is such that I'll actually rate this one as a 6/10 but I wouldn't recommend it personally.

30911219.review:
Prvé Diablo je legenda. O tom asi nikto nepochybuje, veď každý, kto ho hral spomína na tú ponurú atmosféru mestečka Tristram, na temnú katedrálu a ešte temnejšie tajomstvo, ktoré sa v jej útrobách skrývalo. No, a niečo podobné ponúka aj Book of Demons, Early Access titul, ktorý si vďaka grafickému štýlu vyslúžil aj druhé meno, papierové Diablo. V tejto hre Vás tiež privíta malé mestečko s katedrálou na pozadí, v ktorom žije mladá slečna krčmárka, liečiteľ, šedivý mudrc a tajomná čarodejka - does it ring a bell?? ;)), terorizovaní zlom, ktoré sa odtiaľ prebíja na svetlo sveta. A vašou úlohou bude presne tak isto, ako kedysi v Diable, v koži bojovníka, alebo po splnení určitej podmienky aj mága (v pláne je aj lukostrelkyňa, ale až neskôr) poschodie po poschodí vyčistiť katedrálu od príšer, zombíkov a démonov, vtrhnúť do samotného Pekla a vysporiadať sa s Arcidémonom, ako sa v tejto hre volá hlavný nepriateľ.

Čo vás prvé pri spustení hry ale zaujme, je jednoznačne použitý grafický štýl, takmer celá hra vypadá ako poskladaná z papierovej vystrihovačky, dokonca aj efekt ohňa je papierový. Nie je to síce také výrazne ako napríklad pri Tearaway Unfolded, či Paper Mario, ale ak si na takéto veci potrpíte, táto hra Vás osloví. Grafický štýl nepôsobí vôbec rušivo a zároveň aj robí hru o kúsok zapamätovatelnejšou oproti iným ARPG hrám. Takže budovy v mestečku sú z papiera, postavy sú z papiera, aj vrany krákajúce na papierových konároch stromov sú z papiera. Po prvých rozhovoroch - postavičky su všetky plne nadabované - sa teda s vašim hrdinom vrhnete priamo do boja.

Tu sa znova prejaví zvolený štýl, pretože postavička nie len že vyzerá papierovo, ale aj pohyb má ako figúrka z papiera, nehýbe nohami, len skacká ako panáčik v šachu. Spočiatku to pôsobilo prinajlepšom divne, neskôr to ale v hektike boja nevnímate. Po dungeone sa nepohybujete voľne, ale len po cestičkách, ktoré sa ale všelijako vetvia, križujú, rozdeľujú a zasa spájajú a vo vačších podlažiach strávite pekne dlhé chvíle. Dungeony sú pekne temné a ponuré ako to máme radi a atmosféru dokresľuje jemná hudba, ktorá miestami takisto pripomína tóny z prvého Diabla. Sedí k hre perfektne.

Prvý boj absolvujete prakticky hneď po vstupe do prvého poschodia, samozrejme len proti slabému kostlivcovi. Príšery majú miesto HP srdiečka, ale všetko funguje rovnako, ako by HP mali, takže kostlivček na tri rany umrie. Neskôr však počty srdiečok narastajú, dokonca sa mení aj ich typ (kamenné, otrávené, ľadové, aj ohnivé) a tu už treba taktizovať a mať na všetky druhy nepriateľov nejaké opatrenie. Tu vstupujú do hry karty, ktoré šikovne preberajú úlohu skillov, predmetov, aj equip-u naraz. Kartičky sa používajú ako uzdravovacia flaška, Fireball skill vhodný na ľadové monštrá, amulet na obnovu many, či štít na ochranu pred údermi. A to je len zlomok toho, aké kartičky v hre sú. Padajú z nepriateľov, truhiel po úrovniach, mini-bossov aj zo špeciálnych oltárov. Dajú sa samozrejme vylepšovať, na čo slúžia vylepšovacie kartičky a peniaze, ktoré zbierate tiež kdekade, ale aj tak ich je stále málo. Dokonca jedna karta môže mať viacero variácií, (občas dokonca aj legendárnu) ktorá danej karte pridá špeciálnu vlastnosť. Takže vaša uzdravovacia flaša vám okrem vráteného života aj zníži cenu za dobitie u čarodejky, či vám pasívne urýchli cooldown na jej dalšie použitie. Každá variácia sa upgraduje samostatne, takže si treba vybrať len naozaj takú, ktorá vám sadne a investovať do nej. Zo začiatku môžete používať tri karty, neskôr až do desať, ak si odomknete - znova za peniaze - dalšie sloty. To vás núti znova taktizovať a pečlivo vyberať ako si poskladáte postavu. Budete mať plný set equipových, pasívnych kariet? Ich použitie ale zamkne časť many, ktorá može chýbať pri aktívnych kúzlach. Alebo budete používať aktívne skilly a riskovať, že bez flašiek s manou zrazu ostanete kdesi v hĺbke slabý ako čaj?

Hlavne neskôr je toto riadna dilema, pretože nepriatelia su silnejší, majú rôzne schopnosti a imunity, vyvolávajú si pomocníkov a používajú aj kúzla. Tie im musíte manuálne rušiť, teda klikaním na ikonku kúzlenia im čarovanie prerušíte, počas neho sú ale imúnny na iné útoky. V hre sú monštrá so štítom, ten takisto musíte rozbiť presným klikaním na štít, až potom im ubúdajú srdiečka. Iné príšery si volajú na pomoc nohsledov, tých treba zabiť prv, lebo hlavná príšera je vtedy nezraniteľná. Bossovia dokonca môžu a budú používať aj nezrušiteľné kúzla, vtedy máte akurát čas sa premiestniť na pozíciu blízko liečivého oltára, alebo ku vchodu, keby bolo treba utekať. Toto všetko dohromady tvorí veľmi dobre spracovaný súbojový systém, kde treba sledovať naozaj mnoho faktorov. Vaše karty, kúzla a obranu nepriateľov, ich zvláštne schopnosti (niektorý pavúci vás opľujú pavučinou, ktorá vám na pár sekúnd zneškodní náhodné karty) a útoky (démon vás omráči a vy musíte po obrazovke myškou nahánať ,,hviezdičky pred očami), do toho sa stíhať liečiť a občas aj dopredu rozmýšlať, kadiaľ sa dá ujsť.

Za vynaloženú úsilie z monštier padajú karty, peniaze a dostaváte aj skúsenosti, pri každej novej úrovni ale rozhodujete len, či si navýšite HP, alebo manu. Dokonca, ak sa rozhodnete napríklad pre HP, bod do many sa uloží u barmanky v meste, kde si ho za obnos môžete neskor vybrať (aj s dalšími odmenami, ktoré občas z monšier padajú - vačšinou ide o peniaze, potiony, občas sa pritrafí aj karta) z magického kotla. Jeho obsah ale zmizne, ak cestou umriete. Okrem toho sa v meste liečite, identifikujete nové karty, či upgradujete tie stávajúce.

Silné karty sa ale budú hodiť, pretože s každým poschodím slušne stúpa obtiažnosť, pribúda monštier, majú viac HP a rozmanitejšie schopnosti. V posledných fázach hry už som fakt nestíhal sledovať celé bojisko, všade okolo mna lietal papierový oheň, bojoval som aj s dvomi bossmi naraz a to ani neboli hlavný bossovia. Tam sú boje ešte tažšie, ale aj odmena býva omnoho vačšia. Pri hlavných bossov sa znova myslelo na Diablo, takže prvý je The Cook (Butcher), druhý Antipope (Lazarus) a tretí už spomínaný Archdemon (Diablo).

Po jeho smrti hra ale nekončí, skôr naopak. Odomkne sa vám možnosť Freeplay, kde si nastavíte v akom prostredí a približne aký druh monštier chcete zabijať a to v štyroch postupne odomykajúcich sa obtiažnostiach. Celú túto parádu môžete skúsiť hrať aj v Daredevil móde, kde jedna smrť je aj tou jedinou. Je toho teda veľa a takto môžete nazbierať všetky karty, povylepšovať ich a hrať prakticky donekonečna, čo ale samozrejme časom pravdepodobne omrzí. Za 20 eur ale hra podľa mňa stojí, aj s prísľubom viac obsahu do budúcnosti, kedže sa stále jedná o Early Access titul.

Čo som ešte nespomenul? V skratke teda:

- keď umriete, musíte si bežať pre mŕtvolu, vtedy ste slabší ako čerstvo narodený klokan
- v hre je systém umožnujúci nastavovať veľkosť a dĺžku dungeonu tak, ako si prajete a ako máte na hru čas
- level cap je 40, nedosiahol som ho
- takisto sa mi nepodarilo odomknúť všetkých desať slotov na karty, nieto ich ešte povylepšovať na maximálnu úroveň
- vrany v meste vraj vedia vykrákať melodiu Game of Thrones
- v hre je easter egg na Witchera

30888623.review:
A very fresh take on the ARPG genre. Since other reviews already describe the game well, I'll just say that this game has a demo that should help you make your decision about buying the game or not.

If you've played the first Diablo, you'll find the environments quite familiar. :)
Other than that, the game is very original with a unique set of mechanics.

I surprisingly find the gamepad mode to be my preferred way of playing and I can't wait for the devs to implement enemy target cycling, which is the main downside to playing with the gamepad. (The devs have already stated that this feature will be implemented closer to launch)

The devs are also very active on the forums and always do their utmost to help you if a bug presents itself.

Two thumbs up!

30768203.review:
This game is a love letter to Diablo's core mechanics. But still ends up feeling completely fresh. The player is locked to a track which feels a little clunky at first. I'm starting to get used to it.


That aside, everything in the game so far feels balanced and had a purpose. There's great loot to be had and nothing feels like fluff. The progression and goals are clear and I think pacing is perfect. The game even lets you alter pacing according to what kind of session you want. Though this would be nice if you could set a default preference.


The graphics and sound are unique. I think they do the job of making this title distinct and have a fun feel.

The card system I was worried about as I've seen it ruin other games. But the execution here is flawless.


What else can I say? Grab it. Support these developers for doing something new and fresh in a sea of rehashed crap. They managed to pull off a tribute in a new way. Games like this don't come along very often. I'm going to go back and play some more now.

30691138.review:
Zuerst schreckte mich die Grafik von Book of Demons ab. Als ich nach kurzer Spielzeit jedoch merkte, wie viel Potetial in dem Spiel steckt war ich wie gefesselt :)

Jetzt nachdem ich den ersten richtigen Boss besiegt habe muss ich sagen, das Spiel ist nicht so leicht wie es zunächst schien. Hinter jeder Ecke lauern Gegner, Fallen und Gegenstände, die man entdecken und besiegen kann.

Dank der Anzeige am oberen Bildschirmrand verpasst auch kein Spieler Gegenstände oder lässt etwas aus. Ich fühle mich zurückversetzt in die wunderbare Zeit von Diablo I. :-)


Positiv:

- Gelungene Effekte (Gifteffekt negieren / Sterne berühren um Betäubungseffekte zu entfernen)
- Zufällig generierte Dungeos
- Größe der Dungeons frei wählbar (werden nach und nach freigespielt von Klein mit wenig Mobs bis Rießig mit nem Haufen Loot und Gegner)
- Nett inzenierte Tutorials (Schritt für Schritt während dem Spiel/ausschaltbar)
- Freischaltbare Gegenstände und Verbesserungen
- Abwechslungsreiche Gegner
- Fesselnde Sprecher (nur englisch oder polnisch :P)
- Athmosphärische Geräusche und Musik
- Jede Menge Errungenschaften
- Freischaltbare Avatare
- Hardcore Modus mit Anzeige in der "Hall of Fame"
- Für 20 Euro akzeptabler Preis für ein "Early Acces" Spiel


Was mir bislang negativ auffiel:

- Gewöhungsbedürftige Grafik
- Bislang nur zwei spielbare Klassen (Krieger und Magier) (Bogenschütze angekündigt)
- Da lediglich vorgegebenen Wegen gefolgt werden kann, ist das Ausweichen von Geschossen teilweise so gut wie unmöglich.
- Nahkampf-Zwischenbosse blocken sich manchmal selbst mit Trümmern.
- Es gibt Bereiche, die nur über Türen betretbar und dann mit Monstern so vollgestopft sind, dass man innerhalb von Sekunden fast instant tot ist.


Fazit. Wer Diablo I mochte und mal Abwechslung in einem Paper-Hack&Slay sucht, wird hier definitiv fündig. :-)
Klare Kaufempfehlung

30687239.review:
Do you like board-game aesthetics?  Do you enjoy on rail games (sort of?)?  How bout Collectible Card Games that don't involve trading?  How bout Diablo?  If you said yes to any of those questions, you might be an ARPG addict like myself.  Enter Book of Demons, the 12-step program to itch that scratch for ARPG gameplay without the managing of eight million different skillsets, crafting all sorts of fun nonsense, and distill it into the most Southern distilled alcohol without the alcohol!

Pros:
+ The paper-y graphics are a really nice touch and makes the game stand out from ANY other ARPG out there astounding to be what Diablo III couldn't be
+ the card part of the gameplay (collecting/customizing what's on your belt/skills) is pretty cool.  I enjoy being able to collect cards and upgrade them as time goes on per dungeon and going back to town
+ the voice acting is actually pretty superb.  Nothing sounds overdramatic; all the characters so far have their own stories to tell and listening to them is less of a chore than most ARPGs
+ the actual dungeon crawling is... repetitive, yes.  But ARPGs past will tell you that dungeon crawling is repetitive anyway
+ Let's say... unique controller setup.  The left thumbstick moves you around the dungeon and your right thumbstick allows you to pick up items, target enemies and the like.  Overall not a bad button scheme for the controller

Cons:
- the actual roleplaying part of the game is out of touch just a bit.  Yes, the cards you place on your person do influence your character but as far as that goes that's it
- limited character customization to literally just your name (it's not a deal breaker but it does put me out of touch with the character a little)
- Male/female genders per character aren't a thing.  Doesn't bug me that much but it might some
- the "on rails" system may bother some people but this IS a distilled version of Diablo/most ARPGs so it's not THAT big of a con

666/666: would definitely kill demons from hell in any format again... and again... and again... and again.  And again.

Disclaimer: I'm a non-native English speaker, excuse my grammar :P

Book of Demons is your typical dungeon crawler more or less, but it game doesn't feel boring at all, unlike Diablo and PoE, for example.
The reasons for that are:
[list]
[*] Cute graphics and game atmosphere that doesn't feel stressful
[*] Interesting Card Deck instead of Equipment design decision, it feels very fresh
[*] Interactive gameplay mechanics that keep you engaged in combat
[*] Game progress is quite rapid and never gets to the grind
[*] Adjustable difficulty and game session settings
[/list]
I should also note that the recent update added a lot more depth to the game's card system that gives those who like to theorycraft and play on higher difficulty settings a lot more options, so even in the endgame it never gets old.

Overall, I highly recommend this game to both casual and hardcore players, this one is already very good and deep and feels like is going to be a complete masterpiece when it's finished.

30617802.review:
首先，光冲这个画风，就得给个好评。如果你和我一样喜欢收藏一切画风独特的游戏的话，买就是了。
但是在游戏性方面，我还真得多说几句。首先，制作组对这个游戏抱有着很高的期待，真的希望这个游戏能够成为纸片版的暗黑破坏神。但是以这个游戏的底子，真的能够达到这个期待吗？我表示怀疑。
这个游戏的操作性被极大地简化。所有复杂的事件都只需要用“点击鼠标”来达到。敌人有护盾？点tm的。敌人在施法？点tm的。但除此之外，走位，精准等arpg常有的元素都被略去了。高度简化的操作使这个游戏非常非常的休闲，对我这样的轻度玩家来说可能是好事。
另外，这个游戏最有特色的可能就是这个“卡牌系统”。在一开始的时候，我承认这个卡牌系统的意义真的不大，只是个简化版的技能树系统而已。但是经过上一次的更新之后，这些卡牌还真的开始有点意思了（也可以看出制作组还是比较用心的）。你总共有十个卡牌槽，不同的卡牌可能相当于不同的“技能”或者“装备”，同样的卡牌中又有不同的稀有度，高稀有度的卡牌会有自带的特殊效果。虽然卡牌本身的种类不多，但这个设定能让build变得更加多样。
剧情方面，官方的希望是讲一个搞笑的，无厘头的英雄主义，但是我个人觉得游戏本身没有很好地表现出它该有的剧情。希望官方在这方面多下下功夫。本人对剧情的要求还是比较高的。
现阶段，虽然游戏的可玩性很高，但是游戏的完成度仍然很低。总共三个职业，其中一个居然还没做完。总共7个章节，居然只做完了一个。。。而且官方更新速度并不快。既然你们的野心这么大，也希望你们能加快进度。

Anyway, good game. Keep up the good work, and keep it faster!!!!!!

30597088.review:
Book of Demons is an RPG with a unique art style, allows for personallizing the game session, game play that allows it to be an ARPG with stratgic and tactical elements, and a equipment collection system that appeals to my gotta-catch-them-all instincs.  

The game play is mostly a click based ARPG, but certain elements slow down time (such as accessing inventory).  This allows the player the time to make an intelligent decsision that they as a player cannot make as fast as the warrior of fable they are playing. 

Everytime you delve into the dungeon the game asks how long you'd wish to play.  Want to play for 10 minutes? Sure. How about 60 minutes? That's great, go for it.  It does take a few delves to unlock the longer play sessions, but that's ok.  You need these delves to learn your character and the game.

The art style is that of a pop-up book.  This allows the game to be whimsical and sincere at the same time.

The equipment is represented by cards.  This is not a card game.  It just is part of the unique art style.  It does allow the player to fullfil the need to collect things.

I really enjoy this game.  I'm looking forward to when the game is complete and for the followup games that appear to be part of the series.

30596584.review:
This is cardboard diablo 1. If you've played diablo 1 or are at least familiar with the diablo series hack and slash type of games or generally just enjoy a good endless amount of monster slaying from an isometric perspective then this game should definitely be on your wishlist. 

The game adds a couple of unique features such as the boardgame style graphics and playstyle and the cool 'collectable cards instead of skills' as well as the ability to set the length of your dungeon according to your available time.

I think it's worth noting that this game doesn't offer you the 'freeroam' abilities afforded to you in other hack and slashes as the movement is restricted according to set paths in dungeons (kind of like driving a mining cart around interconnected rails). This can make dodging stuff a near impossibile task sometimes and also makes it easier to get boxed in by fires, icycles, rocks, monsters and anything else that decides to block your path.

All in all I am really enjoying my time in Book of Demons and see no reason to not recommend this to anyone who likes a straight forward hack and slash with filled with quips and references to it's spiritual predecessor.

8/10 would let Teleport kill me again by sending me to an unpexpected location

30350219.review:
Review based on version as of March 3/2017.

I recommend to anyone looking here - try the demo. You will get to see how the game works (quite a lot of it actually) so you can make your own mind up.

As for my opinion:
  Graphics are nice - not too demanding, yet still very functional, entertaining and enjoyable to look at.  Only real complaint at this point is that the game is just screaming for more content. There are 7 major groups of monsters, with up to 15 variants of each (total looks to be around 65 to 70, I haven't seen the last group - the first 6 have 58 combined). These variants do use different graphics so they aren't just different colours).

  Gameplay uses a mechanic of cards to represent equipment and spells, as well as "crafting" components - these are for upgrading your cards (each has 3 levels). The card system works pretty well - it forces you to make strategic choices, and you can tune these choices based ont he kind of opponents you are encountering in a dungeon. 
 
  As mentioned elsewhere, your character has to follow the paths, but you do get to choose which way you want to go on these paths. Its not as limiting as you might think (this is where the demo really helps the game shine). Level size is configurable which allows you some control over how long you want to play in a session (time estimates are provided, seem not too far off). And you can return to town at almost any time, your progress will be saved (you do have to either use an item, or walk back to the level entrance to get to town).

  Combat works pretty good and is explained in the tutorial (make sure you follwo along or you will get destroyed!), with only a couple of concerns in the present version. The big one is that sometimes it is hard to get your charater to run away when you want to/need to - he may go a couple steps then stop, move nothing at all, or move where you want.  Also sometimes it is hard to target the monster you want to (or to hit their shield) when there is a crowd.

 The character progression system seems to encourage play, and exploration. You need gold to buy some improvements (more card capacity, upgrades, identify cards, etc), while every level you get a point of health or mana. Mana is used for both spells and to power equipment. Makes you think strategically :-)

  This is part of a series of 7 games (check the publisher's website) - so we will see how the rest goes. This one is a good start, and at this point is quite playable and looks to have a good future. 

  And most importantly, its fun!

我之所以喜欢这个游戏主要是操作简单(操作性没有暗黑火炬那么高，甚至可以说相比这俩基本没有操作性)，基本上鼠标点就行了，偶尔加血用技能也就那么几个键。

配音感觉也很不错，边看文字描述边听npc说话感觉很不错。

作为一个刷刷刷的游戏我觉得这游戏对于角色成长和怪物难度提升方面调和的很好。

每一层地牢的大小是可以由玩家自己掌控，这点我非常喜欢，比如我看到这层会有我不太擅长应付的敌人我就调整一下大小来减少他们的数量，或者根据现实情况调整地牢大小来控制游戏时间。

这个游戏看起来经常能遇到血池，但是这个其实对于游戏难度本身并没有特别大的影响，打第一个boss虽然每个前面小房间都有血魔池，但进入boss房间就锁门了，只能靠身上血瓶。再就是死亡有时候来的很突然，被控制或者被群殴都可能使你无法跑回去喝血，所以我感觉血池基本上算是锦上添花的感觉。

唯一不爽的就是主角只能在固定的轨道上滑行，但是怪却可以自由移动，而且有些怪还可以非常无耻的用石头封路或者招唤小怪围住你。[spoiler] 不过好像就是这个机制感动了手残的我	[/spoiler]

29942130.review:
Book of Demons:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
Hey, you! Are you here to face the ARCHDEMON? You see the old Cathedral on the hill over there, this is where you’ll find the entrance to the dungeons. Oh, before you do so, you might want to visit our village square. We have a fabulous fortune teller, a barmaid, a healer and a sage. They will help you in your quest to defeat the ARCHDEMON. I hope to see you again champion and good luck!

Book of Demons is a hack and slash / dungeon crawler game where you take your champion into dungeons setup in a paper verse world. 

As this game is still in development, you can choose between two classes of heroes at this stage: a warrior or a mage. One of the first aspects of the game that I really like is the fact that you can choose how long each dungeon can be (you have to unlock it though). If you have thirty minutes to spare, then make them short but if you have a couple of hours on hand, make the dungeons bigger.  
  
There are three quests to complete in this game with three bosses to defeat. The first one is the cook, then the Antipope and the almighty ARCHDEMON! Before you get face to face with one of these bosses, there are plenty of dungeons to go through.  As you progress through the game, you’ll find cards; these are usually in golden chests, but may also drop when you eliminate a high ranking enemy. They are basically skill cards with three different coloured backgrounds: the red ones are for potion (health, mana, etc), the blue ones are spells and the green ones are abilities. There are runes cards too, which can be used at the fortune teller to upgrade one or several of your existing cards. As you find a new card you can allocate it to your hero, but you will only have three open slots out of ten at the start of the game. To unlock the other slots, you’ll need coins, so make sure you pick up everything in each dungeon and visit the sage to purchase your new slot.

You character will gain experience as you slaughter your enemies, and each time he levels up, you will be given a choice to get either an additional life point or mana point at that time. If you decide to take a life point, the mana point will be placed in the cauldron which you can purchase back from the barmaid. 

There are stacks of different enemies, some with melee and other with long range weapons. Some will explode while others might teleport themselves to another location to make it harder for you. Fire and freeze spells will come at you from every corner – it’s hectic and really fun! 

Your character will have to follow a specific path within the dungeon, and it will be equipped with an automatic attack as soon as he is within a certain range from his enemies. However, as it is a click type of setup, you can move your mouse on an enemy and click on him until he dies. Click on all pots and chests, as a fair number of them have coins in them. If you are running low on life or mana, you can use a potion if you have a few in your inventory.  Otherwise look at the red and blue fountains. Click on them and your life or mana will be fully regenerated.

I really like the artwork; it is just splendid. The soundtrack is not great and could be improved. However, I do think that the voice over is well done. Mouse and keyboard for the control are just fine.

Positives:
~~~~~~~   

-	Great artwork
-	Well-designed levels
-	Choose the length of your dungeons
-	Stacks of enemies 
-	Plenty of cards
-	Fun and addictive gameplay
-	Achievements (100+) and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~  

-	Soundtrack could be improved

Fans of hack and slash – dungeon crawler style will like this game. Fun, fun, fun… and more fun!

8/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

In order to fully understand this early access edition of Book of Demons it is important to know that it is not like many other games. Despite being a role playing game which is not an unfamiliar concept, the game’s overall appearance is much different. This game is actually set up like a pop-up story book which makes it rather interesting. The simplicity of the graphics in this game make for somewhat of a comical time. It’s funny to see a little story book warrior exploring dungeons and slaying monsters, although that is exactly the case with this particular campaign.

Upon choosing a character (warrior, mage, etc..) you are introduced to a small town where a barmaid, a healer and a couple of other characters reside. These characters are in the game to assist you in your quests as well as heal you and offer you power up opportunities. The healings and other rewards from your companions are very helpful as you continue your quests through dungeons and into the depths of hell. With a wide range cards (power ups), this game offers high levels of characters customization similar to Van Helsing.

29578529.review:
[h1]Book of Demons[/h1]
[b]Developer[/b]: Thing Trunk
[b]Publisher[/b]: Thing Trunk

[b]Introduction[/b]
==========
When I first obtained this game, I really didn't think much of it. It went straight into my backlog behind a lot of other games. But one day I was in the mood to try something different, and as I was scrolling through my library I found Book of Demons. I thought to myself, why not? It was a good a time as ever to give it a shot. I quickly installed it and proceeded to play it for an entire afternoon. I even skipped lunch! 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
==========
Book of Demons is a point and click deck-based action adventure dungeon crawler with RPG elements. That's the fairest way I can think of to describe it. You begin the game with the Warrior class, with other classes (Mage and Rogue) unlocking as you level up. You start in a small town where you are greeted by the Barmaid. She tells you of a terrible evil spreading throughout the land, and directs you to the Sage. He tells you of the evil permeating throughout the old cathedral and how the town's bishop was dragged into the catacombs beneath it.

General gameplay has your character following a pathway through each level. You can only move on this path, back and forth, as you choose. This is how you can avoid spells and attacks. Footprints are shown on the path wherever you have been, and gold footprints are shown if you hav ereached the end of that particular path. To interact with the environment, just click anything. Pots, chests, enemies...everything is clickable as long as you are close enough to it. When yoru character is in range of an enemy, he will automatically attack it slowly. Clicking enemies is MUCH faster though, so I highly encourage you to do so. Basically the goal is to clear out all enemies and check out all the special "spots" on each floors. Spots can be chests, shrines, and other such objects. Once you have cleared at least all the enemies from each floor, you can move onto the next floor. This returns you to the "map" where you can see the next floor and the enemies it contains.

As you met new types of enemies, some of them come with a very specific gimmick or special mechanic. As an example, some enemies explode in a cloud of poison gas when defeated, while some enemies can spawn more enemies. There ar even more complicated mechanics as well...like the goat demons. They tend to charge at you, and if you are hit, your character will have stars spinning around his head. These stars then pop up on screen and move around in a circular fashion. Your character will stay stunned until you manage to click each star and make them all go away. All enemies have a heart counter above their heads, and as you click them, they empty out and die.

As you defeat enemies, you earn EXP, gold, and sometimes special cards. These cards can be spells, abilities, special equipment, or Runes. You can only equip as many cards as you have slots unlocked. Each slot can be bought as you progress, but they are expensive. Rune Cards are used to upgrade your other cards. Each time you level up, you can choose between gaining more HP or more Mana. Whichever you do NOT choose, goes into a special cauldron that you can buy the upgrade from back in town later. All special loot/money items go into this cauldron as well, and the cost of emptying it goes up each time you empty it.

[b]Graphics[/b]
==========
This game has a very special aesthetic that is kind of difficult to describe. Everything is origami/folded paper, that surprisingly works very well for this game. I love how it manages to be very dark, yet very charming at the same time. The theme and tone of the game really shines with this art style.

The UI is very crisp and defined. Health on the left, Mana on the right, cards and extra slots in between them. The icons on each card ar clear and well defined. I really like the look and feel of them, and of everything to be honest. 

[b]Sound and Music[/b]
==========
Sadly, this is the part of the game that comes up short. Usually I can be hooked into a game on the sound direction and music alone, but Book of Demons doesn't have much. It has some basic, creepy theme songs as you explore, and a town theme...and that's pretty much it. Attacks with the Warrior has this fwip fwip sound, the clink of coins can be heard when picking up gold, and pots shattering as you destroy them sound pretty good. 

[b]Performance[/b]
==========
30 FPS minimum? Yep! It can hit 60 FPS easily, for all those who care about that. I used my mouse almost exclusively to play, and I didn't even think to use a controller so I can't comment on that. It's probably best with just the mouse. I didn't experience any weird hiccups, stalls, freezes, lag, or random crashes...and that's always a plus. If you're curious how your system might compare, my PC specs are on my profile as usual. If they are higher than mine (and let's be honest...they most likely are), you'll have even better performance.

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
==========
I absolutely love this game. Pick it up if/when you can, it's great for passing the time and can get fairly challenging in the later levels; you can see an example of this in my gameplay video below. I can't wait to unlock the last class (Rogue) and play around with it and the Mage more. Oh, and did I mention you can set how long of a play session you want before diving into the catacombs (after a few adventures first)? Yep, you can do that! Book of Demons is great for short or longer sessions, and very playable for people of almost any skill level. At least give the free demo a try!

[b]Gameplay Demo[/b]
==========
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNwyx1742E4

[b]Nerd House Verdict[/b]:
==========
[h1][b]Highly Recommended[/b][/h1]

First of all, it looks really fresh and interesting, the art style is awesome. And developers clearly wanted to innovate, but it might have gone wrong way a bit. For instance, it makes you move in diagonals, but it's not adding anything to gameplay except the inability to use WASD, so you have to click around... a lot - because there's no pathfinding. At first glance the game may seem like a Diablo on rails with cards as abilities, but in reality it feels like a real-time Dungelot with shitloads of fast clicking and dragging your mouse to collect the loot. Sell me the magnet card that takes all the stuff automatically, please!

Metagame seems shallow, while core gameplay lacks sophistication and content. There's a slight chance the developer makes something of it, but I'd wait for it. From a game like this I would expect satisfying crits and interesting combos. 
And probably more intriguing stuff in the village. For now I have little incentive to stay in the game, almost everything seems to be open and what's left is not presented in a way that makes me want to keep grinding. Maybe it's all bad luck, but cards themselves were all boring and stats-based, not offering interesting combat abilities.
29491019.developer_response:
Hi! Just dropping by to let you know that:

29477936.review:
Looking for a casual ARPG to play when you just want to game for a little bit? Then this game is perfect for you! The game allows you to mold your session to a length that works for you, whether its for less than 15 minutes or for hours, the game lets you know approximately how long each floor should take (based off of info from your previous sessions) and is just a delight to play.

If you're looking for a complex fast paced ARPG then this is not the game for you, but if you're looking for a soft ARPG that doesn't require a lot of metagaming to get into and just want to have some fun slashing at some papercraft enemies, then this game is pretty fun, it can still get hectic as the game progresses, but its not really on the same scale as the major players in the genre, it fits the art style pretty well and the way it adds depth to its simple controls is quick to pick up and fairly unique for the genre. Probably my favorite to boot up when I want to game for ~30 mins or less, which I feel is what the devs were going for- something very easy to just dip into for a quick session and it accomplishes it splendidly.

Although I will be fair and mention what I don't like about the game. The movement can be a bit unintuitive at times as the movement style on the grid thats on a 45 degree angle facilitates the need to essentially be ready to press AS/SD/AW/WD to make sure it reads where you want to go when you reach a fork correctly- atleast this method felt most comfortable to me. The game is also light on content, as to be expected from an early access title, but its still plenty to entertain me for what it is for me as a quick fix game.

29460385.review:
Estamos ante un gran juego. Un buen planteamiento, un diseño espectacular, bonito y desafiante. 

Se podría decir que es un diablo 1, pero hecho en artístico. Con las figuritas de papel y como se va desplegando el mapa, estamos ante una mezcla de fascinación y añoranza por los juegos clásicos de mesa. 

Tiene cosas originales, no es un diablo al uso. Lo de las cartas es un añadido bastante acertado y lo del caldero es una maravilla, es ese puntito de riesgo, de no sé si quedarme con lo que tengo o jugarmela un poco más y mejorarlo. (Cuando juguéis lo entenderéis). 

No sé todavía como es de largo. He jugado más de las horas que marca steam, pero no me lo he pasado. Tiene pinta de ser una duración bastante aceptable y sobre todo rejugable. 

En cuanto a las actualizaciones están espaciadas en el tiempo, pero cuando salen merecen mucho la pena. En el momento en que escribo esto falta la arquera, que tengo muchas ganas de jugar con ella, porque si es cierto que la forma de jugar del guerrero y el mago en el núcleo es parecida pero luego tienen diferencias notables. A ver que tal lo hacen con el personaje que queda (aunque ojalá sacaran alguno más).

Y poco más que decir, quizás el precio parezca elevado, pero yo creo que está bien en relación calidad precio para todo lo que te dan y lo que te van a dar. 

En resumen un gran juego con un gran futuro.

Hero Siege for me is lack lustre and very repetitive, if you gain enough poweryou can easily just stand around and let monsters come to you and then kill them. 29365969.review:
I normally do not find myself leaving game reviews on Steam (or at all for that matter); but, then again it is so rare to find a game that is so creative and innovative in this stagnent gaming age of the rinse and repeat of over-used ideas - no less a game that is still "Early Access" (Alpha).

I have put over 20 hours into the game at this point, and have unlocked everything but the hardest difficulty, which I plan on playing though that difficulty.  The game has unique affixes to the dungeon and the bosses based on the difficulty, but nothing so sinister as to make the game frusterating or unplayable.  Hard adds a new feature where engaged bosses will 'lock-out' the usage of X-Y number of cards (increasing the range of X and Y as difficulty further increases), the next difficulty adds a feature in which when you start a dungeon you have a set number of cards (again same X-Y # of cards that increases range when you further increase the difficulty) that you MUST use within your build for that dungeon.  There are more things added with additional difficulties to make the replayability quite high, and all the more entertaining.

I also should note I am not big on Single Player games and typically opt-in to Multiplayer games so I can play with friends and family - not since childhood in the early ages of gaming where everything was innovative as there was no set or defined norm - but this game has not only relit a love of engaging single player games but also bringing with it quite the nostalgic memories of my early gaming experiences with Dungeon (D&D) and Turn Based gaming.

When I first was thinking of leaving a review, my only complaint - at that time - would have been about the controls within game; but, that being said, after having put more hours into the game at this point I have gotten used to the controls and any potential stemming frustration has been curbed.  It can take a couple hours to get used to it, but you become quickly acustomed to the controls.

I am looking forward to the other 'Books' from the Developer [Thing Trunk] as well as the completion of Book of Demons.

29353448.review:
Этакая пародия на Diablo со своими картами и куртизанками.

По молодости днями, если не месяцами, засиживался в 1-м и 2-м Diablo, чуть меньше в 3 часть. Но сейчас нет столько свободного времени, и короткосессионная Book of Demons пришлась весьма кстати. Перед прохождением данжа вы выбираете длительности его прохождения, что весьма кстати, когда ты хочешь немного отвлечься от чего-то и потратить 5-20 минут на пробежку пары подземелий.

Карточная система тут весьма номинальна. По сути, это те же абилки, только в в виде карт. Только в случае с Diablo, как и в большинстве традиционных игр, скиллы ограничены минимальным левелом, а в Book of Demons вам ещё необходимо выбить карту с этим скилом.

После прохождения игры вам становится доступен новый режим, в котором у вас блокируется пара карт в зависимости от сложности: эти карты забивают доступные слоты + вы не можете их использовать в течении прохождения текущего данжа. На nigthmare это 3 карты, к примеру. Плюс в этом режиме перед началом битвы с босом у вас блокируется ещё пара кард (на nigthmare 4). Так что, защитные или аое спелы (у вара бомбочки, например) лучше заюзать заранее. Довольно занятный режим, особенно когда у вас блокируется хилка.


Если суммировать:
+ Короткие сессии.
+ Занятная "бумажная графика".
+ Нелпохая задумка с картами.
- Для апгрейда карт слишком много гриндить надо.
- В некоторых местах баланс страдает.
+ Интересный доп. режим после прохождения игры.
- На nigthmare и выше бывает очень плохой рэндом с заблокированными картами, из-за которого невозможно пройти данж в принципе.
- Нет мультиплеера.

Игра в целом неплохая, как минимум для раннего доступа. Разработчики периодически обновляют игру, работают с комьюнити. Надеюсь не забросят проект и сделают из игру конфетку.

Единственное, чего [b]очень[/b] не хватает в игре - это, конечно, [u]мультиплеера[/u].

29247792.review:
开始是被其独特的美术风格吸引的，然而实质的游戏体验并不那么愉快。
游戏的自主性很差，地牢中角色只能在设定好的路线上移动，是的，开阔的地牢，怪物从四面涌来，而你只能在作者画好的线路中移动。角色的操作全程鼠标点击，所谓的卡牌元素好吧其实就是把药水，装备，技能做成卡牌的展示形态。。。至于宣传图中貌似华丽的法师技能释放，实际游戏你会发现还是直接鼠标点击更有用。
这不是个刷刷的游戏，但RPG剧情也并不突出，你只能顺着作者预定的意图推进（是的你只能推进，刷过去的地牢都不再可用）。总之除了刚开始的新奇，游戏品质本身还是很平庸。
最后，强迫症的你特别要记得打碎地牢中每一个瓦罐，不要遗漏每一个金币!

Ну вот я прошел наконец то Nightmare и открылась сложность Massacre, и знаете что пошла эта игра нахер с такими загонами, сейчас обьясню почему так все плохо.

После прохождения компании открывается возможнсть проходить рандомные данжы на разных сложностях, сейчас скажу что я почуствовал, когда попал на Nightmare. Игра стала отдавать бредом и не потому что игра стала сложной (наоборот, чем сложнее тем лучше), а стало невыносимо глупо проходить данжы, в чем суть, на Nightmare вначале данжа, игра выдает 3 карты которые ты не можешь сменить пока не ройдешь данж (ладно, это нормально), но вот то что при встрече с босом  4-6 карт росто выключаются и ты не можешь ими пользоваться , это такой бред, а еще при смерти у тебя забирают любую карту из тех что сейчас у тебя на панеле и придется выбить ее снова и прокачать. Но я страдал и мучился, но дошел до сложности Massacre и что я вижу из 10 возможных карт у тебя на панеле, закрепляются 5 и ты не можешь их сменить(это не страшно, всегда из того что есть можно билд сделать), а при встрече с босом у тебя выключаются 5-8 карт !?!?!?!? ЧТО !!?!?!?, т.е. ты поставил на 1 и 2 слот банку на ману и жизни, а в остальные слоты карты с умениями, подходишь к боссу и херась, босс выключает тебе 8 карт и ты остаешься с банками и ебись как хочешь т.е. просто бей с руки и пытайся его убить, а без карт ты превращаешься в фанеру и кроме босса еще топла бегает. А есть огненный босс(у которого огненные жизни и что бы снять 1 сердце обычной атакой надо ударить раз 5), который имеет армор и при попытке его сбить вызывает миньенов и если ты за несколько секунд не убьешь их, он восстановит армор и вызовет новых миньенов, короче его не убить. И что интересно при смерти, ты теряешь 50% золота и 5 карт !!!, т.е. 2-3 смерти и ты без карт. Что я вижу, надо убирать выключение карт боссом и делать что на Massacre игра сама выбирает тебе все карты и ты с ними пытаешься пройти или еще как то , но оставлять выключение карт боссом нельзя, это просто бред.

Un jeu bien cool, je recommande !

28712587.review: 新颖的 战斗模式，随意搭配的卡片技能装备组合，瞬间沉迷其中不能自拔。

28712398.review:
纸片画风魔幻题材地牢探索游戏，虽然目前游戏体验不错，但是内容还是相对较少。根据商店界面的EA说明来看，正式版原价应该不再提升，感兴趣的可以等待后续开发和优惠，当然，早买早享受的话也是很好的。

游戏对于新玩家相当友好，游戏中遇到新元素时都会有简洁明了的图文介绍，返回小镇时也会有一些NPC对话来进一步介绍，所以不必担心上手问题。
下面我主要对人物培养和地图关卡两方面来介绍&评价

[h1]人物培养[/h1]
游戏中人物属性及其简单，只有生命和魔法这两条，每级可以立即获得1点生命或魔法，另一点属性将会在城镇中花钱获得
游戏中装备+技能融合到了它的卡片系统，卡片共有三种，主动(消耗魔法值)/被动(减少可用魔法上限)/道具(掉落或花钱充能)，总共不太多，战士的话是32种，在冒险中逐渐获得
卡片样式和属性大概如下，可升到3星
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=827231338
合理搭配/及时更换卡牌可以在战斗过程中大幅提高打怪效率
-缺点: 目前版本卡牌种类相对较少，导致人物潜力不是非常大

[h1]地图&关卡[/h1]
地图共有三个场景:地下城,墓穴，地狱(还有NPC住的城镇)，拥有共计大约三名大BOSS，十来种小BOSS，以及几十种怪物，地图和场景设计的比较精巧
游戏中将整个冒险分为几次不同规模的探险，每次探险根据规模2~多关不等，完成后就会增加游戏进度，到达一定进度后就会到达BOSS场景，目前来看大约有五十多关的样子，冒险结束后也有个结算，用于人物进阶和后续统计(目前来看还在开发中...)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=827227375
大地图中可以对关卡有一个大概的了解(地图大小与怪物种类,未知敌人显示轮廓，以便玩家准备战斗)，已经探索过的地图则会显示详细的资料(收集目标&怪物种类数目)，关卡会变为明亮，怪物也会变成骨堆
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=827227411
游戏中的怪物属性各不相同，应对起来方法也不同(游戏中有介绍，针对敌人调整卡牌是游戏一大玩点)。战斗中也有不少QTE元素，比如点击盾兵的盾牌破盾，怪物释法时无法被伤害但是可以通过持续按上面的施法条打断施法，当被眩晕时点击屏幕中出现的五角星恢复行动。战斗视觉和音效算是不错
BOSS有多个形态，每个形态属性不同，被打到下一形态切换时也是无敌的，下面是第二位大BOSS的属性
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=827227343
关卡目标是地图全清，当剩余物品+怪物小于等于5的时候会在上方显示剩余目标的数目和种类，给玩家一个大致目标，数字清零后就算过关可快速进入下一关(当然如果没有全清地图但是找到出口也可以手动过关，但是后面统计数据会差一些，而且目前关卡不可重复挑战，所以最好收集齐完美过关).通关后还有自由模式，可以选择地图和难度
-缺点: 地图方面的缺点是地图地形较为单一，主线流程相对较短

最下面的链接是我录的8分多钟的游戏优酷视频，没有解说，主要是关卡和卡片合成的演示，里面可以看到几种怪物的能力和处理方法(比如法师，持盾战士及小BOSS)，因为我走的是纯被动平A流战士，所以攻击方式会相对单调些。
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTg4NjI5NTc1Ng==.html
另一个B站视频
http://www.bilibili.com/video/av15157893/

Pros:
- Pretty Addictive
- Good Sense of Humor, Selfironia, Retro Feeling
- Interesting Combat Mechanics (Shielded Enemies, you can interrupt spells...)
- Interesting "Items" (= Cards in this game)
- You can choose how big and time intense your levels are
Cons:

28396897.review: Nice gem for 19.99.  Really brought back the feels of old school hack and slash but completely fresh.  If you have reservations about the art style or graphics in general like I did ......don't.  The look, feel, and sound of the game is great.  I won't spoil too many suprises but it plays like a great dungeon crawler with a card game and traditional RPG mixed in while bringing some fresh ideas to the scene (ie: the Flexiscope which basically calculates a random dungeon and , based on your playstyle, how long it will take you to defeat it (ive seen anywhere from 9 minute to 49 minutes) and you go from there.  The timers are suprisingly accurate too.)  From what I understand, there will be 6 other "book" all in a similar style but playing as a different genre.  I anxiously await the next (while i farm further on my Warrior in Demons :) )

28387293.review:
Amazing game already, and still in early release, with constant developement, so it's only going to get betetr!

The early release is about content and balance only, NOT BUGS, unlike alot of early-releases - the game is completely playable and very stable (I haven't had a single crash, lock-up, etc). I have a lvl 40 warrior - of 50 levels possible - and have completed the campaign, and played every difficulty of free-play at this point. So I can tell you there is more than enough content to get your money's worth!

Make no mistake, this is a completely playable game, they just haven't completed some of the content features that you'd normally see released as DLC by less scrupulous companies, are balancing late game elements, and perfecting some of the control elements that you'd expect from a full-release, so they're calling it early release. Bless their souls! (HINT HINT guys! If you need more sales and developemnt capital, make those extra classes DLC and the base game a little cheaper - I know I'd go for it!  ;)

There are some game minor balance issues, mostly in late game, and room for some more polishing without a doubt, but the devs are quick and very responsive to the community, and there's a feedback button right on the left side of the screen so you can comment right in-game! They clearly want your feedback!

As you can see I've already logged 30 hours of play time in the week or so since I bought it. I got it during the sale, but the value per dollar even at full price is a great deal in my book, and I fully plan to buy some gift coppies for my friends!

I've been burnt by early-access in the past, so I understand warriness, but this is one early access I have had absolutely no remorse in participating in, I've already got my money's worth, so it's all gravy from here!

Here's hoping this company gets off the ground and gets to fully realize their vision!

28365396.review:
A fun and refreshing take on the hack and slash genre, using the age old trope of diving into a dungeon to slay a demon but given new life with the game play and graphics.

PROS:
+ The Flexiscope: Only have 8 minutes to play? No problem, you can adjust each quest to however long you want!
+ The artistic style of everything being paper works great with the tone of the game
+ How interactive the game is. Dodging boulders, breaking shields, curing poison, there are plenty of little things in the game that immerse you in it and keep you on your toes
+ Fun card system of skills, items, and equipment for you to balance and play with to find the right fit for you
+Great sound and music, a very obvious and well done homage to old school Diablo
+ A fresh take on enemies, both mobs and bosses alike.

Cons:
- NPC voices are a little stale/irritating
- Some of the latter level enemies can be more annoying than challenging.

Overall this is a very fresh, fun, and interactive hack/slash game that could easily keep you entertained for hundreds of hours, in whatever size chunk you want

28332988.review:
This game is a gem! Feels like a perfect mix of Hand of Fate + Diablo. The visuals / audio are fantastic, and give you that sense of immersion / being there just like D3 does for me. The on-rails look of the game put me off at first, but after playing the demo I bought the game immediately. It's really well done, and doesn't feel clunky / restrictive as I was afraid it would be. The card system is also done perfectly, as you can play around with new cards and swap new ones in and out on the fly. The devs are amazing, most communicative / open to feedback ever. They're obviously working very hard on this title, as there seems to be a new update about every 4-5 days. Also, I am usually not one for story in games... but this game has so many witty one liners and other humor sprinkled into the narrative that I am finding myself sitting through every NPC interaction 100%, ALL of which are fully voice acted (very well) by the way! I can't wait for this game to be finished and to see what the next Return 2 Games title will be!

(Posted this review shortly after purchasing the game. I have a feeling I will be spending many hours playing this, and I plan on updating this review with more detailed information once I learn more about the game)

Une excellente surprise que ce Hack'n Slash assez technique, s'appuyant sur un système de cartes optimisables plutôt que sur celui, plus classique, de skills. 
Les graphismes sont très sympathiques, et même si le choix de contraindre les déplacements de l'avatar sur une seule dimension peut surprendre, le jeu est vraiment prenant. 
Pour l'instant, deux classes sont disponibles : le mage et le guerrier. Le rodeur devrait suivre en Janvier, d'après les developpeurs qui constituent un petit studio très réactif. 
Cerise sur le gateau, et c'est assez rare pour le noter : une démo est disponible. Pour ma part, cela m'a convaincu d'acheter le jeu pour un prix somme toute raisonnable.
A essayer.

28319324.review: I had to think up a better excuse for why I was late to work, because saying I played this till 2am wasn't appropriate.

28319303.review:
For an EA game, it is super polished, responsive and addictive. It has strong elements of Diablo 1 where you descend deeper and deeper into the dungeon. It also has some fleeting similarities to Darkest Dungeon. I really like the combat and the card gameplay, the game merges two different concepts really well and it feels satisfying to finish a dungeon. 

I've only played for roughly 1.3 hours so far and I've already come across dozens of different and very unique enemies. Some you need to do different things in order to effectively kill them, so you are no blindly slashing your way through, it is important to take your time. There's also lots of loot to collect, and while I don't particularly understand the loot mechanics entirely, it's not exactly a complex game that you need to learn every little mechanic in order to enjoy. It's very much pick up & play with some helpful tutorial hints along the way.

There are loads of cards I've already collected, which means loads of different skills which you can also upgrade. 

The game also runs at a constant 60fps on my lil toaster and looks and feels very smooth. I love the art style, the music and sound effects, just everything in this game is super impressive right now. I could easily spend hours playing this game non-stop (if I didn't have other daily commitments).

28275361.review:
Let me start by saying I didn't hate this game.  It's ok.  It's even fun at times.
Genre on this game is Hack & Slash Light?  The plot is almost exactly Diablo (the original from the 90's)

Pros: In lieu of a loot pinata inventory system, you collect and upgrade a small selection of cards (~50) from which you make a hand of abilities.  The same slots are used for equipment, consumables, and abilites, so strategizing what to take becomes very engaging.  It's also kind of a trip down memory lane, and the pop-up-book art is really eye-catching.  The game is visually quite impressive.

Cons: Whew.  I wanted to like this game so bad, but it really isn't good.  Lets start from the general problems and work our way to the specific.  The writing is pretty bad.  It's mostly grammatically correct, but it's just very bland, especially for something directly taken from another game.  I understand homage, but this game makes these tenative attempts at poking fun at the original (Showing[strike]diablo[/strike] the Archdemon on the map soaking in a lake of fire whilst holding a goth rubber ducky, slightly retheming the butcher to be the chef) but it doesn't really follow through on this.  It's a missed opportunity, because the art style lends itself to making this game at least passing funny.  Instead, the dialogue and event scripting is just bland.
The combat system is equal parts brillant and bad.  The card system mentioned above is genius.  It's totally overshadowed by the fact that all dungeon crawling is done on rails.  Let me put a fine point on this.  There are defined, linear tracks that run throughout the dungeon that are the only paths of movement available to the characters.  This causes extraordinary amounts of frustration when trying to dodge enemy attacks.  If they're on the same rail as you, you're going to get hit.  This doesn't happen often, as they're all free roaming.  Additionally,  these rails have bad directional detection.  You can control them with mouse or keyboard, although I had more luck with the keyboard, the game still does not have consistent interpretation of direction, so at a critical point, your character can fatally turn the wrong way at a T-junction if you're not careful.  Games like this are meant to be a fight, but the fight shouldn't be against the controls.
The character's ability to interact with the dungeon or its inhabitants is limited by a light radius.  If an enemy isn't in your light radius, you can't click them.  Since there's no such thing as melee, per se, this is the big limiting factor on attacking.  The problem is that it's pretty indistinct as to when things are in your light radius.  However, it also acts as a limit for most range attacks.  This is particularly problematic with the Mage, who really needs to do what casters in every Hack & Slash game have done since the genre's inception and fire blazing death blindly into adjacent, unseen areas to kill/weaken the things in there enough that the squishy person can survive the ensuing fight.  This isn't really possible in this game and the game suffers for it.
The postgame is also just bad.  The levels are are randomly generated, and therefore, theoretically endlessly replayable, but you take xp and gold penalties for death.  XP hurts (especially since there's no way to build survivability in this game) but the gold is arguably worse.  Gold is a hot commodity in this game as it's required to get new card slots, upgrade your cards, and upgrade your upgrade materials.  On nightmare difficulty (the first challenge difficulty) you'll lose 30% of yours for every death.  I'm not against a challenge and a failure penalty, but there's no tools avaialable to use for success.  I mean at least let me move laterally.

TL;DR: Pros: Card system of abilities good.
Cons: Actual dungeon crawl is restrictive and poorly executed.
28275361.developer_response:
While you have full right to find the game not to your tastes, I will take this opportunity to address a few of issues you have with the game and clarify. 

First of all, at the time of writing this review you have spent 40 hours in the game. Book of Demons is in Early Access and story mode provides ~8 hours per character. This means you have spent over 50% of play time in the end game, which we have not yet finished!
There is a lot of content planned for the end game. We will rework card system to offer more flexibility, add quest mastering, golden stars mechanic and mythic tier cards that will, in some cases, literally change game mechanics (check the roadmap in the forums for more details on what is planned when). 
Balancing of the endgame is also an ongoing process - if you read changelogs we make balance tweaks every few days.

You point out the range of the Mage - but he does have a longer range than Warrior (20-30%) and his missiles are guided. You can fire them towards enemies outside of your range and they will hit them. However, range in this game isn't the differentiating factor. Cards are. 

Keyboard movement - there are two modes, you can switch the "smart" movement off and turning will become predictable. As I mentioned this is early access and so far players are split as to which control scheme works best, so both modes are in the game. 

Last, but not least, there is no XP penalty for death on a higher difficulty. Only gold and cards. And playing on that difficulty is purely optional.

I will not comment on humor or writing because that's matter of personal tastes :-)

I hope you will revisit the game later during development and review the review in case you find things have improved. You have put a lot of thought into that review, so I'm confident you will appreciate the direction we will take with the endgame.

PS And check out that keyboard movement option, it can work better for you than the default one. 

PPS And I'm glad you enjoyed at least some aspects of the game :-)

28223574.review:
[i]Thing Trunk a mis à disposition une démo, libre à vous de vous faire votre propre avis sur Book of Demons ![/i]

[b]Un mot sur le studio Thing Trunk…[/b]

… pour comprendre la philosophie du jeu Book of Demons, le premier des sept titres de la série Return 2 Games.
La volonté du studio est celle de se souvenir des jeux qui ont pu marquer les joueurs bien avant les années 2000. Retrouver du gameplay alors innovant pour l’époque, garder cette expérience familière et la remettre au goût du jour, sans pour autant reproduire trait pour trait des jeux existants. Créer des hommages, non des suites.
L’intention est également de proposer une expérience qui s’adresse à tous. Fans de jeux classiques, casuals, joueurs plus confirmés : l’objectif recherché reste le fun.

[b]Puisque l’on parle d’hommage…[/b]

… Les plus habitués ne manqueront pas de le remarquer ici, et très rapidement. Un aventurier, une cathédrale, descendre toujours plus dans les catacombes face à des hordes de squelettes et démons pour s’engouffrer en enfer : la référence au premier opus de Diablo est évidente.
Le village avec son ancien sage devant le puits, les trois archétypes des classes jouables, la musique d’ambiance dans les donjons, l’aspect sombre des profondeurs, tout y est.

[b]Au cœur du gameplay[/b]

Si vous recherchez un hack’n’slash traditionnel tel que Diablo, Sacred, Titan Quest ou encore Torchlight, ce jeu risque de ne pas répondre à vos attentes. Là encore, il convient de rappeler que Book of Demons s’inspire, mais suit son propre chemin.

En ville, plusieurs PNJ seront à votre disposition. Vous ne dirigez pas votre personnage à ce moment, vous interagissez simplement avec eux. Chacun possède sa spécialité : l’ancien peut identifier des cartes inconnues, la mystique recharge et améliore les objets, l’aubergiste permet d’obtenir du butin en plus via un chaudron magique et le soigneur vous remettra d’aplomb.

Au niveau de l’interface, l’ensemble est clair et accessible : la réserve d’or, deux globes pour indiquer votre réserve de vie et de mana, un bouton d’accès aux statistiques du personnage, un bouton d’accès à l’inventaire de vos cartes, et enfin la barre d’action, où vous pourrez disposer vos différentes cartes.

Parlons des cartes justement. Vous en obtiendrez en guise de butin au cours de vos aventures, que ce soit en tuant des monstres, en ouvrant des coffres ou encore dans le chaudron de l’aubergiste. Les cartes, ce sont vos sorts, votre équipement, vos potions. Vous en trouverez donc différents types : objet (les potions et parchemins), sort, artéfact (armes, bijoux et armures), spécial (des runes qui vous permettront d’améliorer les autres cartes). 

En donjon, vous vous retrouvez alors devant une vision plus familière en terme de hack’n’slash, avec votre personnage au centre de l’écran, en vue isométrique. 

Les déplacements sont plus restreints, vous suivez un réseau de chemins sans pouvoir en sortir. Cela peut s’avérer déroutant. Que vous ramassiez un objet ou de l’or, ouvriez un tombeau, cassiez une urne ou combattiez un monstre, votre personnage reste dans son rail. Là encore, à côté du jeu dont il s’inspire, Book of Demons se différencie.

Concernant les combats, la mécanique est plutôt simple. De base, sans que vous ne fassiez quoi que ce soit, votre personnage effectuera une attaque automatique dans un certain rayon. En cliquant, vous infligerez des dégâts supplémentaires. Enfin, il est possible d’utiliser des sorts si vous en disposez.

Chaque monstre possède un capital de cœurs, faisant office de barre de vie. A chaque attaque de votre part, ce capital de cœurs diminue. Des monstres disposeront d’une armure qu’il vous faudra d’abord casser, d’autres demanderont que vous brisiez leur sort, ou certains encore laisseront une aura de poison se répandre à leur mort. Bien entendu, c’est en cumulant ces différents effets et le nombre d’ennemis à l’écran que le défi grandira. En cas de mort, il vous faudra alors retourner chercher votre dépouille pour récupérer les cartes de votre barre d’action. Pour les plus téméraires, Book of Devils dispose du classique mode hardcore, nommé Daredevil pour l’occasion, qui propose une mort permanente.

[b]Des donjons « à la carte »[/b]

Book of Devil dispose d’une mécanique vous permettant des sessions de jeu adaptées à votre temps, le « Flexiscope ».
Lorsque vous terminez une série de donjons, une nouvelle série apparait. Vous devez alors choisir la taille de cette dernière : Very small, Small…

A chaque taille correspond une durée. Par exemple, « Very small » vous indiquera que la session prendra en moyenne 6 minutes, contre 12 minutes pour « Small ».
Bien entendu, plus la session sera grande, meilleures seront les récompenses : quantité minimale d’or, nombre de cartes et ingrédients pour le chaudron, taux de progression dans l’aventure.

28220508.review:
I had this title on my wishlist for a while without realizing that they offered a demo to play - if you're even the slightest bit curious, play the demo!  I immediately spent a couple of hours with the demo and when I reached the end of my trial run, I immediately dropped coin... and another 4 hours into playing, continuing my journey. 

It's now the day after and I'm here writing a review because I felt this game and the developers deserved one.  With that said, if you're a fan of hack and slash, actionRPGs, dumped countless hours into Diablo I or II, I think you'll recognize the charm.  Book of Demons captures what made those two entries successful.  If you've played Card Hunter, or any similar type "card" RPG - you'll recognize those gameplay elements at work here too.  There is a lot of "tongue-in-cheek" humor here, and again I say, a lot of charm that can be enjoyed by new players and veterans alike. 

The Flexiscope™ system is great.  This system allows you to choose the length of your quest.  So if you only have 5 or 10 minutes to spare, you can set Flexiscope to small and have a quick romp to scratch that itch, or if you have no time constraints, set it to it's highest option and sink some time into a foray through the dungeons... 

Never the same dungeon twice, a great selection of mobs, skills, and items.  For early access, this is a rare treat!  

Considering the amount of times I've been hoodwinked by larger productions offering less with a higher price tag, this purchase was a no-brainer.  I'm anxious to get back in a play some more!

27915872.review:
I took a chance on this little game because it looked interesting.
Wow, instantly hooked!

The world, Paperverse, is presented in an unique art style akin to a childrens paper pop-up book.
The music, sound design, and voice overs are well done.

A neat feature is that you can pick your gaming session length, whether it be ~10 minutes to over an hour.
Of course the longer you play the deeper you will go into the dungeon below.
Oh, the dungeon mazes are randomized as are the minions within.

You don't free move like you do in a traditional ARPG, but instead walk down a path like a board game pawn.
That being said, there is the possibility of getting caught with some interesting monsters on either side of your avatar that can trap you, 

Tread lighty.  :)

Only one class is available at this time, the Warrior, but two more are coming (Mage and Rogue).

10/10 - Will definitly be searching for loots in the future as a Mage or Rogue.

27909692.review:
Book of Demons is a beautiful homage to a classic 90s game: Diablo 1.

Return 2 Games (the developer) has managed to capture the essence of the original game and yet add to it their own special flair.

Combining the hack and slash action of the original with a new card system that seems to do right what later games have done wrong with a skill system. Cards are the lifeblood of your character; they're your items, spells, equipment, and skills. Equiping armor or weapons "reserves" some of your mana so you can cast fewer spells. It's a technique that has been done before, but it always carries some charm for me. The system seems quite well balanced and I'm looking forward to seeing how the mage and rogue classes play out.

If you loved Diablo 1 then give this game a try! It captures the mood, atmosphere, and gameplay splendidly while re-creating the whole in a unique way. I garauntee that you won't be disappointed (and if you're skittish then give the FREE DEMO a whirl).

~S~

27716056.review:
It’s nothing new to see games in early access these days. Once one started the trend of Alpha/Beta/EAing their games for essentially a preorder price they all did. What is rare to see is an Early access game that has as much polish and working game mechanics as Book of Demons.
ss_91c9958dfd4582e01c2bc5df7418e85218d51ac9-1920x1080

Book of Demons is a hack/slash, ARPG which boasts an impressive amount of customisation to your own requirements. I have sat down for a fair amount of time to see if it’s worth picking up and if you should hop on to help provide valuable feedback for this Early Access or to avoid at all costs… So far… Help them out with all the feedback. It’s fun and could be a winner guys.

The art style is charming and simplistic so it should be available to anyone with a machine, even if it’s a potato. The papercraft universe the appear to be building on keeps it simple but the animations and spell effects provide enough to show promise.

ss_bfa47e981fd1e85684acfd289634b97363cf67c0-1920x1080

On first log in you are met with a classic dungeon crawler ARPG setting (evil, plague, desolate towns blah blah) and a dungeon in the background. You click on it and you see that there is a progress bar (TO HELL) and you will see 2 key points (The cook and the Antipope) I assumed these as “Act” bosses and I was not wrong. Each time you play the game it’s split into a session on which YOU determine the length. You only have a quick 30 minutes? that’s fine. Set it to medium and it’ll give you enough content that will fill out a 30 minute slot, along with providing you some progress towards your next act boss. The more you choose to do, the more rewards, gold and progress. Simple!

ss_60bf772669557e76c149375dab82cd55164c3dd5-1920x1080

The combat is taught to you on your first few levels and it couldn’t be any simpler to start with. You click, you attack, it dies… This combat does evolve from a simplistic clickfest to actually using your keyboard for abilities and focusing or you’ll die. Death in the game is treated with classic dungeon crawler Hardcore (Daredevil) or normal mode. I opted for the balls of steel approach and was clenching rectally a few times…

As you progress you will earn cards. These cards act as spells, artifact or items and can be equipped to your action bar.

A consumable does not cost any mana but does spend a charge (replenished through RNGesus drops or via the fortuneteller)
A spell costs mana and will perform the function outline on the card (charge/bladestorms/mighty blow etc)
Artifact cards are essentially equipment cards and reserve mana but provided you have a card slot and the mana available will be active at all time
You start with only 3 slots available but can increase them through Deckard Ca…I mean…the Sage… *wink wink*

ss_73815aa7580cee8025d886686991364ba3cfd108-1920x1080

Each time you level up you only have 2 options. Health, or Mana. Whatever you didn’t choose is thrown into a “cauldron” and the barmaid back in town will keep it safe until you pay to get it. This will stack up but the cost will not until you purchase it. So the idea behind this is buy only when you need a big boost but there is the risk of dying and losing it all. (For Daredevils this is vital to balance!) Through your travels, you will be lucky and obtain +1 health/mana as a drop from bookshelves/chests and bosses.

The bosses appear to all have clearly outline abilities and when you reach the “Cook” it appears all mechanics taught to you through the act are used in one massive boss fight. This led to an interesting boss fight with actual mechanics.

Due to this game being in Early access, all of the above is subject to change but hopefully in great ways. I did not experience many issues in this early access game.

If any of the above didn’t sway you…it has a free demo. Literally, decide for yourself, but if you won’t be displeased.

Review from - Noobgrind. http://www.noobgrind.com/book-of-demons-early-access/

For a Indie dev, this Diablo clone has some intresting twists.

1) Everything is in a Paper/Card board cutout look, makes it fun not as a serious tone like Diablo.
2) You set how much you will be playing for the session.

27513671.review:
Review escrito el 25/11/16 el juego sigen en early access.

Debo decir, este juego es sorprendentemente divertido y adictivo, book of demons se puede describir como un hibrido entre diablo 2, hand of fate y cookie clicker. Bajen el demo para ver mas o menos de que va, es 1 hora de gampley gratis y tu save se transfiere al juego completo si lo compras.

Lo bueno:

+Loot variado! supongoq ue despus van a meter mas items, pero lo que logrado conseguir es basico pero suficiente para motivarme a buscar mas items.
+Excelente voice acting! (en ingles)
+El juego te permite elegir cuan larga quieres que sea tu secion de experiencia, lo pongo como un pro porque uno en los dungeons crawlers tiende a perder horas y a olvidar responsabilidades.
+Efectos de sonido y musica cumplidora, creo que lo hicieron parecerse lo mas a l diablo 2 posible a proposito, pero en realidad, me encanta.
+Buen balanceo del oro, en algunos juegos de este estilo o el oro te sobra o siempre te hace falta, en este el oro es justo para progresar, pero no demaciado como para hacerte super mega OP.
+El juego recompensa limpiar y matar absolutamente todo en los dungeons. Love it!
+La combinacion de build posibles que hasta ahora tiene el juego es super divertida de explorar.
+El juego periodicamente introduce nuevas mecanicas y enemigos, asi que el juego nunca se pone aburrido.

Lo malo:

-Al ser early access tiene algunos bugs, nada que te arruine la experiencia, pero lo suficiente para mencionarlo.
-Faltan algunos efectos de sonidos. (Es early access)
-Los tutoriales podrian ser mas informativos. (Early access coff coff)

Recomiendo este juego a cualquier fan de diablo que busque algo sencillo pero no facil.
8/10, si le agregan mas contenido al juego cuando salga de early access capaz le deje un 10/10

27398710.review:
J’ai beaucoup aimé Book of Demons.

Le rythme est un peu trop lent au départ, mais une fois que vous aurez suffisamment avancé, vous aurez tellement de choses à gérer en même temps à l’écran que vous serez bien occupé.

Le système Flexitron permettant de paramétrer au mieux les aventures suivant votre temps de jeu est absolument génial et j’ai vraiment hâte que l’archère et le mage sortent pour découvrir leurs spécificités.

Simple, joli, addictif, si vous aimez découper des monstres pour devenir toujours plus fort, je vous conseille d’y jeter un coup d’oeil. Les quelques minutes d’adaptation pour le déplacement du personnage passées, c’est du tout bon !

Lire ma preview complète sur [url=http://www.gamesidestory.com/2016/11/24/book-of-demons/]Game Side Story[/url]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLYpIkrqB9w

27312580.review:
This game is so simply fun.

It has very nice mechanics that could fit even into other modern dungeon crawlers, like choosing the lenght of your own adventure on "how to make your life miserable with you own hands" style.

At the moment it is a bit on the easy side, specially in early game, turning into a spawnfest larter one, but still remaining quite easy 'cause of the early powering up.

I don't actually like the gap within the "comedy" in the dungeon itself (like silly poems before bosses and the poopy coins) and the kind of silly seriousness of the npc back in town.
It would've been better to keep them on the comedic side too.

I don't know if it is intended to be like this, but the game ends up being a lot chaotic on later levels, with many clicks to do here and there 'cause of status effects, which reflect the silly nature of this adventure quite well honestly.

With more polish later on it will become a title worth its price, but i could suggest even buying it now, it is a nice way to spend some time.
