26449062.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Book of Demons is a hack & slash which pays homage to Diablo with a few twists - it is set in a paper-cut universe like in a pop-up book, and everything you can equip, use, do comes in the form of cards that you assemble into your loadout to conquer the said Paperverse. You start out with 3 card slots out of the maximum of 10 available. Card slots are unlocked using gold and cost incrementally more. As of the build I played (0.75.11062+), only the Warrior class is available. The other 2 classes - Mage and Rogue will be released at a later date according to the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/449960/discussions/0/355043117510126581/]roadmap[/url] but apart from this the game is pretty complete for an Early Access game. The total of 32 cards in the Warrior's arsenal are divided into Artifacts (equipment - e.g. weapons, armor, trinkets), Items (e.g. potions, bombs, town portal scroll) and Spells (e.g. Mighty Blow, Charge, Blade Storm). All Artifacts have a mana cost which effectively reduces your mana pool available for using Spells (Items have no mana cost). Leveling up allows you to increase your health or mana, which translates to taking more hits / casting more spells. You do not actually grow stronger by levelling up. Instead you increase in strength by discovering new cards or upgrading your existing cards using gold and runes you find.

[h1]Dungeoneering [/h1]
Your goal is of course to take care of The Archdemon that awaits you in the depths of hell. At major intervals you'll find 3 familiar main bosses of Diablo I - The Archdemon being the final boss. So how do the dungeons play out? 

The Flexiscope system let's you decide how big / long a session you wish to play and randomly generates an appropriate dungeon of that size / depth. The range available for selection goes from Very Small (2 floors, ~8 mins) to Very Big (~4-7 floors, ~40+ mins). Note that the progress / rewards are balanced across all sizes that you choose. What it really means is, even if you have only a few minutes Flexiscope will give you a dungeon that still fits your needs. Pure awesome! =)

You traverse the dungeons in set paths and eliminate the various enemies that you come across by clicking on them. Enemies with elements will have their own quirks e.g. fire enemies are easier to take out with a ice weapon equiped. Boss monsters are pretty fun too. They are like multi-stage enemies in that each stage brings out a different attack pattern / attribute. Having said that, being constrained to a set path can be annoying but for the most part the game has designed it's way around it fairly well. Unlike you, the enemies can swarm at you from all directions however you are given spells / items to get out of those difficult situations.

The one thing that did trouble me was the fact that [b]you cannot walk through enemies - they block your path[/b]. So if you're surrounded the only way you're getting out is to clear the enemies on either side. It sounds trivial but the combat mechanics of later enemies compound this problem. Shielded enemies can only be damaged after you take out their shields, enemies may charge at you or teleport onto you and archers will be raining death on to you whilst summoners add to their growing numbers. I think you can see how a situation can quickly get out of hand especially when your auto-attack can only hit 3 enemies at a time with a fully upgraded Shadow Sword (Artifact).

Once you complete Adventure Mode (by taking out The Archdemon), you unlock Freeplay mode and slowly you will unlock the higher difficulties which are made more difficult by forcing you to use a certain number of random cards during a session, having bosses which curse your cards rendering them useless while the boss lives and having harsh penalties for dying (gold loss, card loss, etc). Lastly if that isn’t enough of a challenge there’s Daredevil mode (equivalent of Diablo’s Hardcore mode) and a leaderboard for that.

[h1]Worldbuilding[/h1]
The NPCs available - Healer, Barmaid, Sage, Fortune Teller all have clear counterparts to Diablo (except The Healer). The links to Diablo are fairly obvious but are done tastefully in my opinion and I would think they must have chose the voice actors carefully. Reason being they sound remarkably similiar to the voices in Diablo but at the same time are clearly different (hope that makes sense!). It's a pity that they have limited lines of gossip to go through. There are cutscenes for each major boss and I think nobody gives the devs enough credit for the rhymes they put in there. =)

[h1]Conclusion [/h1]
All in all, it’s a good game that I hope becomes better with the remaining features on the roadmap. I think it would definitely help to have more cards and better balance (some upgrades feel less meaningful). Some have complained about the difficulty / lack of variety in the enemies and / or procedurally generated dungeons but personally I did not find this a problem. For the record, I did not encounter any bugs during my entire time with the game.

[EDIT] Although Adventure Mode can be completed without experimenting with the card combinations, the late game at higher difficulties requires understanding what combos are viable with the imposed hand. For example, if Blade Storm gets imposed. Do I build a powerful crowd control build - Blade Storm + Shadow Sword + Burning Axe / Frozen Flail or a more flexible build – Blade Storm + Dagger + Amulet of Mana? In either case, you are still free to swap out cards on the fly to adjust your build to the enemies you are currently facing. Conclusion : Late game is surprisingly well balanced and those hardcore achievements (no equiped cards / no healing) are truly difficult BUT achievable.

26427854.review:
할인기간에 구입해서 플레이 했었습니다. 보통의 앞서 해보는 게임이 가질 수 있는 
게임 내용의 부실은 느껴지지 않았고 제값하는(거짓말 조금 보태서^^) 게임의 느낌을 받았습니다.
추후 볼륨을 추가하고 유저의 의견을 반영해 밸런스, 인터페이스등을 개선해나간다면 
많은 인기를 끄는 게임이 될 수 있다고 봅니다.

클래스는 전사, rogue(도적?), 마법사가 있는데 현재 전사만 플레이 할 수 있습니다. 
전사는 초근접타격을 할 것 같지만 생각보다 긴 공격범위를 가집니다.
상자 혹은 몬스터를 잡으면 나오는 카드중에 물약, 장비, 마법 카드가 있는데 이것들은 캐릭터의 마나코스트를 요구합니다.
캐릭터 레벨을 올리고 템을 파밍하면서 카드 또한 최대 3단계까지 업그레이드 할 수 있고 옵션이 좋은 카드들을 장착해 
몹을 쉽게 잡을 수 있습니다.(ex 하나의 타격으로 여러명 동시타격+ 일정 확률로 즉사 카드조합)

스토리모드가 끝나면 현재 무한 모드를 진행할 수 있는데 
나름의 카드 핸디캡을 받으면서 이후 난이도를 진행할 수 있습니다.

2016년 12월 7일

현재 마법사도 할 수 있습니다

26414853.review:
[b][u]Wstęp[/u][/b] Book of Demons to taki tańszy Diablo na szynach z przyjaźnie nastawioną papierkową oprawą graficzną.

[b][u]Book of Demons[/u][/b] to oryginalny pomysł zrealizowany przez [u]"Thing Trunk"[/u] Który ma przypomnieć staremu pokoleniu wyśmienite gry z lat 90. Jej wczesne fazy rozwoju sięgają od Maja 2013 roku i będą trwać jeszcze pare ładnych lat, bo nasi rodacy nie planują przystąpić tylko na jednej grze, ale planują zrobić ich aż 7.

[b][u]O grze[/u][/b] BoD jest to niespotykany dotychczas Hack & Slash z bardzo ładną oprawą graficzną i elementami RPG czy nawet Rogue-like. W Book of Demons możemy wybrać 3 klasy, Wojownik, Mag czy Łotrzyca(Łucznik) dlatego, że to jest Early Access to chwilowo mag jak i łucznik nie jest dostępny. Klasycznie level'ujemy naszą postać i błądzimy po lochach, które są ciagle generowane losowo!

[b][u]Fabuła[/u][/b] Podobna do Diablo, wracamy po latach do swojego ukochanego domu, ale okazuje się, że ktoś obudził mroczną moc która ożywiła wszystkich umarlaków jako bohater musimy oczyścić lochy z wszelkiej złej mocy czyniąc to uratować nasz ukochany dom (Bardzo skrócona wersja) 

[b][u]Pozytywne uwagi[/u][/b]
* Możliwość przetestowania wersji Demo
* Interakcja i możliwość wpływu na tworzenie gry
* Wysoka aktywność twórców gry
* Bardzo płynnie chodzi 
* Polska wersja językowa dostępna


[b][h1]Aspekty, które mnie zachęciły do produktu[/h1][/b]
[b]+ Oprawa graficzna[/b] Wyśmienicie zrobiona, oryginalnie i zachęcająca do gry

[b]+ Losowość poziomów[/b] Za każdym podejściem gra generuje nam losowo nowe lochy

[b]+ Achievementy/Karty kolekcjonerskie[/b] 

[b]+ Urozmaicenie obiektów/potworów/umiejętności[/b] Pomieszczenia nie nudzą, potwory zaskakują, a umiejętności bohaterów jest mnóstwo! 

[b]+ Wysoko jakościowe dzwięki/soundtrack[/b] Widać, że jest dopracowane i tak ma być :)



[b][h1]Aspekty, które mnie odpychały od gry[/h1][/b]
[b]- Monotonność[/b] No jednak po paru godzinach grania odczuwasz, że już jednak robiłeś to pare rozgrywek temu

[b][strike]- Brak prawdziwej losowości[/strike][OBALONE][/b] Rzeczy/Karty które dostajemy mogą wydropić na poziomie w którym aktualnie możemy jej użyć, szkoda wydropić karte której nie możemy użyć przez pare godzin bo nasz level jest za niski.

[b]- Wczesny Dostęp[/b] Wczesny dostęp odpycha wielu graczy, są z nią wiele obaw typu: Twórcy zostawią produkt nieukończony.

[h1]Pas le temps[/h1]

🍙🍣🥄 Vraiment magnifique ! Très très bel hommage à Diablo !

____________________________

barème à titre indicatif (c'est un ressenti personnel - sans 🍴🍹 aux évaluations négatives)

🍙🥄 juste un bol de temps en temps mais pas tous les jours

🍙🍣🍱🍹😍 (vous je sais pas mais) jusqu'à l'indigestion
____________________________

[h1]Le temps d'un café[/h1]

Super l'idée de découper les donjons en portions de taille variable pour ceux qui veulent jouer 20min avant de faire autre chose.
La démo est bien représentative du jeu. 14€ en soldes c'est très honnête pour une telle qualité.
L'histoire dure que 6-7h ? C'est pas grave, l'histoire de Diablo est pas longue non plus et les hack'n'slash, c'est fait pour y rejouer en boucle.
C'est vraiment le plus cadeau (pas du dev, c'était pas gratuit) que je pouvais recevoir hier. Déjà hâte d'y retourner ! \o/

edit 4/11 : histoire terminée une fois avec le guerrier 9-10h pour indication, mais peut-être que vous jouez plus vite, je prends le temps de tout ramasser.
Et les devs sont sympas, ils semblent très à l'écoute sur le forum steam du jeu.

edit 06/12 : le mage est là, manque plus que l'archer !

edit 14/01 : (va vers le 🍙🍣🍱🥄 quand il sera fini) Ci-dessous une liste de demandes faites aux devs pour savoir si c'était possible ou prévu, avec les réponses :

◇ possibilité de se téléporter pour les magiciens ou comme compétence rare pour les autres héros => fait, mais seul le mage peut se téléporter et seulement sur la route, pas en dehors sur les côtés malheureusement
◇ des pluies de météores de feu, de glace, des pics de glace qui tombent du ciel, un pouvoir comme le nova de d2 pour congeler les ennemis autour => fait
◇ raccourcis pour attribuer les cartes aux boutons de la souris/clavier => à venir
◇ un système de maîtrise ou double maîtrises comme dans TQ/Grim dawn => n'aura pas lieu
◇ réduire le délai pour ramasser l'or => en fait il suffit de passer la souris sur l'or sans cliquer pour le ramasser
◇ plus de runes plus ou moins rare avec des mots runiques => plus de runes à venir
◇ un compagnon avec une aura offensive/défensive => compagnon dispo pour le mage, aura à vérifier
◇ des objets de différentes qualités, armures, casques, etc. à équiper sur les différentes parties du personnage => n'aura pas lieu
◇ un monde secret => très probablement à venir
◇ le canard de bain en boss => pas sûr mais peut-être à venir

26323397.review:
Hay algo más peligroso que tomar el sol en la vía del metro?.Yo diría que sí que lo hay, se trata de hacer un homenaje en el mundo de los videojuegos.Generalmente, los homenajeados son títulos que han marcado un género y a una generación entera.Si te limitas a hacer un copia y pega... más te vale irte buscando una cueva en Marte porque te despellejarán diciendo que para copias insulsas, mejor el original.Si te dedicas a meter cambios aquí y allá, píllate una cueva también, pero esta vez más hacia Júpiter, porque habrás hecho algo aún peor... destrozar la esencia de un juego.

¿Existe alguna manera de hacer un homenaje sin salir trasquilado en el intento?.A decir verdad no soy desarrollador, ni trabajo en el mundo del videojuego, pero la manera en la que los chicos de Book of Demons lo han hecho, me parece bastante acertada.

Pongámonos en situación, el concierto de hoy homenajea a Diablo 1. Describir lo que ha supuesto este videojuego me llevaría más letras que toda la saga de Harry Potter en élfico, así que por mi salud,voy a dar por hecho de que tod@s lo conocemos. A modo de resumen, diré que más le vale que no le salga ni un sólo gallo al grupo lo suficientemente pirado para hacer algo así, o no van a recibir una lluvia de tomates, sino de calabazas de Hallowen cargadas por el mismísimo Duende Verde.

Lo primero en lo que uno se fijaría es en la estética de semejantes temerarios. Pues bien, te diré que tanto el entorno como los personajes son como de papel, parecen sacados de una serie de dibujos animados de un canal de esos para los  más peques.

Aquí es cuando empiezas a sangrar por los ojos y a montarte tu ritual a los Dioses Oscuros para que castiguen semejante insulto... Yo te diría que antes de que cierres el pentagrama con la cabra dentro,  te tranquilizases un momento.
El concierto tiene lugar en un pueblo acojonado porque se ha despertado un mal muy chungo, sus habitantes ofrecerán ayuda a la persona con las pedradas suficientes en la cabeza como para investigar ese mal y entre tanto, tendrán tiempo para rajar de sus vecinos.La fuente del mal parece ser una Iglesia en la que han mezclado clorhídico con sulfúrico y la han "liao parda".¿Te va tranquilizando un poco?.

¿Quién va a acudir a semejante festival?.Pues están invitados esqueletucos y otros no muertos con ganas de tirarte los dientes.Como toda gran banda, hay unas groupies que se hacen llamar Súcubos, ¿te acuerdas de ellas?. Esas demonios ligeritas de ropa que no hacían otra cosa que levantarte migrañas de la mucha lata que daban.Hasta hay un palco VIP en el que está algún que otro jefote mítico del título original.

¿Entonces por qué iban a querer convertir tu título de culto en un libro de Teo y su familia van al Santuario del Mal?.Realmente no tengo una respuesta que te haga dormir más tranquil@, pero te diré que no se cómo, pero este motor logra captar la esencia del titulo de Blizzard a la vez que es capaz de ser original.Supongo que tiene algo de eso que llaman personalidad. Es un motor gráfico diseñado de cero para la ocasión, su optimización es buena, y a pesar de su "infantilismo" a primera vista es capaz de ponernos en tensión porque el juego es tan adulto como el que más ya que por mucho dibujito de cartón aquí o matas peña de ultratumba, o te unes tú a ella, porque mucha risa y todo lo que tú quieras pero aquí también hay su modo con Permadeath.

¿Todavía tienes la cabra berreando en tu habitación?.Yo te diría que sueltes el cuchillo  y escuches antes de lo que te tengo que decir, porque con este homenaje se le ha intentado quitar algo de hierro al asunto, por no decir que hasta tiene un toque cómico. Hay muchos ejemplos, pero quizá el más claro sea que aquí, el mismísimo Diablo pasa sus tardes libres en su bañera de lava con un pato de goma.Si has sobrevivido al ictus que te ha producido leer esto y buscas respuestas, te diré lo mismo que antes.No tengo ninguna que te llegue a complacer, sólo te puedo decir que no enturbia para nada la experiencia matademonios que se le presupone a un jeugo así.

Y si has llegado hasta aquí sin completar tu ritual oscuro o sin desangrarte por leer tanta herejía, creo que te mereces que te cuente un poco sobre las mecánicas del juego.

En la versión final tendrás 3 personajes a elegir ( actualmente sólo el  Guerrero está disponible y próximamente meterán un mago y una arquera).Los personajes van a entrar en la iglesia a repartir ostias sagradísimas e irán encontrando equipo, potis y encantamientos. Todos ellos están representados con cartas pero el impacto que tiene esto respecto a un juego de loot tradicional no varía demasiado. Las cartas de hechizo te consumirán maná al utilizarse y los de equipamiento de darán propiedades extra además de ayudarte a reventar a los poco amigables inquilinos de la Iglesia.

Sin embargo,a lo largo de tus aventurás encontrarás muchas más cartas que equipo de inventario tienes, aquí es dónde entra en juego el tema cartas.El equipo que no utilices aquí no lo venderás sino que pasará a formar parte de tu mazo y antes de iniciar una aventura, podrás quitar y poner las cartas que más te gusten para ir probando combinaciones.

¿Me parece esto una decisión acertada?, pues la verdad es que sí.El ansia por conseguir nuevo botín se logra mantener durante la partida, el equipo no es numerosísimo pero sí que te permite experimentar diferentes combinaciones y además se puede mejorar varios niveles mediante runas que irás encontrando y desbloquear así nuevas bonificaciones.En definitiva,cartas sí, pero sigue siendo un juego de buscar y equiparse loot para ir lo más cheto posible.

¿Y como de difícil va a ser salvar al mundo ( o al menos al pueblo de 5 amigotes al que has llegado)?, pues la dificultad Normal no creo que te suponga ningún problema. Sin embargo, las dificultades superiores además de pincharles esteroides en el culete a tus enemigos introducen unas mecánicas bastantes peculiares.Por ejemplo, algunos jefes bloquearan ciertas cartas, por lo que no podrás usarlas lo que dure el combate, otras veces al iniciar un run se te "obligara" a usar X cartas sí o sí, con lo que tendrás que crear un mazo a partir de ellas, en definitiva, se le van añadiendo toques de roguelike que creo que le dan bastante salsilla al asunto.

Una vez que termines las dificultades principales, se desbloquea un modo "infinito", en el que la muerte es permanente y según lo lejos que llegues obtendrás una puntuación para competir en leaderboards, o dicho de otra manera, esto se supone que es el denominado endgame. Aquí poco te puedo decir porque hay gente a la que esto el dará para muchas horas y otra que pasará de ello olímpicamente.

Por último, los desarrolladores planean añadir cartas más raras de encontrar que un español que no adore la siesta ( para motivar algo más el farmeo), retocar algo el endgame y añadir todas las clases que faltan.

En definitiva, Book of Demons me parece un homenaje necesario a uno de los titulos que marcaron una época.El homenaje tiene suficientes puntos para ser considerado original sin llegar a perder la esencia.
Parafraseando al gran Sinatra... I did it my way!!!

26279607.review:
I had put this off for a bit when I initially saw it pop up in EA and decided to pick it up after finally getting a little hands on with the demo to actually get a feel for what it is. Everything about this game just feels "comfy". The papercraft assets all pop into place with nice little sounds, the clicks and pops of the UI all have a nice feel as you go through them, and theres a lot of little touches to the UI and play experience that show some definite thought was put into the player experience beyond the gameplay. As far as the gameplay itself, its a more straightforward ARPG thats more about staying alive, reacting appropriately to enemy types and managing your cards as you progress, rathe than furiously clicking and seeing huge numbers pop up everywhere. Character advancement is more about gathering the cards, upgrading them, and making subtle adjustments over grinding gear (there is no "gear" to speak out outside of the cards which have rarity). Its a bit more laid back but definitely pleasant. The setting and story have kept pretty true to having that "storybook" feel it's going for, with the game maintaining its own sense of identity and charm while not feeling overly cheesy with references. 

I've still got quite a bit to go with it as of this review, but it's a damn charming game and I wanted to say something about it. I actually had no idea about the Return 2 Games project part of all this until I had booted up the game for the first time and it's a very neat concept. I'd love to see what they do with the other books planned in the future. The planned "popup sandbox) looks like it will also be an amusing addition. As someone who's a sucker for unlocking, collecting, and arranging trophies, having a little popup book area you can pose and screenshot your own little papercraft unlocks is a cool plan I hope ends up panning out. 

tl;dr: Solid little ARPG that looks and feels like a storybook, definitely worth giving the demo a shot if you remotely seem into it.

Les graphismes et le deisgn général sont vraiment très bons. On dirait (et je crois que c'est volontaire) un clone "papier" de Diablo. La musique, les sons et surtout les voix des acteurs sont vraiment bien.
Le tutorial est bien fait. Il est simple et bien presenté.

Le seul bémol... C'est qu'on se contente de se balader sur un chemin prédéfini en cliquant sur des mobs. Il y'a bien une originalité dans la façon de les combattre, mais on se sent vraiment privé d'une liberté et d'une nervosité qui sont normalement des caractères obligatoires du hack n' slash. Ca me fait un peut penser à un rail shooter. C'est joli, mais chiant.

Je n'ai pas encore assez joué pour parler du loot, mais le système de cartes est rafraichissant bien qu'un peu confus (cartes à recharger, d'autre non, etc ...).

Le générateur de donjon est génial. C'est quelque chose que j'aimerais revoir dans d'autres jeux du genre.

En bref je suis un peu déçu, je m'attendais à quelque chose qui allait me passionner. Je laisse tout de même un avis positif, car le jeu dispose de nombreuses innovations qui méritent d'être découvertes.

26124508.review:
I actually put aside Grim Dawn to beat this game before, of course, jumping back to Grim Dawn. I missed the awesomeness that was Diablo II. But I've tried to make up for that by playing Diablo III, Grim Dawn, Path of Exile, etc. When I found this game, I was immediately drawn to the ability to set managable time limits for dungeon crawling. You set how long you want to play for and the game will unfold a series of paths that are approximately the amount of time you have. 

The whole card thing is a little played out, but fits really well with the paper craft style. Upgrading cards, unlocking new slots, constantly becoming more powerful as you venture into Hell is all very well done. Is the a little more involved than casual, and not "holy crap" complicated like Path of Exile's point system. It's a nice middle ground for people who want to kill stuff, level up, and dungeon crawl on a time limit. Have to study? Have a kid? This lets you set the length of your adventure! Stop any time, or make it longer. I love that about this game.

I cannot wait for the other classes to be added! This is a very polished early access. It's missing two classes and perhaps a bit more cards. Other than that, I haven't experience any bugs of glaring issues.

26087483.review:
tl;dr: fun and pretty, this is how diablo 3 should be.

Long version:
The game is made to look like a pop-up book and it dos that right. From an unfolding effect at the beginning of the level to the way monsters fell apart after death the art is consistent and simply looks great. 

Hero moves on the path only which makes dodging arrows coming parallel to path tricky but in general is way less annoying than I thought when I picked the game up. Controlling the hero used to be finicky after launch back when I got the game but devs obviously were hard at work because there were multiple updates in the last two months and most issues are fixed (not to mention lots of new content). 

Combat-wise it's a clicker arpg but with many interesting extra mechanics that are introduced one by one and prevent the game from becoming boring. Can't say how it made me play for 3 hours straight when I have work to do but it somehow did. 

Recommended.

26086050.review:
Overall Book of Demons is a very nifty dungeon crawler reminicent of Diablo 2 in style. The game's focus on user availability and time is also something I find very positive. It has a good sense of humour and the late game becomes very in depth with character builds. The risk reward system also bring some added tension to every single floor you go through. A good game to spend some time on both if you are really into it or just a casual game to past the time. 

There are some cons as well such as some frustrating RNG enemies which give immediate unavoidable damage but this happens few times and the enemies don't take huge amount of chunks out of your health. Battles at times may also seem insurmountable, especially on character death and you lose all items and you have to go gather them without any. This may cause people going back to earlier levels and have to farm up again. However, this is most likely just a personal gripe and not a bad in game function.

Above all, the creators of the game are constantly interacting with their community and making changes based on their feedback. Overall this game is a solid 7.5/10 and can be enjoyable in short bursts or long bursts of time.

25960600.review:
[h1]A Tribute to the Golden Age of Gaming[/h1]

Thing Trunk, the developers behind Book of Demons, has undertaken a large multi-game series project named Return 2 Games. This series of 7 games (Books) take heavy inspiration from the "golden days" of gaming, each a tribute to a single hit game from the 90s. Although these Books will be self-contained and unique in their own right, they will all share a "grand vision," set in a stylish paper-cut universe. Book of Demons marks the release of the first Book in the Return 2 Games project.

Book of Demons is a fully voiced, Hack & Slash ARPG dungeon crawler coupled with deck-building aspects. Collect skill cards and upgrade them in order to save the world from demonic annihilation. Currently in Early Access, this ARPG manages to provide a very fun take on a popular classic many know and love, Diablo. In its current state, only one of three classes are unlocked (Warrior); however, the single-player campaign is complete, and nearly all of the spell cards are available. The story is mostly provided in bits and pieces through NPC gossip and creature descriptions throughout the duration of the campaign, along with minor cut scenes from the 3 major bosses. The bulk and core content comprising the gameplay focuses on pure, unadulterated, Hack & Slash dungeon crawling with intermittent trips to the town for healing and upgrades.

[h1]Fight to Loot Another Day[/h1]

When you first venture into the deep unknown, the Flexiscope system will make itself known. This system aids in tailoring the upcoming set of procedurally generated dungeon levels to match a desired playtime. Although it will take a few tries to hone in on your playstyle, this innovative system manages to do a great job designing to your needs. Almost every end-game dungeon generation and boss fight length approximation was spot on. The game increases your time in the dungeon based on increasing the dungeon's physical map size, creature density, and number of creature types. Larger dungeons will reward you with more obtainable gold and chests. 

Book of Demon's combat is fairly simplistic. With only your health and mana to manage, BoD's take on Diablo's combat system takes shape in the form of a static deck-building system (deck is not randomized), along with predetermined and confined movement paths. As opposed to a traditional skill bar filled with skills and consumables, BoD utilizes unlockable card slots to equip skill cards. These skill cards come in the form of pseudo-consumables that must be recharged, spells, and equipment. They must also be individually discovered as loot from your dungeon crawling expeditions. In an ARPG with minimal story elements, the goal is to foster a loot/combat-based addiction in order to motivate progression, and I feel that the developers did a great job in making me feel like a loot junkie. Almost every droppable item will be useful in some shape or form, and the creature mechanics are extremely varied between races. Certain creatures have shields that must be physically targeted with your cursor before damage can be dealt directly to the creature itself. Other monsters can be categorized by their tendencies to jump, charge, warp, spell cast, or spawn henchmen.

After defeating the Archdemon, you will unlock Freeplay along with 4 different difficulty levels (Normal, Hard, Nightmare, and Massacre). Everything carries over, and the new mode allows you to generate dungeons from each of the 3 different locations (Labyrinth, Catacombs, Hell). Defeating the bosses in higher difficulties, collecting all remaining cards, player levels, and achievements will add a lot of extra playtime while waiting for the rest of the Early Access content to unlock.

[h1]Early Access Advice[/h1]

There is an aspect of micro-management in combat that is very fun, and it revolves around the poison, dazed, disrupt, and knocked loose mechanics. These mechanics are implemented by: breaking your poison status (click on health pool), recovering the stars (floating around when dazed), interrupting enemy spell casts (by discharging their cast bubbles), and re-orientating your cards when knocked loose. These mechanics help break up the Hack & Slash monotony; however, this can quickly turn into a clicker game when swarms of creatures start to overwhelm you. For most ARPGs, a single auto attack will instakill grunt-type enemies. Imagine the tedium when a basic grunt takes 3+ hits to kill, while managing a swarm of them on top of much deadlier, spell casters, bowmen, or boss creatures mucking things up. To make things worse, you are also confined to a 2 directional path, so strafing is out of the question. There are certain items that will alleviate the strain when under a swarming ambush (extra phantom attacks, etc.); however, there needs to be a scatter auto-attack weapon, a weapon with a skill shot/aoe placement, or a weapon that can instakill enemies so that the fighting doesn't begin to feel tiresome. Providing more cards that can alter the character’s auto attack properties is also desirable.

Regarding the dungeons themselves, one major downside I have seen in almost every procedurally generated game is the lack of hand-crafted or detailed scenery and events, and upon closer inspection, Book of Demons shows this with too similar environments regardless of room layouts. It takes a little too long to change locations, and combat begins to feel like a chore since nothing special really happens until you reach the area boss (only 3 in the game). A new creature here or there really helps stem this feeling of repetitiveness, although if only for a short while. More interaction with the dungeons would also alleviate some of the strain, such as incorporating puzzle, lever, or switch-type elements along with dynamic tile-changes (moving platforms, trap doors, etc.).

[h1]Complete Walkthrough Playlist[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cu2K7KBirQI&index=1&list=PLeavCsRFiP54QIqz4aK8be2rzDdGoLdtp 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

With so many weaknesses covered regarding combat mechanics and procedural generation, it's important to know that Book of Demons still does a lot of things well. Don't let my previous scatterbrained thoughts paint a dreary image about this game, because I still had a blast making my way to the Devil's hot tub. The Antipope fight and lair leading up to the boss contained some really fun gameplay elements. In that specific area, your first encounter with the Antipope starts with him scattering all of your cards throughout the dungeon, forcing you to trek through the darkness recovering them all. This was a definite stroke of genius on the developers’ part, as it not only provided a unique twist, but it also made me appreciate cards that I never thought had much usefulness.

The most important thing to take away from this is that Book of Demons still has an amazing and very solid foundation for improvement, and since the game is still in development, there is a chance that the developers will manage to improve the weaker areas. Adding more cards and classes will already make the game have much more replayability, but to improve the depth, it really needs more story, side objectives, locations, and true boss fights. Fortunately, these ideas are listed in their long-term roadmap of planned features. Going back to what the game does right, the card-based combat and equipment system is fairly refreshing to use, and enables an addictive loot-based progression system. The Flexiscope system also manages to create dungeons in such a way to match your available playtime. Taking all of this into consideration, I am able to confidently recommend Book of Demons to fans of the dungeon-crawling/Hack & Slash ARPG genres.

[table][tr][td]Press copy provided by Thing Trunk[/td][/tr][/table]

25734476.review:
For me, this game is nostalgiac and in my (not so) humble opinion has it's own rather new and unique twist on the gameplay.

I wasn't entirely sure  that I was going to enjoy this new interpretation... After all, Diablo spawned what felt like an entirely new genre of video games.  I would constantly fall back to this as my measuring stick on what a great Hack and Slash game was meant to be.  There were many great games that came after Diablo
 Titan Quest (+ the add-on) was a pretty good 'clone', but really it deserved it's own place for it's rather decent go at greek Mythology.

25628145.review:
Fun game :D

Awesome art style, interesting rails-based gameplay mechanics offer an interesting spin on the hack & slash ARPG format as does the in depth upgradable and switchable card system, which allows you to loadout/modify your character in different ways. Cards are found as you progress through the game, and there are other collectables that can be used to upgrade your cards/abilities. Passive cards take a flat amount of constant mana from your meter whereas active cards use an amount of mana based on what level they are at. 

Only con so far is I'm kinda impatient for the other character classes to be added, (Only warrior since Early Access launch,  rogue and wizard to be added before release) and that has made me want to stop playing until they're added. That's a personal issue with the game. I don't know whether this will influence you, but I'm a bit disappointed (but understanding) of the delays of the class updates.

Get it now if you're happy to be able to only play a complete game with a single class. If not, definitely buy it when it's finished because what is there now is an enjoyable experience so far.

25580381.review:
I very much enjoy this game. It has the strategy of a card game with the craziness of Diablo. Very satisfying to clear a floor or beat up a whole group of enemies. Very much looking forward to getting new content. Do note that it is early access, so there are plenty of features which have not been implemented. If they keep up as they have been, it seems like this will be a game to watch.

Edited after Oct 30th ish update.

This game has gotten a lot of depth with the inclusion of imposed cards, cursed cards, and the leaderboard. 

Daredevil mode keeps you interested and on the edge of your seat. If you die, you die. thats it. you gotta start over. Every move counts.

The imposed cards (cards you have to take) and cursed cards (cards made unusable by bosses while they are alive) makes this game into one of the rare games where, while there may be an op combination or two or three or seven, there is no "right" hand that you have to take everytime. Very often I find myself switching cards just because I can. 

Lastly the community is one of the best parts of this game. Konstanty responds within 24 hours and the rest of the community is always ready to help you with anything you need.

TLDR give it a good solid try, I think you will find it much more enjoyable than one might think :D

25412170.review:
This game is an utter piece of crap!  The game is a Diablo-clonelike with none of the fun because there's no freedom of movement. You run the track provided and thats it.  Combat is slow as molasses and requires intense precision because of the "hold and strike" mouse action required.  Two thirds of the classes are missing (no mage and no rogue).  The death penalty is losing your most valuable cards, and if you die in route to picking them up...they're just gone.  That last one actually pissed me off the most...so now I gotta rerun the random dungeon from the beginning again to get the cards I lost when I died?...two deaths and I lost 2/3 of my cards.  You have to TOTALLY ALTER your playstyle to get back to your corpse with whatever cards you may have left. What a completely stupid idea, Devs!

Be smart...wait until this game hits the bargain bin...or better yet...don't buy it at all!  This game just builds frustration.
25412170.developer_response:
Hi! 

Your cards are never lost in the story mode :-) When you die en route to pick them up from your grave they will be moved to your new resting pace for faster pickup. Equipped cards dropping by your corpse mechanic is meant to encourage you to test new combos. Not to mention it's a little tribute to items dropping on death in the original Diablo. 

You probably didn't check your inventory after picking the first tombstone or overlooked them. Cards should be there :-) No one reported this as confusing before it would be prudent to add a hint about this in-game. Thanks!

There is no "hold and strike" mouse action either - you can either click or click and hold (and as long as you hold the button you can move your cursor away from the monster, it remains targeted and you will keep striking it). 

We are in the forums, drop by and ask if you have any questions :-)

25409449.review:
I honestly dont know why I'm enjoying this game so much.

I've played many Action RPG's and I enjoy almost all of them.
This game takes the concepts from those and just does it differently.

You're stuck on a rail, well, you can go in different directions, but you stay on a rail.
You kill lots of baddies and collect loot.
However, the loot is card based, which are either abilities that cost mana or equipment that buff your character but take up mana points (so you cant use as many abilities).

There shouldn't be a reason for this game to be so good, there just shouldn't.
It simplifies and recreates elements from ARPG'sin a way that makes it different, but still the same in some way.
And it just feels so damn good.

Its definitely worth a look if you love ARPG's or if you're just into weird but good indie games.

The card mechanic serves as equipment and spells, I think the system works quite well although it could use more content (currently only 1 class is available but more are in development). 25372426.review:
A charming little throw back to the classic action rpg Diablo. Only done in a beautiful paper pop-up book aesthetic. 

Gameplay: Semi on rails you take your hero down various corridors and hallways to slay monsters, level up and collect loot. Loot in this case is mainly gold and of course cards. Cards consist of your abilities. (A nice feature as it gives lots of ways to play the game!) And rune cards, which are used as a means to upgrading said ability cards coupled with a gold sum.

The game shows an amazing amount of promise and the devs certainly deserve to be recognized for it's beautiful aesthetic and really addicting, easy to get into gameplay. 

Another incredibly nice feature is this game is great for if you have small amount of time as you can select how much you want to progress from simple 5 minute sessions to 45. 

The devs have also been very vocal on the steam forums about questions, curiosities, concerns, feedback be it negative or positive. It's a refreshing thing to see after so many atrocious games both in early access and fully released as of late.

25369914.review:
Although I'm always wary of early access titles, I decided to give this one a go, based on the good reviews, interesting aesthetic, and general theme (I love dungeon crawlers!). And am I glad I did! I am absolutely loving this gem of a game and I can't wait to see more of it.

I have to say that for an early access game, this one has a ton of content already. I really like how they have implemented feedback within the game, so you don't even have to go to the forums if you find any niggles or come up with suggestions as you play. The immediate impression I got from the game is that the developers have poured a lot of love, hard work, and attention to detail into this game. The price did initially look a little steep, but after having a good look at how much work has gone into the game, I think it's more than fair.

The backstory of the game goes along your generic Diablo-esque trend: you are an adventurer trying to defeat the forces of evil. The game's approach to dungeoneering, however, is very novel, as it features progress through a combination of stat improvements and cards that you can equip (and level up on their own). While the concept is simple, it is incredibly well implemented, and very well balanced, even at this stage. The subtle humour and gorgeous design (which reminds me a bit of Paper Mario) make it stand out from the crowd even further.

In brief:

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Gorgeous design! Lots of attention to detail.
[*]Gameplay that adjusts to how much time you can spare.
[*]Balanced combat and learning curve, and a progression that feels natural.
[*]Nice soundtrack.
[*]Great developers, involved with the community, they have even implemented an in-game [*]feedback system. You really couldn't ask for better on this front.
[*]Good replayability value (especially when the other classes are implemented).
[/list]

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Movement/combat (with mouse/keyboard) feels a little awkward at the beginning, until you get used to it. Perhaps it's more natural using a controller.
[*]Some content is still not accessible (obviously, as the game is not finished, but take it into account before buying!)
[/list]

At this stage I'd give it a 9/10, and strongly encourage you to buy it, if you want to be involved in the game's development, or keep an eye on it for when it's released.

Bardzo jestem ciekaw co pozostałe 6 książek doda do tej inicjatywy. 25347920.review:
History will show that I do not really write reviews - not that I'm lazy, but being a "Legendary Gamer" in terms of time ( not skill ) that I have been playing since the ZX Spectrum - it has to be something worthwhile.

I once brought Diablo for the PS4, lovely little game until I clicked that it was just the same thing over and over.  No sense of any real completion - just grinding.

I love games like this, Nethack, Rogue and anything like that. Hours and hours have been put into them and many ASCII characters have lain slain and destroyed by myself and the "k".

The Book of Demons was the first game in a long while that captured the experience for me.  Today I have put a solid two hours into this since purchasing it.  I got as far as the first major boss, The Cook.

The first thing that jumped out at me was the variations on the monsters, you know things got fairly exciting for my hands as they danced across the keyboard and clicked insanely on the mouse to ensure that I was the champion of the fight.

The graphics are very retro, they remind me of a cross between some elements of those silly PSX sackboy games and paper mario where characters are like cardboard monsters.  The sound effects as well were perfect for the graphic style of game and everything seemed to blend like a smooth cup of coffee and a plate of custard creams before you go to bed.

I loved the fact that I posted on the board asking for an endless NetHack type mode and had an immediate response from the developers on this game.

The price to me is absolutely worth this.  I could get five tubes of Pringles ( mixed flavours ) and have about one hour and forty three minutes of eating time with enough tubes to make several WiFi signal boosters or a stupid amount of gametime with this that I can return to, time and time again.

You know what - this game wins hands down and I am delighted with my purchase.

25344456.review:
A nice indie (yet solid) take on hack&slash genre.
It is based mostly on Diablo 1 by the looks of it, but with a simple walking mechanism and card system
instead of skills.
Killing mobs and getting loot is just as rewarding though. The game feels like a light parody of Diablo,
but it is still a complete experience.
It offers the ability to create random dungeons in smaller or longer chunks. The game learns how you play and is quite accurate in estimating how long the next dungeon will take you to finish.
If you don't have too much time to grind in diablo, you can take 10 minutes of Book Of Demons and complete one dungeon, or you could dedicate more time if you wish. (Something similiar we could see in Dungeons of Dredmore).

There is a was array of enemies, that keep you from getting bored too quickly. Seeing as this is an Early Access game, I am relieved that there were no bugs I could find myself.
So far, you can play as a warrior, but it seems that two other classes are in the making.

I highly recommend watching this title as it progresses towards the full release.

25236096.review:
I'm surprised at how much I'm enjoying Book of Demons, and I definitely recommend it. However, I do want to make sure that other buyers of the game understand what they're getting. I was looking for a new game with controller support in the dungeon crawling and hack and slash genres, and this game came up. That's not exactly accurate, though.

Book of Dungeons is understandably a dungeon crawler, because it takes place for the most part in dungeons that go deeper and deeper as the game progresses. However, it's also a CCG with turn-based combat. A variety of monsters are encountered and unlocked in the bestiary as you progress through the game, and cards of varying uses and rarity are obtained and utilized to build your deck. Players will be able to equip more cards as the game progresses and card slots are unlocked with gold and loot drops.

Combat is turn-based and automatic, so your only options as a player during combat are to move in a grid-like formation along a path to avoid and/or target enemies and projectiles, use consumable cards (like health and mana) click a button to disarm a shield or interrupt a spell to make an emeny vulnerable, or use an ability card, like a spell. No offensive combat happens while your character is in motion, so your choice is to be still and attack or maneuver around to avoid/engage enemies and obtain loot. That's not exactly, "Hack and slash" to me, and I have a hunch that this would be confusing to other players as well. Since I paid full price for my copy, and didn't get what I thought I was buying, I want to be very clear about what this game actually is.

In regard to controller support, the tag is accurate that this game currently provides partial controller support. You will still need a mouse and/or keyboard to access menus, such as those used to level up your character, switch out cards, and upgrade or identify cards. The controller support that is provided works very well. I didn't have any issues on that front, and I would bet that a Steam Controller or controller mapping program could be used for the remaining functions if a gamer was so inclined.

A positive aspect of the game is that it doesn't require a lengthy gaming session to enjoy. Games range from a few minutes to very long, and the player has the ability to set these parameters. Those with short attention spans and those who "bounce" between games will appreciate that the developers provided this feature. I know I certainly do.

Graphically, the game is beautiful. I love the angular features of the characters and scenery. It really does look like a world all its own, and it's fun to be a part of it. Overall, I'm having a lot of fun with it, and since I don't usually enjoy turn-based games of any kind, this is a testament to how very well this game has been developed. 

It's a great combination of a lot of different elements, but it's really not categorized very well for browsing by tags. Of the dungeon crawling and hack and slash tags that have been attributed to this game, it's neither one nor the other. I'd classify it as a CCG with turn-based combat and dungeon crawling elements, with the dungeon environment and looting being fundamental to the game. 

Most games have elements of other genres, like strategy, which is common and can be attributed to nearly any game, so I realize categorization isn't as simple as it once was. That's not necessarily a bad thing. In fact, a lot of great gaming combinations are available now, like one of my favorites which is actually an RPG/Pinball mashup. So while I don't believe these genre fusions are a negative thing, I do think that more attention should be paid to categorization, tags, and descriptions. Games like this with a $20 price tag aren't so easy to dismiss when "unwrapping" a game that isn't quite what you thought you had at the checkout.

25210741.review:
[h1] Diese Review wurde zuletzt am 28.08.2016 bei Version (0.71.10.10477+) aktualisiert und es könnte sich bereits was verändert haben, bitte schaut euch die Patchlogs an falls neuere Versionen verfügbar sind[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Book of Demons handelt es sich um einen Action Dungeon Crawler bei dem man von einem Dorf aus über eine Kirche den Weg bis in die Hölle kommen muss um den Erzdämonen zu töten. Das ganze funktioniert indem man sich verschiedene Dungeonbereiche über das sogenannte "Flexiscope" erstellt und diese dann abschließt.

[h1]Das Bewegungssystem[/h1]
Man kann sich mit der Maus oder mit der Tastatur bewegen. Das Spiel hat vorgegebene Pfade in denen man laufen kann. Bereits betretene Wege werden mit grauen Fußspuren markiert und wenn ein Pfad abegschlossen ist wird dieser mit goldenen Fußspuren markiert. Das SPiel hat eine Art 4 Achsen Bewegungssystem so das die Wege wie in vielen klassischen RPGs recht einfach gehalten sind und man sich nicht frei durch das ganze Bild bewegen kann.

[h1]Das Kampfsystem[/h1]
Der Charakter kämpft automatisch ach ohne Spielereinfluss mit einem Hieb auf einen zufälligen Gegner, man kann jedoch die Kampfgeschwindigkeit stark erhöhen und einen Gegner fokusieren indem man ihn immer wieder anklickt oder die linke Maustaste auf ihm gedrückt hält. Jeder Gegner hat eine gewisse Anzahl an Herzen über dem Kopf welche man vernichten muss um ihn zu besiegen.

[h1]Die Fähigkeiten/Ausrüstung/Tränke/... [/h1]
Alle Fähigkeiten, Tränke usw sind im Spiel Karten wie bei einem Kartenspiel. Man kann sich im Spiel gesamt 10 karten Schnellslots freispielen in denen man Karten zur Benutzung ablegen kann. Hier muss man entscheiden welche denn alle Karten brauchen die gleichen Slots. Es gibt z.B Artefakte welche einem zusätzliche automatische Fähigkeiten geben wie den Gegner in Flammen zu setzen, ihn einzufrieren, bestimmte positive Gegnereffekte schneller zu durchbrechen und vieles mehr. Manche Karten wie Heiltrankkarten müssen aufgeladen werden und haben immer nur eine beschränkte nutzbarkeit z.B 4 nutzungen bevor man sie in der STadt wieder aufladen kann. Alle Karten haben 3 STufen, wenn man sie droppt haben sie Stufe 1, können aber mit Runenkarten auf Stufe 3 erhöht werden was ihre Wirkung verbessert aber auch ihre Kosten erhöht.

[h1]Die Gegner[/h1]
Die Gegner sind zahlreich und haben viele verschiedene Eigenschaften, Es gibt nah und Fernkämpfer, Magier und Physische gegner, Gegner die andere Gegner spawnen, Gegner mit Rüstungen und vieles mehr.

[h1]Die Bosse[/h1]
Es gibt in vielen Dungeons kleine Bosse welche mehrere Stufen besitzen, Ein Boss ist erkennbar da das Spiel vor dem Kampf eine kleine Animation zeigt in der sie den Boss anvisiert und zum anderen da am oberen mittleren Bildschirmrand eine Leiste erscheint mit mehreren Kugeln. Jede kugel zeigt eine ander Stufe an und zwischen den Kugeln ist ein hinweis darauf wie dieser zu ebsiegen ist. hier gibt es viele verschiedene varianten wie z.B das man eine bestimmte zeit in der nähe des Bosses überleben muss, Ihm die Herzen zerstören muss, seine Leibgare ausschalten muss, usw...
Wenn die gesamte Leiste ausgefüllt ist und die Leiste bei der letzten kugel mit dem Totenkopf ankommt ist der Boss besiegt.
Kleine und große Bosse funktionieren vom Hauptsystem gleich nur das die großen Bosse etwas schwerer sind. Die kleinen Bosse können ein oder mehrfach in einem Dungeon vorkommen, die großen Bosse kommen nur am Ende der 3 Kapitel vor und müssen zum Kapitelwechsel besiegt werden.

[h1]Das Levelsystem[/h1]
Durch Erfahrung levelt der Char nach und nach auf bis zu einem Maximallevel von 50, bei jedem Level kann man einen Punkt auf Leben oder Magie setzen und wird dadurch stärker. Zusätzlich evrlieren die Gegner 1 Herz vom Maximalleben und sind dadurch schwächer, was sozusagen simuliert das der CHarakter stärker wurde.
Bei Level 10,20,35 erreicht man einen neuen Rang was jedoch nur das Aussehen des Charakters verändert.

[h1]Spielmodis[/h1]
Es gibt 2 Spielmodis, Story und Freeplay, wobei der Freeplay Modus erst freigeschalten wird wenn man die Story abgeschlossen hat.

[h1]Die Helden[/h1]
Es gibt gesamt 3 Helden, den Krieger, den Magier und dden Bogenschützen. Momentan ist nur der Krieger spielbar.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
- Schöne papercut Grafik
- Keine Abstürze
- Schönes Spielsystem
- Viele anlehnungen an alte Klassiker wie z.B Diablo 1
- ca 8-10h Spielzeit pro Durchlauf
- Durch Freeplaymodus kanna uch nach der Story weitrgespielt werden
- Viele Möglichkeiten
- Mehrere Schwierigkeitsgrade
- Bosskämpfe

[h1]Neutrales[/h1]
- Viele Achievements
- Sammelkarten
- Controllerunterstützung
- Gute Ingame STatistiken

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Manchmal bleibt man zwischen monstern stecken und kommt kaum noch raus.
- Manchmal war ein Weg von einem gegner belegt wodurch man mit der Maus nicht rauskam aber mit der Tastatur noch rauslaufen konnte
- Gegner die übereinander stehen sind schwer zu töten da man nicht steuern kann welcher davon attackiert wird, besonders störend wenn diese noch Schild haben und man das vom Unteren nicht sieht.
- Teilweise sind Gegner schwerer als die Bosse, besonders im ENdteil des Spieles
- Die Großen bosse sind zu einfach

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Ein tolles Spiel das jedem Fan dieser Spielart gefallen würde, jedoch sollte sich ejder klar sein das es noch im EA ist und viele Funktionen wie Quests, weitere Helden, Sternensystem usw noch nicht fertig. Wer damit kein problem hat den kann ich es nur empfehlen, wer sich unsicher ist solte auf einen Sale warten

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-

25126650.review:
First off, this game has amazing potential, but there are some MAJOR control issues that need to be addressed before I can in good faiuth recommend this game. The attack and move functions are both mapped to left click (while right click has NO binding) this combined with really small hitboxes leads to CONSTANTLY (around 80% of the time for me) moving instead of attacking. This is especially frustrating since the clickable circle hitboxes under the enemies don't appear until AFTER you have clicked them. 

Secondly the "Force Stand Still" button is left shift (not space) and having it there when space is not mapped to anything either will leads to sore pinky fingers.

Other than that the game is great, a cool dungeon crawler with a twist that has some really cool ideas. But in it's current state it feels like a mobile game ported to steam, since all the controls seem to derive from touchscreens.
25126650.developer_response:
Hi! 

First of all, it's great that you like the game and think it has a potential, thanks for the kind words :-) 

If controls are annoying you then I bring good news - we just published an update that adds key mapping. We are also enlarging hit areas on monsters (by the way - you don't have to click circles under the monsters, but the monsters themselves) so hitting smaller monsters should be easier. You could also consider using WASD steering with disabled mouse movement - it eliminates misclick entirely). 

I hope this update will allow you to enjoy the game to the fullest - consider joining the community in the forums. We have a big thread on controls and how to improve them.  

Cheers,
Konstanty

25082323.review: Really enjoyed this game and can't wait to see what it is like when it gets a full release.

25073694.review:
Witam, 

Właśnie ukończyłem dostępną historę w Book of Demons. Oczywiście, gram dalej aby podnieść rangę bohatera i sklepać kilka szkielecich tyłków. Ale do brzegu. Zacznijmy od początku. 

Co mnie skłniło aby zakupić właśnie Book of Demons? 

Ponieważ niespodziewanie mam kilka tygodni wolnego czasu postanowiłem zakupić jakąś gre na zabicie czasu. BoD przyciągneło mnie nietuzinkową mechaniką gry jaką zauważyłem w gameplayach, niecodzienną grafiką oraz tym, że jest to gra Polskiego studia (notabene, którego siedziba leży może 1km od miejsca mojego zamieszkania :) ). 

Na początku uważałem, że 20 euro to ciut wygurowana cena jak za wczesny dostęp, rozważałem również wykupienie dostępu do wszystkich gier ( info na oficjalnej stronie studia ) stwierdziłem jednak, że okres oczekiwania na kolejne gry jest dosyć długi, co jest zupełnie zrozumiałe, więc skusiłem się na 20 euro. 

I nie zawiodłem się, chociaż... 

Prosta fabuła sprawia, że gracza trzyma przy brnięciu dalej raczej rozgrywka (chociaż filmik wieńczący historię przeczy temu i podsyca emocje ;). Po opanowaniu sterowania i ( czego nie sugeruje samouczek) przerzuceniu się na WASD + celowanie myszą ruszyłem do gry. 

Bardzo sposobał mi się motyw tarcz u przeciwników, oraz czego brakowało mi w innych podobnych tytułach ( hack and slash) blokowanie czarów przeciwnika. Często po wejściu do następnego poziomu szybka reakcja na rozpoczęcie zaklęcia wroga była kluczem do sukcesu. 
System kart również bardzo przypadł mi gustu, ale sądziłem, że z bosów oraz co trudniejszych poczwar będą wypadać rzadkie karty. Liczba kart nie jest powalająca a po przejściu około 85% ( mniej więcej ) historii chyba już żadnej karty nie znalazłem. Kwestia na pewno do rozwinięcia i rozbudowania talii. Ale oczywiście biorę pod uwagę,że jest to wersja wczęsny dostęp. 

Nie wiem czym kierowali się twórcy wymyślając stworkom złote serca. Mechanizm odczekiwania kilku chwil aby zranić znów potworka jest potężnie nudny i niepotrzebnie wydłużający rozgrywkę. Kilka razy zdarzało się, że cały poziom został wyczyszczony i biegało ( a raczej snuło się) kilku przeciwników ze złotymi serduszkami, na których zabicie przygotowałem sobie nawet gorącą herbatę... i zanim je ubiłem już dawno wystygła. Stracony czas. Zamiast tego można bardziej urozmaicić rogrywkę np. chowając różne przedmioty potrzebne do zejścia niżej. 

Mimo wersji wczesnego dostępu nie doświadczyłem praktycznie żadnego błędu technicznego, żadnych bugów, zacinających się potworków, nie działających portali itp. Raz przytrafiła mi się sytuacja, gdzie kasa, która wypadała z potworka spadała na schody, które prowadziły na poziom wyżej. Kliknięcie na nie prowadziło bohatera na inny lewel, a kasa jak leżała na schodach tak tam została. Uniemożliwiło mi to jedynie wyczyszczenie poziomu. Kolejnym drobnym ( a może tylko w mojej opinii ) niedociągnięciem ( ale nie natury technicznej ) wersji wczesny dostęp był drop run. Po ukończeniu historii na 33 poziomie bohatera w talii miałem ponad 30 run słońca i księżyca. Pozostałe dwa rodzaje były tak rzadkie, że nawet nie pamiętam jak sie nazywały. 

Udało mi się jednak awansować dwie karty na poziom *** dzięki czemu ( o ironio) pierwszą kartą czaru jaki udało mi się uzyskać (P.Uderzenie) przeszedłem całą rozgrywkę. Łącząc ją z artefaktami, które odpowiednia oddziaływują na rodzaje serc przeciwnika był to czar bardzo potężny, może nawet zbyt... ponieważ nie było potrzeby go zmieniać. 

Ostatnią sprawą jaka rzuciła mi się w oczy to śmierć. Tak, po śmierci trafimy kase i karty i aby je odzyskać należy wrócić do miejsca śmierci i podnieść zgubione przedmioty. Otóż nie do końca... Jest to czasami bardzo utrudnione, poprzez cała hordę przeciwników. Jest na to rozwiązanie. Otóż wracając z miasta do podziemi wystarczy wejść o poziom wyżej, już przez nas wyczyszczony. Od razu pojawiamy się w nim ze wszystkimi kartami i cała kasą, znajdujemy kapliczkę z maną, zdrowiem i możemy śmiało przejść do poziomu, w którym nas pokonali i walczyć dalej. 

Podsumowują, produkcja bardzo ciekawa, z niecodzienną mechaniką, która jak wyczytałem w innych rezenzjach, nie wszystkim przypadnie do gustu. Cały pomysł z "biblioteką gier" również bardzo ciekawy i na pewno rozwojowy. Ja osobiście z niecierpliwością czekam na kolejne odsłony Return 2 Games, a przecież warto również zwrócić uwagę na ten tytuł ze względu na to, że jest to Polskie studio a jak ostatnio możemy obserować jesteśmy w te klocko co raz lepsi. 

Pozdrawiam, 
Rafał

24999620.review:
I don't write reviews often, but because of the incredibly mixed feelings this game left me with I decided to write one anyway.

The technical:
First of all, this game doesn't support resolutions over 1920x1200. If you have a 1440p or higher resolution monitor, be aware of this. I also do not know if it supports aspect ratios other than 16:10 and 16:9. If you have an ultrawide monitor, I cannot guarantee they offer a suitable resolution.
At the bottom of this review is a link to the game's discussions where the developers say higher resolutions aren't coming in the future either. 

The good: 
The game itself feels pretty innovative and I really liked the card system for your skills, equipment and consumables. The dungeon size slider is also a nice touch. The art style is very nice as well. It has a little "Don't Starve" influence, with everything being made out of paper, but in its very own way. 

The bad:
Aside from the resolution problems mentioned under "The technical", the game suffers from immense swings in difficulty because of the procedural generation. Long corridors with archers can be a pain, as well as rooms being packed to the bring with monsters. This can be extra frustrating because monsters block your movement. Because you are "on rails" (can't walk off the paths) you do not have the freedom of movement to properly kite to deal with these packs. 

The verdict:
Before the problems under "the bad" are fixed, I'd recommend holding off on this one. It shows a lot of promise, but still needs a few changes before it's ready.



The discussion regarding resolution:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/449960/discussions/0/353915309349470505/

Specifically, they say that because the 2D graphics they use are not made for higher resolutions, they will not be able to support 1440p or over without redoing all their art assets.
24999620.developer_response:
Hello! 

I hope you will be glad to know that during the last few weeks we addressed problems from your "The bad" section :)

We removed most difficulty spikes during the last few weeks (it's still work in progress as we are adding new mechanics). 

Today we also added support for higher resolutions - if you pick higher than native resolution we handle the upscaling. 

Recently we also added WASD movement option, which allows for much finer control over movement and missile dodging. 

Also mouse controls got reworked and now hitting monsters is easier with less misclicks. 

Cheers!

24989973.review:
This game is quite unlike other games, it's fun, addictive and it has an interesting time managing/picking mechanics where you pick how long a dungeon should last and clear it based on how much available time you have in real life, basically, if you can only play 5-10 minutes then you can and still get good rewards (it has a special interface for it).

This is a game of early access done right where devs are very communicative and nice.

Graphics look amazing, sound reminds me of diablo 1 and diablo 2, the gameplay is innovative and fun as hell, replayability is infinite, overall i would give this game a 8.5/10 for now because some features are still in development but i think it will easily be 10/10 if the devs continue to pour their love and soul into it :)

24902857.review:
I initially bought this with the interest of having my 6 year old daughter watch along (or play if the difficulty matched her ability/interest), but ended up enjoying it on a much more personal level.  It has an excellent and well-polished presentation, with a user interface to match.  The pacing and method of tutorials is well done and consistently ramps you up for the gameplay mechanics as well as a deepening texture within the plot.  As the mechanics become more fully revealed, you begin to realize that the game is less of a hollow and cheap nerd-reference and more of a heart-felt homage to the pc-arpg genre. 

Initially it is noticed that this game obviously appeals to classic ARPG fans by replicating the plot and tone of the original Diablo.  At first, this seemed like a nostalgia-grab.  After the first 2 hours, though, I realized that this is a good approach not only for that reason but because it informs the player that it isn’t attempting to reinvent the genre, but rather tries to capture what made a game like the first Diablo so great and modernizes it in a stylized way.

Once I realized this, it made me much more excited at the apparent concept of ‘return 2 games’.  They will likely look to other successes like space shooters / Metroidvania / platformers / etc and have the same approach, which, if as focused as Book of Demons, will be very welcome additions.

Gameplay mechanics are quite fun, and makes you explore everything just to see what cool cards can you get. Music is also very nostalgic. And nostalgy is probably most important factor for me, I kinda felt like 10 years old me when i was playing diablo 1.

24844377.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bm9rchhNUaE
Więcej - http://www.youtube.com/user/midvith?sub_confirmation=1
[h1][b]Bardzo ciekawy projekt majacy łączyć w sobie 7 gier[/b][/h1]
Book of Demons to nazwa pierwszej księgi jaka znajduje się w projekcie Return 2 Games - czyli jakby "gry w grach" - w przyszłości mają się tu pojawić kolejne gry nawiązujące w humorystyczny sposób do klasyków sprzed wielu lat. Pierwsza z nich, Book of Demons nawiązuje do DIablo. Ogółem jest dobrze, pytanie tylko czy twórcy będą dodawać kolejne gry na zasadzie nowych DARMOWYCH aktualizacji czy pierdolną w formie DLC? To zdecyduje jak tę grę należy oceniać. Na razie Book of Demons jako pierwsza część wypada bardzo dobrze - "chodzona" mechanika, bardzo precyzyjna klikana zręcznościówka, system skilli, kart, ulepszeń, NPC i ciekawy system odpowiadający za to jak długo chcemy przechodzić podziemia. Sami ustalamy jaki stopień trudności i długość chcemy mieć - gra tworzy następnie losowe lochy i ustawia nam przeciwników. Szkoda też, że ta pierwsza księga jest w "wczesnym dostępie" - czyli twórcy nawet tej 1 z 7 jeszcze nie skończyli. 24715691.review:
Most well made early access game I've ever played.

Reminds me a lot of Hitman Go in how simplicity breeds complexity. An APRG that actually does things different, making simple combat much more complex without spreadsheeting %s but actually having lots of ways to interact during combat. 
If you want something more like Diablo 1 instead of Diablo 2, this is the closest I've seen in a long time. The card (skill/gear) system is great, the mana system is great, enemies are fun to fight, loot matters overall I'd say this is a damn well made Diablo "parody". I suppose you could call it a big mix of D1, D3 and legend of zelda.

Credentials: 10000000000 hours in D2, titan quest, PoE, torchlight 1&2, D3, grim dawn, all those other ARPGs that never actually got much attention.

Really surprised by these devs to be honest. Guess making casual puzzle games can actually teach you to make good new twists on other genres. Interested in what they do next, "book of aliens". X-com?


EDIT: having beaten the game and unlocked higher difficulties and freeplay, this is pretty sick. Needs more goals to reach for as I've already gotten all the cards I wanted maxed out, but I imagine these are a low priority for early access. Hope they look to add to that.

I have never seen a dev team more involved in the community in an EA game. It's almost worth supporting them on that point alone. I would consider it, but the fact that the game is so fresh and polished it's not even necessary. The game is worth the price already, even missing 2 classes and half of a skill system. It's a new take on ARPG, your character on rails, with card-based skills and upgrades. It sounded really simplistic at first but there is quite a bit of depth to the combat.

24694637.review:
My husband gave me a heads-up when he saw this game released as early access, and I haven't been disappointed!  

I totally dig the gameplay (it will scratch your dungeoncrawler itch).  The paper motif takes a little getting used to, and you're limited to moving where the paths in the game go (and mobs don't have this limitation), so fights take some planning, and the card system is deeper than it originally looked (it's a card system instead of the usual RPG skill tree), but I count all of those as positives.  It's worth playing with the combination of armor cards and active spell cards.  You can trade them pretty much on the fly, so if you get stuck on a level it's worth mixing and matching.   I love that there's a slider that lets you choose the dungeon size; sometimes I just don't have a ton of time to play, but I can still get my fix in with a smaller dungeon.

It's early release, but a lot smoother than I've seen with other early release games.  There are some tweaks they could work on: 
1/ difficulty in freeplay doesn't seem to scale up that much (currently in .
2/ I love completing a dungeon level, but sometimes loot and/or mobs are hidden or bugged, even when I've walked through repeatedly (seemed to happen more in story mode than freeplay mode).
3/ Some of the copious Steam achievements don't seem to sync (eg. warrior level 3 cards).

 I can't wait for the rogue and mage to be unlocked, and for more books to be released!  (Book of Demons is the first of seven games planned).  I definitely recommend picking this up!

24684450.review:
Book of Demons biete einen nostalgischen Blick zurück auf den Urvater aller Action RPG's Diablo.

Der Charakter bewegt sich wie auf Schienen durch ein zufallsgeneriertes Labyrinth und klickt mit der Maus Gegner tot.

Soweit so gut. Kennt man alles. 

Moment auf Schienen?????

Heißt: Es gibt Laufwege und auf diesen Laufwegen kann der Avatar Vor- und Zurück laufen.
Was doof klingt, spielt sich erst ungewohnt und etwas entäuschend. Kann man aber über die Kausale 
Herangehensweise hinwegsehen, bildet sich schnell der alte "nur noch einen Abschnitt" Sog der Vorlage.

Desweiteren gibt es ein Karten System. Bedeutet der Spieler findet Karten die er ausrüsten kann. Im laufe des Spiels 
kommt da ein ganzes Deck an Möglichkeiten zusammen, den Krieger nach der eigenen Spielweise zu konfigurieren.

Das dritte "Feature" oder in deutsch "Element was BoD hervorhebt ist ein Zeit Manager.
Am Anfang eines neuen Abschnittes fragt der Manager den Spieler:
"Wieviel Zeit hast Du Nun zur Verfügung?"
Basierend auf der angegebenen Zeitangabe wird der neue Abschnitt generiert.
Prima.
10 Minuten Zeit? Hier bitte
20 Minuten Zeit? Um so besser...
Prima Feature.

Da dass Spiel in Early Access ist sei angemerkt:
Es läuft Stabil, ausser ein paar Balance Problemen gab es keine "Game-Stopper-Bugs"

Gespielt auf:
Windows 10 Pro
MB Asus M5A78L-M/USB3
16 GB Crucial 2100 Mhz Dual Channel
AMD FX-8350
MSI GTX 960 2 GB VRAM
Onboard Sound
Games installed on an SCANDISK II SSD 480 GB
Nvidia 368.81 

Zu guter Letzt: 
Book of Demons ist Nostalgia Spiel Nummero Uno... Die Entwickler planen in den nächsten Jahren weitere 6 Klassiker mit ihrer "Auf Schienen" Technik wieder zum Leben zu erwecken. 
Das vorhandene Framework hat schon 6 weitere Platzhalter implementiert... 

Man(n)(Frau) darf gespannt sein.

24669641.review:
Страстный кликер, который по странному стечению обстоятельств, авторы называют Action RPG. Но которому не нужны все эти жанровые рамки, настолько он самодостаточен. Разве что новую мышку имейте под рукой, запуская игру.

Сюжет прост,и влетев в одно ухо, тут же превращается в зевок. ГГ, вернувшись из мрачных ебеней, осознаёт, что ебеня его просто так не оставят. Более того, сделали марчными и его родные ебеня. Поболтав с оставшимися в живых [strike]ебенятами[/strike] односельчанами, он выясняет, что мрачное зло, выбралось из [strike]винных[/strike] подвалов, стоящей на холме церкви. И прихватив [strike]саблю, бурку и велосипед[/strike] заточку, пивной бурдюк и свежие штаны отправляется в подземелья церкви спасать все сущее [spoiler]и не очень[/spoiler].

Подземелье - то самое классическое из первой Диаблы. Спиралью, по разному задизайненных комнат, уходящее вглубь холма под церковью. Полностью линейно и предсказуемо. Передвижение по которому осуществляется вдоль коридоров, как будто по рельсам, и исключительно тычком мышки. Никаких WASDов.
Экшон заключается в закликивании врагов вусмерть. Чем больше кликов, тем больше мертвых супостатов. Тут бы и закручиниться и впасть в запой с горя. Но не выйдет. Монстры и их алгоритмы поведения крайне разнообразны и не тупы. Они целенаправленно окружают героя, блокируют ему пути отхода, после чего закидывает его дотами яда и огня, обстреливают стрелами. Если же герой вырвался из окружения и пытается сделать ноги, ему в спину легко могут кинуть морозный фриз, лишая действия и спокойно добить. Или тут полно монстров, которые кастуют каменные/морозные глыбы с двух сторон от ГГ. Которые придётся разбивать прежде чем куда-то двигаться. Или полно мелких дохлых монстров, которые гибнут с одного тычка. Но умирая, взрываются, вешая на ГГ дот. Который суммируется от каждого убитого. Подло подлавливая манчкинскую душу игрока, радующегося легкому умерщвлению монстров. Но который через 10 секунд сам падает мертвый от действия стаков яда. Или есть монстры, при приближении к которым, телепортируются за спину игрока, слегка [strike]покусывая ему мочку уха[/strike] постреливая в него заклинаниями. ГГ бежит к монстру, бьёт его, тот делится на двух монстров поменьше и догонялки приобретают уже не томный характер, когда несколько вражин постоянно обстреливают тебя, телепортируясь. 
И таких примеров тут множество. Монстры великолепны и разнообразны. В игре есть шикарный бестиарий.
За лут  тут карты. Их надо выбивать из монстров, апгрейдить в деревне, подбирать сетап к каждому отдельному виду супостатов. Делятся по типу на: шмот, применяемые банки-склянки, заклинания. Золото, руны для апгрейда, коробочки с сюрпризами присутствуют.

Дизайн прост и прекрасен. А-ля "художественной души порывы, подняли с пола смятую цветную бумагу, и по пути в Гималаи для преподавания уроков самосовершенствования,  свернули из неё весь мир игры".  Милый бумажный дьяволенок, хорошенький плоский скорпиончик плюющийся кислотой, а это наш бравый вояка в плоском бумажном шлеме. Жаль что эффекты заклинаний не осилили в той же стилистике, они обычные. При всем при этом, моментально и без каких либо сомнений вспоминается атмосфера первой Диабло. 

В итоге hack&slash игра (которую я бы назвал "Click and click and more more clicks") в раннем доступе даёт сто очков вперёд многим аналогичным играм, уже вышедшим. Играть (кликать) в нее интересно. Разве что, на данный момент единственное подземелье маловато, часов на 10. Ну да эти 10 часов были чистым удовольствием для меня.

24665416.review:
Great game. I personally love the art style, but the real selling point for me are things that deviate from the current Diablo 3 style of hack and slash game, that annoy me.

1) Equipment and abilities. Rather than collecting gear and going for a cookie cutter "optimal build" you collect cards, with the intention of being able to switch them around with at whim. This means you do not suffer from tedious inventory/stash issues, and can change your build on the fly to deal with whatever you encounter along the way. You have to balance your resources between passive "equipment" type cards and active abilities/items with on use properties.

2) Mousing over collection of basic resources. Seriously, how long have people asked in D3 to not have to click on materials to pick them up? Here you can just mouse over gold, and whilst you have to click other items you find, they are more sparse and therefore a lot less annoying to pick up.

3) Mechanics. Don't stand in the shit on the ground, pull carefully, interrupt casters, and dodge missiles. Thus far missiles have been dodgeable since you get an indicator of where they will hit allowing you to sidestep. Pretty much everything frustrating that is encountered in this game has an answer in the cards. 

4) Restrained use of visual effects. If you're like me, you get super tired of incessant, flashy, pixel vomit explosions. This game uses visual effects sparingly which allows you to more easily see where e.g. ranged mobs are shooting from, where missiles will hit, and nasty stuff that you don't want to be standing in.

TL;DR - if you liked classic games that weren't just mindless spamming of noisy/flashy spell effects, then give this one a shot.

[h1] Ein Hack n' Slay fan sollte das nicht verpassen! [/h1]

Ja es ist eine schamlose kopie von diablo 1 - was nicht unbedingt schlecht sein muss denn es ist ne gute kopie - aber nur das was die story, die Umgebung oder die bosse angeht. Alles andere ist echt einzigartig!!!

Der gesamte loot besteht so zu sagen nur aus karten! Es gibt karten für skills, verbrauchsgegenstaende und Equipment!

Auch wenn es nach pappe aussieht, sich wie pappe spielt und aus pappe besteht... ist es doch qualitative pappe! Auch wenn es mit kisten zerstampfen und zombies plaetten anfaengt... glaubt mir die "kacke" faengt spaeter richtig an zu dampfen!!!

Im moment ist nur ein buch spielbar (es wird 7 bücher geben). Ich habe 9 stunden gebraucht für den ersten durchlauf. Nachdem mann den endboss besiegt schaltet man das Freeplay frei! Kann man sich so vorstellen wie ein "new game +" wo man höhere schwierigkeitsgrade freischaltet usw...
Mehr will ich auch nicht drum rum erzaehlen, hier die pros und contras!

Pro:
- Einzigartiges artstyle
- Bis jetzt wenig bugs entdeckt (devs reagieren sehr schnell auf reports)
- Sehr viel potential
- Viele unterschiedliche Monster
- Einfaches UI

- Viele Möglichkeiten sein "deck" zu gestalten

- Jetzt schon ne bessere atmosphaere als diablo 3 ^^

- WASD steuerung implementiert
- Haufenweise Achievements
